speaker: Chrom
text: I'd like to believe it's our cunning that got us this far without being spotted... But we've seen far too little of the Plegian Guard. Where are they? Whatever trap Gangrel has planned, he is in no hurry to spring it.

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, our scouts report some manner of engagement downfield.

speaker: Chrom
text: Understood. Get everyone ready to move.

speaker: Frederick
text: These desert sands are certain to bog down our units, milord. Only mages and fliers will likely be able to proceed unhindered.

speaker: Chrom
text: Good point. I'll keep it in mind. Robin, let's discuss strategy.

speaker: Nowi
text: *Huff, huff* Have... Have I lost him?

speaker: Gregor
text: Wait, I say! Why you no comprehending, wee one?

speaker: Nowi
text: AUGH! GET AWAY! Everyone just leave me ALONE!

speaker: Gregor
text: Please, be keeping down with the voice! You give away position! Very bad!

speaker: Nowi
text: My throat is dry, my shoes are full of sand, and some big weirdo is trying to KILL ME!

speaker: Gregor
text: Oy, you break Gregor's heart! Why you treat like villain?

speaker: Chrom
text: You there! Fiend! Keep your hands off that maiden!

speaker: Gregor
text: Who is fiend? ...You mean Gregor? No, friend! You have idea wrong!

speaker: Lissa
text: Yeah, right! ...Creep!

speaker: Gregor
text: This day has been nothing but insults and punches to groin. And all for doing good deed! ...Listen, friend! Gregor only want to—

speaker: Chalard
text: Gotcha, you slippery scamp! Prepare for a dose of Grima's wrath.

speaker: Gregor
text: Oy, this is most terrible! Do you see now? They make with the catching of us!

speaker: Chrom
text: Why are you all after the girl?

speaker: Gregor
text: All? What is this "all"? Gregor is not one of "all"! Look close! Maybe you not see from so far? Gregor have innocent-baby face!

speaker: Chrom
text: Hmm…

speaker: Lissa
text: Well…

speaker: Robin
text: Yeah... Not sure "innocent baby" is how I'd describe it…

speaker: Gregor
text: Gah! Never be minding! Gregor is not enemy! You must believe!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...This is making my head hurt. We'll sort him out later. Right now, we need to protect the girl.

speaker: Nowi
text: Y-you're going to help me?

speaker: Chrom
text: We'll do everything in our power to keep you safe. Just hold on until we can reach you, and we'll drive them off!

speaker: Chrom
text: We need to warn these villages of the danger. But who to send? Best if it's someone who can move swiftly through the sands...

speaker: Nowi
text: GET AWAY FROM ME!

speaker: Robin
text: What in blazes?! The girl is a dragon!

speaker: Chrom
text: By the gods, she's a manakete... I never thought I'd see one.

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm... Perhaps she doesn't need our help so much as we could use hers...

speaker: Nowi
text: Nngh... That h-hurts! I have to get to...safety...

speaker: Chalard
text: Ha ha! You dare defy Grima, god of annihilation?

speaker: Chalard
text: Master Grima...my life force...is yours...

speaker: Elder
text: Gods praise ye, good people! Gods praise ye one and all! We lives in constant fear of what the Grimleal will do to us, so we does! 'Ere! Take this staff with me blessings! It can fetch distant comrades to safety. Be sure to place it in the hands o' one gifted in spells or the like. Magic folk be able to reach the farthest with it!

speaker: Villager
text: You have our thanks for the warning. Please, take this. It's my family's treasure. I would offer more, if only I could. A fellow with enough experience could use it to grow even stronger.

speaker: Maiden
text: Really? You'll protect the village? ...This little dung heap? Goodness, you're kind! I suppose I should give you a little something, eh? ...Here. Someone with enough experience could use this to start a new life. It's like running off to join a circus troupe! ...But more classy-like.

speaker: Nowi
text: This is just the worst. Day. EVER! *sob!*

speaker: Gregor
text: Ho now, wee one! Do not make with the crying of tears. The evil people are now dead people. This is good, no?

speaker: Nowi
text: You... You're right. Th-thank you. And... I'm sorry I was so mean to you earlier. I just get nervous around people who are...outside my age group.

speaker: Gregor
text: Your age group? Ha! Gregor much closer to your age than others here!

speaker: Chrom
text: Say, um...Gregor, was it? Gregor, do you mind looking after her? We need to press on.

speaker: Gregor
text: Mmm... Gregor is mercenary, yes? Maybe you hire Gregor instead. True, Gregor just finish killing former employers, but still very reliable! So long as you not try to hurt little girl, Gregor will not hurt you. Also, Gregor need steady income. ...Many angry former employers.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're a sellsword?

speaker: Gregor
text: Yes! Very swell sword! Cost performance very high. You have Gregor's word.

speaker: Chrom
text: Sure, why not? You're hired.

speaker: Nowi
text: But! But what about me?! I WON'T go back on the auction block!

speaker: Lissa
text: Wait. You've been sold? Like a...like a slave?!

speaker: Nowi
text: To men more despicable than you can possibly imagine. They made me transform for them... They drank and laughed and called out tricks…

speaker: Lissa
text: What kind of scumbags buy and sell a little girl?! Even if she CAN turn into a dragon…

speaker: Frederick
text: She may be little, milady, but not nearly so young as you might think. Manaketes live a very long time.

speaker: Lissa
text: Really? ...How old are you?

speaker: Nowi
text: Oh, I dunno. ...A thousand...something? But look! No wrinkles!

speaker: Frederick
text: The dragonkin are said to be more resilient than men. Nowi would make a strong ally. Besides, we cannot risk her falling back into the hands of the Grimleal.

speaker: Robin
text: Beg pardon, but who are the Grimleal?

speaker: Frederick
text: Followers of the fell dragon, Grima. The selfsame dragon the first exalt defeated a thousand years ago. Even today there are some who yearn for the fiend's return.

speaker: Robin
text: I...see.

speaker: Flavia
text: Well, shall we get some rest? We're almost to the Plegian capital. We'll need all our strength, soon enough…

speaker: Chrom
text: Origin Peak...

speaker: Naga
text: The fell dragon is indeed here. Remember, Awakener! The power I gave you cannot destroy Grima.

speaker: Robin
text: It can only put him back to sleep...

speaker: Naga
text: Correct, Fellblood.

speaker: Robin
text: So you know of my lineage?

speaker: Naga
text: You possess power not so different from my own.

speaker: Chrom
text: We must find some way to break this unholy cycle! We can't just keep putting Grima back to sleep every few centuries. Otherwise we merely will his vengeance on our descendants.

speaker: Robin
text: ...I may know a way.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, Robin? You have some strategy?

speaker: Robin
text: The other me claimed the dragon and I were the same, yes? If I strike the final blow, he'd be killed by his own hand...

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! Ingenious! Naga? Will it work?

speaker: Naga
text: ...Perhaps. But there would be consequences. Grima's heart and Robin's are inexorably linked. Dragon and man/woman can no longer be separated. Therefore, slaying Grima would also cause the end of Robin's life.

speaker: Robin
text: ...I realize that. I am ready.

speaker: Naga
text: There is...a chance you could survive, but it is small indeed. You have bound your heart to those of many others in this world.

speaker: Robin
text: If those ties prove strong enough, they may yet keep you in this reality. But I would not give you false hope. The chance you would live is insignificant. In truth, you will almost certainly cease to exist.

speaker: Robin
text: If those bonds prove strong enough, they may yet keep you in this reality. However, not even a thousand human friendships surpass the dragon's grip. In truth, you will almost certainly cease to exist.

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin would cease to be?! No. We'll find another way.

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, wait. You're not thinking clearly. Think about what your sister would have wanted.

speaker: Chrom
text: Emmeryn would never have asked you to do this!

speaker: Robin
text: What is one life, when weighed against millions?

speaker: Chrom
text: Stop it! You're one of us. You'll ALWAYS be one of us. There has to be another way. We just have to find it. Promise me, Robin. Promise me you won't do this!

speaker: Robin
text: You have been so very kind to me, Chrom, always... But this is my decision.

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin...

speaker: Robin
text: ...You're right, Chrom. I'm sorry.

speaker: Chrom
text: We swore to stand by each other, remember? We're two halves of a whole... Not even a dragon can sever us!

speaker: Naga
text: The time for deliberation is over, Awakener. The Grimleal have found us.

speaker: Lucina
text: Father! We're under attack!

speaker: Aversa
text: Really, now—still at your little schemes? Butchering Validar wasn't enough? Do you SEE what your great struggle has won you?! ...NOTHING! Master Grima has returned! The world's fate is sealed! Or perhaps you simply seek a tender embrace here at the end? Hmm? I'm not completely cruel, you know. Come, I have a kiss for each of you...

speaker: Naga
text: Be swift, Awakener. Grima's servants will harry you to the very last. You must reach the dragon before it is too late.

speaker: Aversa
text: Murderers! You'll pay for taking Master Validar from me!

speaker: Aversa
text: Ahh...finally... Sweet...death... Finally...the pain... F-finally...it ends...

speaker: Lissa
text: Yikes! What was that?!

speaker: Lucina
text: The dragon's call!

speaker: Lucina
text: Grima!

speaker: Chrom
text: We can defeat him!

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, how does a man challenge a mountain?! Where would one even strike?!

speaker: Naga
text: The fell dragon has a weakness on the nape of his neck. But that weakness will be guarded by his servants. I can send you onto the dragon's back, but the rest is in your hands.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then please, milady, and quickly! We would ask no more of you. Everyone, gird yourselves! One way or another this ends here!

speaker: Lissa
text: Brrr! F-F-Frebberick! I'm f-f-freebing!

speaker: Frederick
text: Stand beside my horse, milady. She'll shelter you from the wind.

speaker: Robin
text: So this is the fortress?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, the Longfort. It stretches along the border of Ylisse and Regna Ferox.

speaker: Frederick
text: The khans that rule Ferox have grown quite wary of foreigners. Still, don't mistake a lack of hospitality for open hostility. This simply calls for a bit of diplomacy.

speaker: Chrom
text: Negotiation's not my strong suit, but I'll do my best. Remember, everyone: your actions here reflect back upon Ylisse.

speaker: Frederick
text: Trouble in the wind, milord: the Feroxi Guard are mobilizing.

speaker: Chrom
text: What?! Why?

speaker: Frederick
text: Who can say? But they look ready to let fly at a moment's notice. We'd best prepare for combat, just to be safe. Perhaps we ought pool our supplies and select which Shepherds to deploy? Loath as I am to trust him/her, Robin might offer some valuable insight in this…

speaker: Chrom
text: Indeed, he/she IS our tactician, after all. So, Robin? What do you suggest?

speaker: Raimi
text: Halt! Who goes there?!

speaker: Chrom
text: In the name of House Ylisse, I seek audience with the khans!

speaker: Raimi
text: Not another step, my bold lad! I've lancers at the ready!

speaker: Frederick
text: Hold, milady! We are not your enemy! Exalt Emmeryn herself sent us to discuss matters of mutual interest.

speaker: Raimi
text: My only interest is keeping you out of Regna Ferox, brigand!

speaker: Frederick
text: B-brigand? Now see here—

speaker: Raimi
text: You think you are the first "Ylisseans" to try and cross our border? I have the authority to fell such imposters where they stand.

speaker: Frederick
text: How dare you! You are in the presence of Prince Chrom, the exalt's own blood!

speaker: Raimi
text: Ha! Yes, indeed—and I'm the queen of Valm! You do realize impersonating royalty is a capital offense, yes? Mmm... Then perhaps we should settle this the Feroxi way. You claim to be the prince of Ylisse? Then prove it on the battlefield!

speaker: Chrom
text: Rgh... Emmeryn won't like this at all... Please, good lady! If you'd just listen—

speaker: Raimi
text: I've heard quite enough! Attack!

speaker: Chrom
text: Sumia...?

speaker: Sumia
text: Better hold on tight, Captain. Could get bumpy.

speaker: Chrom
text: Uh...right.

speaker: Sumia
text: You'll be fine.

speaker: Chrom
text: Sumia!

speaker: Sumia
text: Right!

speaker: Sumia
text: Oh, Captain, I'm so relieved I made it in time.

speaker: Chrom
text: That goes double for me, Sumia! And this—is this the same ornery pegasus we met on the road?!

speaker: Sumia
text: Oh, she's a sweetheart, isn't she? ...Once you really get to know her…

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, many thanks to you both.

speaker: Lissa
text: I think the pegasus is blushing!

speaker: Frederick
text: And I think we had all best focus on the situation at hand!

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, they're coming!

speaker: Chrom
text: All right. The Feroxi way it is!

speaker: Sumia
text: Phila said pegasi can fly far afield, but they're highly vulnerable to arrows. Don't worry, girl. I'll watch out for archers for both our sakes!

speaker: Chrom
text: Why do I feel like I'm being watched...?
Um, sir? ...Sir! Right here, sir!

speaker: Chrom
text: Who's there? Show yourself!

speaker: Kellam
text: I'm standing in plain sight, sir. Right he—

speaker: Chrom
text: BWAAAH! Oh! I-is that you, Kellam? When did you arrive?

speaker: Kellam
text: ...The same time as you. I've been with you all along. Er, I AM still a Shepherd, right? It's quite the honor, after all. I'd hate to lose it. Sometimes I—

speaker: Chrom
text: Of course, Kellam. Forgive me. You're just so...quiet, I completely—

speaker: Kellam
text: Quite all right, sir, quite all right. I've been told I'm easy to miss.

speaker: Chrom
text: At least the Feroxi didn't find you.

speaker: Kellam
text: I've been calling to you and waving my arms for several minutes... I don't think they've so much as glanced this way.

speaker: Chrom
text: You almost sound disappointed.

speaker: Kellam
text: Well, I just... I'm glad you finally saw me! Just try to keep an eye out from now on?

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm…

speaker: Chrom
text: What is it, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: I've been thinking about how you rode with Sumia earlier... Do our unit always have to fight one-on-one?

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you suggesting we pair up? That's an interesting thought... I admit, I'd resemble a pincushion right now if it weren't for Sumia and her mount.

speaker: Robin
text: Exactly. By pairing up, units could lend each other added offense and defense... It might also allow quicker soldiers to ferry slower units great distances... Yes... Yes! I'm sure of it. This opens up all sorts of strategic possibilities! We should try it whenever the opportunity presents itself.

speaker: Kellam
text: *Sigh* Do they STILL not see me? Perhaps Chrom will talk to me if I...wave my...hands around...

speaker: Chrom
text: It already feels as though Robin has been a Shepherd forever. It's funny how fighting alongside someone speeds friendships along... And the more we fight side by side, the more valuable those friendships become!

speaker: Frederick
text: A key! We can use it to open the fortress doors.

speaker: Raimi
text: Let our battle sound out the truth of your words!

speaker: Raimi
text: Then your claims were...true...

speaker: Raimi
text: A thousand apologies, Prince Chrom. I truly took you for brigand impostors. But no frauds could ever wage a battle as you just have! I will send word of your arrival to the capital and escort you there personally.

speaker: Chrom
text: That would be most appreciated, thank you.

speaker: Robin
text: Amazing. Her whole demeanor changed.

speaker: Frederick
text: In Ferox, strength speaks louder than words. I should have known better than to overestimate the value of diplomacy here…

speaker: Lissa
text: So can we get going, Chrom?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, it's not getting any warmer.

speaker: Flavia
text: Damn! Look at those walls... This isn't going to be easy.

speaker: Basilio
text: It's not the walls I'm worried about—it's the hordes of Valmese inside them.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Our best bet is a swift, surgical strike, right at their heart. If we can strike down their commander, the fortress will be ours. So—Khan Flavia, your men will take on the forces surrounded the castle. That should create an opening for a smaller team led by Chrom and I. ...I regret to say this will put you at the forefront of the battle, Sir Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: I wouldn't have it any other way.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Then it's settled. Other Resistance forces are on the way. With luck, they'll arrive in time to help. Let's cleave them a proud trail of imperial blood to find us by!

speaker: Pheros
text: Hmph. Such arrogance... They truly mean to assault Steiger in such meager numbers? Perhaps they expect a woman's garrison to be a softer target,.. Heh, when I'm through, they'll wish they'd challenged Yen'fay instead. Battle stations!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Sir Chrom—I hear movement from the floor below. It may be reinforcements. Be wary...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Our comrades! But wait, how...

speaker: Chrom
text: The Resistance had already infiltrated the castle...?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Nay, impossible! Something is amiss...

speaker: Excellus
text: Oooh, it appears I'm just in time for the Rebellion reunion! Delicious... Please, do give your "friends" your warmest welcome. Just remember your promise...or you can be sure I will remember mine.

speaker: Chrom
text: Say'ri... Are you certain their reinforcements are from the Resistance?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, sir, I'm ashamed to say I am. I know some of them by name. ...B-but why would they turn cloak against us now?!

speaker: Excellus
text: Oooh, it seems we've touched a nerve! I do so enjoy inappropriate touching... Now be good little servants and scrub the stronghold of these Ylissean filth.

speaker: Pheros
text: What is this meddling, Excellus?!

speaker: Excellus
text: ..."Meddling"? Why, General Pheros, one might almost mistake you for ungrateful. This "meddling" is going to save your post, and quite possibly your life...

speaker: Pheros
text: We've no need of your parlor tricks here, schemer! I can handle this myself.

speaker: Excellus
text: Why yes, of course you can, General! I can see you're doing SO well already. You're obviously just...waiting to crush the Ylisseans? Toying with them, like a cat! I only brought these rebels so they might learn from your shining example! They were so anxious to join the cause...

speaker: Pheros
text: Because you threatened them? Tortured them? ...Or perhaps their families? Their villages?

speaker: Excellus
text: *Ahem* ...I would not wish to burden you with such mundane details, good General. You have more important matters to think after, and to deal with...quickly. But rest assured they are QUITE motivated. Feel free to thank me some other time!

speaker: Pheros
text: Odious freak... He has no honor. Just the sight of him makes me sick. He is the worm, yet I'm the one left squirming... Bah. ...True, his interference may seal our victory...but he'll never hear me say it.

speaker: Soldier
text: General! Sir Excellus is here to see you.

speaker: Excellus
text: Good day to you, General. You look ravishing, as always.

speaker: Pheros
text: Why are you here, trickster?

speaker: Excellus
text: Trickster? Why General, it's almost as if you aren't happy to see me! And after I came all this way to help you... I brought friends, you know. Well... perhaps "friends" isn't the word... But they will fight for you all the same.

speaker: Pheros
text: You brought rebels into my stronghold?! Why would they fight their own kind? Unless... You threatened them? Tortured them? ...Or perhaps their families? Their villages?

speaker: Excellus
text: *Ahem* ...I would not wish to burden you with such mundane details, good General. You have more important matters to think after, and to deal with...quickly. But rest assured they are QUITE motivated. Feel free to thank me some other time!

speaker: Pheros
text: Odious freak... He has no honor. Just the sight of him makes me sick. He is the worm, yet I'm the one left squirming... Bah. ...True, his interference may seal our victory...but he'll never hear me say it.

speaker: Pheros
text: In the name of the Conqueror, you shall not take this fortress!

speaker: Pheros
text: Nngh... Well done... I may not live...to see Walhart unify all mankind...with my own eyes... But I have seen it...in my dreams... And that is enough...

speaker: Pheros
text: Then you'd be Prince Chrom... Once, I followed your exalted sister, you know. Made the pilgrimage all the way to Ylisstol, just to hear her speak. I, too, grew up worshiping Naga and the Earth Mother.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Yet you abandoned your faith.

speaker: Pheros
text: I have no use for invisible spirits any longer. I serve a god among men now. Emperor Walhart will do what no religion ever could—unite all people.

speaker: Chrom
text: Your naivete betrays you. Think about it: who willingly follows a tyrant?

speaker: Pheros
text: Thinking plays no part in it. In words and deeds, a great leader takes hold of the heart, not the mind. I remember your sister possessing that selfsame gift for inspiring others. Doubtless many still cling to the power of her poetry. But I have found a greater voice...

speaker: Chrom
text: My sister believed we all desire the same thing: peace. If Walhart holds such promise, why must he use violence to unite the people?

speaker: Pheros
text: Now who is being naive, good Prince? Sometimes those who will not walk must be dragged along or pushed aside. So raise your sword, Chrom of Ylisse, and prepare to be pushed aside.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Steiger has fallen. ...But I'm afraid our new enemy has the fortress surrounded.

speaker: Chrom
text: New enemy... You mean the rest of the former Resistance?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, sir. Words cannot express my shame. My...regret... Finally, I succeed in uniting them...but only against us.

speaker: Soldier
text: Milord! Dire news! Our forces to the north and south have been decimated by Walhart and Yen'fay! What's worse, most of the survivors have turned their coats for the empire!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: B-but our troops numbered in the hundreds of thousands!

speaker: Basilio
text: The empire must have had more.

speaker: Flavia
text: Or perhaps have been better trained and equipped...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Blast! Walhart and my brother—where are their armies now?

speaker: Soldier
text: Marching toward this fortress, milady. It's only a matter of time.

speaker: Basilio
text: So much for fortune favoring the bold. This war was lost before it even began.

speaker: Chrom
text: All our struggles until now, and we've yet to so much as dent the empire...

speaker: Robin
text: ...Chrom?

speaker: Chrom
text: What is it, Robin? Do you have something to say?

speaker: Robin
text: We need to leave here—right away.

speaker: Flavia
text: Have you lost your wits? We're surrounded!

speaker: Robin
text: When the other armies arrive, then we'll be trapped for a certainty. If we intend to escape, now is our best chance.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: He/She's right. The dynasts outside betray us only out of fear for the empire. They'll only put up token resistance without their masters watching.

speaker: Chrom
text: But we can't keep running forever. How do we hope to turn the tide?

speaker: Robin
text: By striking at either Walhart or Yen'fay before they join strength.

speaker: Chrom
text: Either one seems a death sentence.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: One general would be upon us before we could finish with the other.

speaker: Robin
text: I agree...which is why we attack both.

speaker: Flavia
text: Our army lies in tatters, yet you would divide it by half?!

speaker: Robin
text: ...I didn't say by half. Chrom would lead our strongest troops against Yen'fay. Meanwhile, a smaller force could attack Walhart.

speaker: Basilio
text: A SMALLER force? We couldn't defeat him with double our entire number.

speaker: Robin
text: ...I didn't say we'd defeat him. We only need to distract him.

speaker: Basilio
text: Hmm... Spend some lives to buy the other team time...

speaker: Chrom
text: This smaller force would face our most dangerous mission yet. It would need a leader of unparalleled skill, reckless bravery...

speaker: Basilio
text: All right, Chrom, please—you're embarrassing me! I'll do it already—just stop with all the compliments!

speaker: Robin
text: This is no time for japes, Basilio. The stakes could not be higher.

speaker: Basilio
text: I am being serious—I'll lead the squad. Though I prefer my steaks well done...

speaker: Flavia
text: That's just his way, Robin. Bad jokes come with the bravado. But the oaf clearly has faith in your thinking. And I as well... All of us do, I'd wager. Somehow you always find a way to best the odds.

speaker: Basilio
text: Then it's settled. I'll make preparations and be off. The rest of you stay with Chrom and keep him safe.

speaker: Robin
text: Godspeed, Basilio.

speaker: Lucina
text: Stop!

speaker: Chrom
text: Lucina? What are you—

speaker: Lucina
text: I cannot allow you to go, Khan Basilio. You will die in this battle. I know it for truth!

speaker: Chrom
text: What?

speaker: Basilio
text: You know, lass, you have a strange way of saying good-bye. All right, then. Who is it? Who kills me? Is it Walhart himself? ...Please say yes. It'd make a poor song to die at the end of some farmer's pitchfork.

speaker: Lucina
text: ...Yes, it was Walhart. Or so goes the story I heard. We must change our plans so fate cannot take this course!

speaker: Basilio
text: All I needed to know. Thank you much, lass. ...I'll be careful.

speaker: Lucina
text: Y-you're still going? But I just told you—

speaker: Basilio
text: Aye, I heard you just fine. But someone still has to stall his division from advancing. If he's the one that kills me, well then, I'll just avoid confronting him. You don't grow this old and handsome without knowing how to avoid trouble.

speaker: Lucina
text: N-no! It's never that simple.

speaker: Flavia
text: Don't worry, love, he'll be fine. He'll have me to keep an eye on him.

speaker: Basilio
text: You aren't coming, woman! You're the reigning khan!

speaker: Flavia
text: I thought you intended to survive this, oaf. Regna Ferox has two khans, and now you're responsible for both. I dare you to die now!

speaker: Basilio
text: ...Har! Aha ha ha! All right, all right. You can come. ...Hope that's all right, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: Just look after each other.

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha! I'll bring this big ox back on a leash if it comes to that.

speaker: Basilio
text: Luck and more be with you all. We'll meet again soon.

speaker: Lucina
text: But please, your future! You must—

speaker: Basilio
text: Please, yourself! not another word. I fully intend to outlive all you sprogs—just see if I don't. And as for your "future," it can kiss my big brown Feroxi arse!

speaker: Basilio
text: Fall back and form up! Don't let them scatter us!

speaker: Flavia
text: Rrgh! Easier said than done... Their cavalry is riding right over us!

speaker: Basilio
text: We can hold our ground... I'll show you how a real Feroxi fights, woman!

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha! Did I hear a crack in your voice? Is that fear in your eye?

speaker: Basilio
text: Gah! Never! Let's give these kettleheads a taste of our barbarian roots!

speaker: Flavia
text: Now THAT'S the oaf I love! ...Huh? Enemy soldiers, there—

speaker: Basilio
text: They're swatting our troops like flies!

speaker: Flavia
text: Is it some kind of elite cavalry? No, wait... Gods! It's just one man!

speaker: Walhart
text: YOU THERE! Do you command these forces?

speaker: Basilio
text: Awww, crap!

speaker: Basilio
text: Haaarrrgh... Such...strength... Is he even human...

speaker: Walhart
text: ...Impressive. You're the first since Yen'fay to survive beyond a single stroke.

speaker: Basilio
text: I d-don't... I don't stand a chance... Flavia! Everyone! Run! Run for your lives!

speaker: Flavia
text: I'm not leaving you here!

speaker: Basilio
text: He's a demon, woman... I can only keep him...busy while you...escape... Hngh! ...D-damn... Looks like the lass was right...

speaker: Flavia
text: I think not! I'm here, and that means events can be changed! Damn you, oaf! You're not getting away from me that easily!

speaker: Flavia
text: Basilio!

speaker: Basilio
text: Nngh... Flavia... Give this to Chrom...

speaker: Flavia
text: Is this...the Gemstone?!

speaker: Basilio
text: You have to...survive... G-give it to him...

speaker: Flavia
text: Give it to him yourself, you one-eyed clod of a man! I'm not going anywhere and neither are you!

speaker: Basilio
text: Fool woman! I'm f-finished... Don't let it...be for nothing... For once in your life...just do what I say... Go! Go, gods damn you! GOOOOOO!

speaker: Flavia
text: BASILIO!

speaker: Lissa
text: It's beautiful...

speaker: Lucina
text: The divine dragon's power flows through every blade of grass here.

speaker: Chrom
text: Wait... Something doesn't feel right.

speaker: Robin
text: Nngh... We must prepare for battle! Grima has sent servants here. I can sense it. They'll be on us soon!

speaker: Lucina
text: How could Risen infiltrate this sacred place?

speaker: Chrom
text: Their power must be linked to Grima's. We must destroy them!

speaker: Chrom
text: We've made it—the altar. Wait here... I'll be back.

speaker: Lissa
text: Be careful, Chrom...

speaker: Lucina
text: We must believe in him, Aunt Lissa.

speaker: Chrom
text: Hear me, Naga! I bear proof of our sacred covenant! In the name of the exalted blood, I ask for the divine dragon's power! Baptize me in fire, that I may become your true son!

speaker: Chrom
text: Hrrraaagh!

speaker: Lucina
text: Father!

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm... I'm all right!

speaker: Naga
text: Be welcome, Awakener. Your heart has been tested and deemed worthy. Cleansed in my fire, your desire has proven to be the stronger.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then you will grant me the power to defeat Grima? ...The power of a god?

speaker: Naga
text: Yes. But know this: I am no god.

speaker: Lucina
text: But milady, you are the divine dragon!

speaker: Naga
text: So do sons of man name me. But I am no creator. I possess not the powers of making or unmaking. And neither does Grima. Neither of us bears the power to destroy the other utterly.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then what power can you grant me?

speaker: Naga
text: With my blessing, thou may draw forth Falchion's true might. The blade of the exalts shall again strike like the dragon's fang. Your strength will then be my equal.

speaker: Chrom
text: But not strong enough to destroy Grima?

speaker: Naga
text: Alas, Grima cannot be slain. Sleep alone can be your victory. Just as your ancestor put the fell dragon to sleep a millennium ago. But you must weaken him first. Only as the final blow can my power be used to bind his.

speaker: Lissa
text: Isn't there ANY way to destroy him for good?

speaker: Naga
text: There is, perchance, a power that could end Grima. However... 'Twould be his own.

speaker: Frederick
text: ...He has to kill himself?

speaker: Naga
text: Yes. And never would he do so of his own volition. He seeks only to add to his power, and set ruin upon the world. Now come. There is little time...

speaker: Chrom
text: Where is Grima now?

speaker: Naga
text: To the west lies a volcano known as Origin Peak. You shall find the fell dragon there.

speaker: Dalton
text: You dare board our ship, worm? I'll not discuss terms with a peasant; I will issue demands to all! Citizens! Soldiers! Hear my words! The Conqueror himself, Emperor Walhart, claims dominion over these lands! You will grant your new emperor your ships! You will grant him all your provender! You will grant him your loyalty and your every possession! And you will surrender this land's greatest treasure, the Fire Emblem! Do this, and your lives will be spared. Resist, and your lives are forfeit! Now, kneel! And swear fealty to the mighty Valmese Empire!

speaker: Villager
text: B-but if you take all that we have, how are we to make our living? Without food and ships, people will starve! Would you have us all die?

speaker: Dalton
text: ...You'll do for now.

speaker: Villager
text: Hrrgh!

speaker: Chrom
text: These savages will never listen to reason. Everyone: prepare to engage!

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, are you certain? Another war...

speaker: Chrom
text: I've had time to ponder Ylisse's place in the world, Frederick. ...And my own. We must stand against evil, in all its forms, or there can be no peace!

speaker: Cherche
text: Might I join, sire? This may not be my country, but it is my cause. My dear Minerva here hungers for a bite of the action as well!

speaker: Dalton
text: You are nothing! A speck of sand on the boot of the great empire!

speaker: Dalton
text: What... H-how... Ahh...

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, is that all of them?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, but victory's come with a price...

speaker: Basilio
text: The town is in shambles, as is my army.

speaker: Frederick
text: This is most troubling news. Feroxi soldiers are the finest east of the long sea. If they are having trouble, we are ALL in trouble.

speaker: Flavia
text: That's not the half of it. This was just the vanguard—but a taste of the meal yet to come.

speaker: Basilio
text: And once it arrives, their host will wash over the whole continent in a matter of weeks. There's no way we could repel them and defend our people. It would be a slaughter.

speaker: Chrom
text: Ylisse is no better equipped to handle an attack from the sea... Robin, what do you suggest?

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm... Their greatest strength is their cavalry, which puts us at a disadvantage... on land. But if we were to catch them at SEA...

speaker: Chrom
text: But how?! Ylisse has no warships, nor does Ferox.

speaker: Basilio
text: So we'd need aid from a kingdom that does...

speaker: Flavia
text: You have someplace in mind, oaf?

speaker: Basilio
text: Perhaps a land that borders the sea, with enough wealth to afford this campaign?

speaker: Robin
text: Plegia!

speaker: Chrom
text: No. Absolutely not. Out of the question.

speaker: Basilio
text: They have gold, boy! Countless ships! And more importantly, we have a fart's chance in the wind without them.

speaker: Flavia
text: The oaf is right. ...Crude, but right. There's only one path forward.

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, will you reconsider?

speaker: Chrom
text: ...... ...Very well. Send a messenger and request a summit immediately. Let us pray this new king is more reasonable than their last.

speaker: Robin
text: Indeed.

speaker: Flavia
text: You know, Robin... For your first time against Valmese forces, that was an impressive victory. You and Chrom have both grown quite adept. You should be proud.

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, we have word from Plegia. They have agreed to meet with us at their outpost on Carrion Isle. A poor venue should things go sour, as the island's name makes plain. But then I don't see we have much of a choice.

speaker: Chrom
text: Cautious as ever, Frederick the Wary. Don't worry. We'll get our ships. This threat hangs over all of us—Plegia as well. They must see that.

speaker: Chrom
text: *Sigh*

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom? What are you doing out so late?

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, hi, Robin. Just... dueling with some unpleasant thoughts... Tomorrow we march to Regna Ferox to request additional soldiers. But there's something you should know first. ...Not everything Gangrel said was a lie. The last exalt, my father, waged war on Plegia for many years. The violence... It was a brutal compaign, ending only with his death 15 years ago. Plegia rightfully remembers their suffering, but his war was no kinder to his own people. As the fighting dragged on, out army became more and more diminished. Farmers who could barely wield a pitchfork were conscripted and sent to their deaths. Soon there was no food at all, and the kingdom began to collapse. I was young, but I remember those dark times. ...I know how they affected Emmeryn.

speaker: Robin
text: Such an experience would change anyone.

speaker: Chrom
text: Indeed. When our father died before her 10th year, he left her quite the legacy... Plegia's desire for vengeance... Our own people's unbridled rage... My sister became a target for blame on all sides. Her own subjects began to hurl insults—and stones. She still bears the scar from one... But she never let them see her pain. Only Lissa and I understood.

speaker: Robin
text: It must have been so hard...

speaker: Chrom
text: I cannot claim to know how she does it, Robin. I could not greet such hostility with warmth and patience. While our people mocked and vilified her, she reached out and healed them. She brought soldiers home to their families. She ended the war. And when Ylisse's spirit was mended and the people "forgave" her? ...She never resented them for it. She represents the best part of the halidom—the part most worth protecting. She IS peace. But some men would take advantage of that. Men like King Gangrel. The day he understands peace will be the day death gives it to him. ...So perhaps I must be death's agent. Emmeryn would never order him killed, nor would I wish her to.

speaker: Marth
text: Well spoken, sir.

speaker: Chrom
text: Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: Good evening to you.

speaker: Chrom
text: How did you get here?

speaker: Marth
text: The cleft in the castle wall, behind the maple grove.

speaker: Chrom
text: There? But how would you...? Ugh.

speaker: Robin
text: You know the place, Chrom?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes. I bashed in part of the wall while training the Shepherds. It's only a small hole, and I'd thought it well concealed, but...

speaker: Marth
text: Your secret is safe with me. I come here only to warn you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Warn us?

speaker: Marth
text: The exalt's life is in danger.

speaker: Chrom
text: What, Emmeryn? That's absurd. She's guarded at all hours.

speaker: Marth
text: What if... What if I told you I have seen the future? Would you believe me? A future where Emmeryn is killed. Here. Tonight.

speaker: Chrom
text: Seen the future? Have you lost your wits?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I expected you wouldn't believe me. So allow me to prove it!

speaker: Marth
text: I'm about to save your life. ...From him.

speaker: Marth
text: I trust this proof will suffice?

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Yeah.

speaker: Chrom
text: Wait, you're—You're a woman?

speaker: Marth
text: And quite the actress, too. Honestly, I'm surprised you didn't figure it out until just now.

speaker: Validar
text: Remember, I want the Emblem in my hand and Emmeryn dead on the floor. Let nothing distract you from either purpose.

speaker: Assassin
text: As you will it.

speaker: Gaius
text: Woah, woah, did I just hear that right? We're to KILL the exalt? I'm just here for the plunder. You know, line my pockets with some royal goods. The exalt's such a sweet lady... Sure, I'll rob her blind, but I'd never harm her!

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom! Take Lissa and flee while you still have time!

speaker: Chrom
text: No! We're not leaving you! Just stay where it's safe!

speaker: Robin
text: The assassins should scatter if we can defeat their leader.

speaker: Validar
text: Hmph! Two assassins and the little princeling was not even wounds? ...Wait. Some of these actors do not belong on this stage...

speaker: Validar
text: Ho ho! Can it be?! After years of searching... Tonight, fate truly piles gifts at my feet!

speaker: Marth
text: Falchion is gleaming...

speaker: Chrom
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Marth
text: It's not your concern.

speaker: Chrom
text: Seems like nothing ever is with you.

speaker: Marth
text: My apologies.

speaker: Chrom
text: Just stay at Emmeryn's door. We'll handle the killers.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom, please! Flee while you still can! You each have but one life, and I do not wish it weighed against mine!

speaker: Panne
text: I knew there was wisdom in slipping in with those rogues. Look at how these man-spawn claw at each other like savages! I will repay my warren's debt and then wash my hands of their race.

speaker: Chrom
text: Another assassin?

speaker: Marth
text: Hold! Panne is not your enemy.

speaker: Chrom
text: You know her?

speaker: Marth
text: I know... of her. And I knew she would come here tonight.

speaker: Chrom
text: Quite the prophet, aren't you?

speaker: Marth
text: As you say. And I swear to you, Panne is an ally.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Good enough for me. All right, Shepherds! For now, we leave this Panne character be.

speaker: Frederick
text: Is that wise, milord?

speaker: Chrom
text: Marth has earned our trust. She enjoys her secrets, I know. ...Like her gender, for one. But she's also saved our lives. Twice. And that's enough for me.

speaker: Marth
text: Chrom... Thank you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Now, to the matter at hand: driving these scoundrels from our castle!

speaker: Chrom
text: Drop your weapon, or die where you stand!

speaker: Gaius
text: Easy there, blue blood. I'm not here to hurt anyone.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Yet you run with a band of assassins?

speaker: Gaius
text: Believe it or not, just trying to make a living. I'm a thief, see? Bust open doors, crack into chests... that kind of thing. This lot said they wanted to break into some kind of vault. Nobody said anything about murder. I'd just as soon sit this one out.

speaker: Chrom
text: Hmm... Then perhaps you'd be willing to prove your good intentions?

speaker: Gaius
text: Beg pardon?

speaker: Chrom
text: We need all the help we can get to save the exalt's life. You appear capable, and we could use any information you have about our foes.

speaker: Gaius
text: Oh, right—those good intentions. Fine then, I'll prove my sincerity... if you sweeten the deal.

speaker: Chrom
text: You want gold? ...Fine, you scoundrel. Let me just—oops.

speaker: Gaius
text: Looks like you dropped something. What's in the satchel, mmm?

speaker: Chrom
text: Nothing—candies from my little sister. I'm sure you--

speaker: Gaius
text: Candies? As in, sugar candies?

speaker: Chrom
text: Well... yes. I assume they'd be sweet? But--

speaker: Gaius
text: IT'S A DEAL!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...You'll risk your life if I give you... a bag of candy?

speaker: Gaius
text: I said "sweeten the deal", didn't I? Don't get me wrong, I'll take the gold, too. Later. Unless you've got more of these. ...Have you got more of these?!

speaker: Chrom
text: Um... I'll ask Lissa.

speaker: Gaius
text: Nngh... Damn and double damn... I hate it when things... go sour...

speaker: Panne
text: I have misjudged the strength of these animals... I must fall back...

speaker: Marth
text: Nngh, no! I must keep fighting...or what purpose have I served?

speaker: Chrom
text: Marth, no! Stand down! You'll die if you don't! We'll keep Emmeryn safe, I swear!

speaker: Marth
text: All right...nngh... A-as you wish...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Ah... I... Forgive me…

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm? ...EMM?! No, no, no, no, no! Oh gods, nooo!

speaker: Validar
text: Emmeryn was supposed to be an easy target... You will pay for interfering in my designs!

speaker: Validar
text: No... This is... all wrong... How could... you have known the plan...

speaker: Validar
text: Well, well... Ha ha ha! Oh, I know you... Submit to me, and perhaps I might honor you with the truth!

speaker: Chrom
text: Thank the gods you're safe!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: It is you I have to thank, Chrom.

speaker: Phila
text: I beg your forgiveness, milord! I failed in my duty—they should never have made it into the castle in the first place.

speaker: Chrom
text: Peace, Phila. You couldn't have known what was coming. Only Marth could...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...Marth?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, I would speak more with... Um... Robin, where's Marth?

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm... An excellent question. She was here a moment ago...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Not again!

speaker: Chrom
text: Going somewhere? You have a bad habit of leaving without saying goodbye, you know.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I'm afraid I have a few bad habits.

speaker: Chrom
text: Good ones as well—you saved my life, as well as both of my sisters. Is there some way I can repay you? Some favor I can grant?

speaker: Marth
text: Hearing you offer is reward enough.

speaker: Chrom
text: But there must be something...

speaker: Marth
text: I already have what I came for: history has been rewritten.

speaker: Chrom
text: And what future averted?

speaker: Marth
text: After the exalt's untimely assassination, the Fire Emblem would be stolen. This, in turn, would lead to a great war, and soon to the end of mankind itself. ...But I'm sure that sounds like madness to you.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Strangely, no. It doesn't. Somehow I know I can trust you. And I hope someday to repay your favors.

speaker: Marth
text: Perhaps one day you shall. Until then...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Brave taguel, there are not words enough to express my gratitude.

speaker: Panne
text: So you know our true name?

speaker: Robin
text: Sorry, what's a taguel?

speaker: Panne
text: I am a taguel. The... The last taguel. We are shape-shifters. Most of your kind calls us "beast" or "coney" in the midst of their hunt. I only helped because my warren owes Ylisse a debt. Do not think us friends, you and I!

speaker: Robin
text: I don't understand...

speaker: Panne
text: Yes, it's precious little your kind seem to understand. It was man-spawn like you that invaded our warren and slaughtered my people.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: What?! Is this true? Who would do such a thing?

speaker: Panne
text: Ha! Do not act so shocked. You are all the same. Right down to your base desire to ruin and destroy all your touch—even each other.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...There is truth to your words, perhaps. I'm told that, in taguel society, everyone is treated as an equal. Mankind could learn much from your warren. The words may come too late and mean too little, but I am deeply sorry. We have stolen your friends and family and made the world a lesser place.

speaker: Phila
text: Your Grace—you had no fault in this!

speaker: Panne
text: You claim to be blameless, and yet you would apologize? Pah! Your words are but wind.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: I know... But they are all I have.

speaker: Panne
text: ...You seem sincere, man-spawn. You feel my pain as your own. ...I've never felt that before. Look at me. ...See what I am. I will never trust mankind. But you... Perhaps you truly are not like the others.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: All I ask if a chance to earn your trust.

speaker: Validar
text: Nngh... How?! My purpose is too significant... to be thwarted... here... Aaargh...
Validar.

speaker: Validar
text: What? Who are you... Where did you... come from?
I am the power that compels you. You will not perish here. It is not written. You must live on to author a destiny greater than you know.

speaker: Validar
text: I-impossible! It can't be you! It can't be...
I am the wings of despair. I am the breath of ruin. I am the fell dragon, Grima...

speaker: Phila
text: It will take time to investigate how the assassination plot got so far. We have no leads at present.

speaker: Chrom
text: It was Plegia! I'm certain of it. They'd do anything for the Emblem. Emm, you can't stay here. Come to Ferox where it's safe.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: And leave the people undefended? War is at our borders, Chrom. Do you expect Ylisse to stand against Plegia without a leader? They must know their exalt stands with them.

speaker: Chrom
text: But if something happens to you? What then?

speaker: Frederick
text: Your Grace, perhaps you might relocate to the eastern palace for the time being? The other kingdoms would know nothing of it. You would be safer.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, please. At least that. I can't leave for Ferox with you right in harm's way.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...Hmm. Very well.

speaker: Chrom
text: Thanks, Emm. I mean it. We'll escort you to the palace before we head north to the border.

speaker: Grima
text: WRETCHED SON OF NAGA... YOU WILL BE DESTROYED.

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you ready, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: As ready as I will ever be, Chrom. Let's finish this!

speaker: Chrom
text: Hrrngh! *Huff, huff* ...Wh-what... What manner of magic...

speaker: Basilio
text: Magic? *huff, huff* That was a...damned...catastrophe... He's weakened us all... He's too...strong...rrgh...

speaker: Frederick
text: It cannot end like this... I won't have...all our struggle...be for naught...

speaker: Lucina
text: No... This darkness... The future is upon us! Oh gods... F-Father...

speaker: Grima
text: And so it ends, Robin. See how frail these human bonds of yours are? How short lived? How pointless? You have all thrown your lives away, and the result is the same!

speaker: Robin
text: We're not dead yet!

speaker: Grima
text: Details, details. *sigh* But yes, I suppose it's time I got you all off my back, so to speak—permanently.

speaker: Robin
text: No...

speaker: Grima
text: No, you don't want this, do you? You do have a choice, you know. It doesn't have to be this way. You can still save all your friends... Become one with me, and we shall spare their lives. ...Refuse, and watch as I rend the flesh from their bones!

speaker: Chrom
text: No, Robin! Don't...do it...

speaker: Lissa
text: He's/She's lying... It's...a trap...

speaker: Grima
text: NOW! I will have your decision! Will you save these worms? Will you JOIN ME and become a GOD?

speaker: Robin
text: Do you think me a fool? You'll kill them anyway!

speaker: Grima
text: ...Well, of COURSE I would. I only thought you might want to leave your comrades with a heroic, selfless image. ...But so be it. Leave them with the final memory that you were their undoing!

speaker: Robin
text: Aaarrrrgh!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin!

speaker: Robin
text: Where am I?

speaker: Grima
text: Where your god wills you to be. Now if you will excuse me... I have some fleas on my back to take care of.

speaker: Robin
text: No... I won't let you!

speaker: Robin
text: All right! I'll do as you wish! Just...let them live.

speaker: Chrom
text: No, Robin! Don't—

speaker: Grima
text: Yes, at last I have you... Once our power is joined... THE DRAGON'S MIGHT...WILL BE MADE WHOLE.

speaker: Robin
text: First, let my friends go... You promised to spare them.

speaker: Grima
text: Oh come now, we both knew that was never going to happen... But I am not altogether cruel... I did spare you the pain of damning them openly.

speaker: Robin
text: You...

speaker: Grima
text: In truth, I simply don't understand why you care so deeply for the creatures... No matter. Your soul is mine now; you cannot escape. Your mind will descend into the shadow of my own!

speaker: Robin
text: No... I won't let you!

speaker: Grima
text: You still DARE resist ME?! Then perhaps I should end you first!

speaker: Robin
text: So dark... A sea of black... I have...no final strategy... No cards left to play... He/She has...won... Ah... I c-can't see... I can't hear... I feel...nothing... ...... ...Nothing... ......
——ve to ————ack!
Yo— ha——— fi— back! ——ghting!

speaker: Robin
text: I...hear something... A voice...
Fight ba—! —ave to keep ——ing! Fight back, Robin! You swore to do so, remember? Now keep your damn word!

speaker: Robin
text: C-Chrom? Chrom! Chrom, I can hear you!

speaker: Grima
text: What?! No! You are mine now! The dragon's grip cannot be broken!

speaker: Lissa
text: Come back to us, Robin!

speaker: Frederick
text: I know it would take more than this to stop you, sir/milady!

speaker: Sully
text: You gonna let that ugly snake get the last hiss? Come on!

speaker: Virion
text: History is watching, Robin! The bards would sing of your triumph!

speaker: Vaike
text: On your feet, soldier! Don't make ol' Teach give ya a lecture!

speaker: Stahl
text: Wake up, Robin! Only I get to oversleep!

speaker: Miriel
text: Arise from your hypnopompic state! You are sorely needed here!

speaker: Kellam
text: Hello? Can you hear me? ...Perhaps if I shout? AAAAAAH!

speaker: Sumia
text: Robin, remember all the days we spent together!

speaker: Lon'Qu
text: Answer us, Robin!

speaker: Ricken
text: Please, Robin! You're too important to me!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Get up right this instant, or suffer a swift smack of my parasol!

speaker: Panne
text: Do not rob the taguel of one of our last true champions!

speaker: Gaius
text: Up and at 'em, Robin! One dragon ought to be a piece of cake!

speaker: Cordelia
text: We're all right here by your side!

speaker: Gregor
text: Gregor will snap you out of it! Gregor does with the YELLING!

speaker: Nowi
text: I thought I was your favorite dragon! Forget about Grima!

speaker: Libra
text: The gods gave you to us. I do not believe they wish you taken away!

speaker: Tharja
text: Get up, Robin! No one goes down without my say so...

speaker: Olivia
text: Please, Robin! I still haven't shown you my new dance!

speaker: Cherche
text: Minerva wants you back, and so do I!

speaker: Henry
text: I know the darkness is warm and delicious... But too much of a good thing is just bad!

speaker: Lucina
text: You have earned my trust and my love, sir/milady. Now return to us!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, awaken! You cannot leave now, with my debt to you unpaid!

speaker: Basilio
text: Pull it together, lad/lass! Death is overrated, believe me!

speaker: Flavia
text: You don't bow to dragons. You break 'em!

speaker: Donnel
text: I need ya to come on back, y'hear?!

speaker: Anna
text: Robin, you can't close up shop on us now! We still need you!

speaker: Owain
text: Heed not the dark's eerie call, friend! Summon forth the strength inside you!

speaker: Inigo
text: I can think of nothing worse than dying alone. ...No, seriously. I can't.

speaker: Brady
text: Come on, bud! No giving up now!

speaker: Kjelle
text: This is a test, and by the gods, you're gonna pass it!

speaker: Cynthia
text: Come on! You can do this! You need to fight with us!

speaker: Severa
text: If you don't come back, I'm never going to forgive you!

speaker: Gerome
text: We lost to the fell dragon once. Do not grant fate a second victory!

speaker: Morgan
text: Father/Mother! You mean everything to me! I can't lose you again!

speaker: Yarne
text: You're going to be okay, right? ...I need you to keep me safe.

speaker: Laurent
text: It is inconceivable that our rollicking adventures might end at this juncture.

speaker: Noire
text: Blood and thunder! Return to us now!

speaker: Nah
text: You'll return. I know you will.

speaker: Tiki
text: You are not Grima, nor is he you. Remember that, Robin!

speaker: Gangrel
text: One nip from a dragon and you're down? Get up, you craven schoolboy/schoolgirl!

speaker: Walhart
text: Rise, Robin! Show this god that man is made of sterner stuff!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Robin... Robin... Robin!

speaker: Aversa
text: Oh, Robin, no taking the easy way out—I haven't finished with you yet!

speaker: Priam
text: True champions find victory in the darkest hour! Show us, Robin!

speaker: Robin
text: I can hear them... I hear my friends!

speaker: Grima
text: Stop this at once! SILENCE those wretched voices! You are all powerless! Frail! Insignificant! You are NOOOTHING!

speaker: Chrom
text: Return to us, Robin! Your bond with us is stronger than even the fell dragon's might!

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom! I'm coming, Chrom! Hold on!

speaker: Naga
text: Children of man, take my power! Rise now, and face the fell dragon!

speaker: Naga
text: Hear my words, Awakener! Grima's servants will beset you to no end. Dispatch him as soon as you are able! Once the fell one is weakened, a choice will await you... If Chrom lets fall the final blow, Grima shall survive but return to his slumber...

speaker: Chrom
text: So be it.

speaker: Naga
text: If Robin strikes in Chrom's stead, both his/her life and Grima's are forever over. Only in this way may the fell dragon be destroyed for good and all.

speaker: Naga
text: The final decision...is yours.

speaker: Grima
text: ...I AM...GRIMA... I AM...DESPAIR...

speaker: Grima
text: ...NNGH...AAAAUGHHH...

speaker: Chrom
text: Now, Robin! This is our chance! I'm going to finish it!

speaker: Grima
text: ...RETURN TO ME... COME... WE ARE ONE...AND THE SAME...

speaker: Chrom
text: I come to end you, Grima!

speaker: Grima
text: ...ARROGANT MORTAL... I AM THE END!

speaker: Lucina
text: I lost to you once, monster. I shall not lose again! Die now, that our future can live!

speaker: Grima
text: ... YOU CANNOT SLAY...WHAT MAY NEVER DIE...

speaker: Chrom
text: He's...he's finished. ...We did it! And without sacrificing the life of another friend! Can you believe it, Robin?

speaker: Naga
text: Grima has returned to slumber.

speaker: Chrom
text: He may rise to threaten the world again, but he'll never destroy it. One such as I, or the first exalt before me... One will rise up to challenge him.

speaker: Chrom
text: Shepherds... Friends... The war is over! The fell dragon's era of chaos has been averted! The Risen will trouble our world no more! You all know that I'm a simple man, never one for speeches or song... But you need to know this... All that is good and brave in me and what I have done is because of you! We have weathered a sea of horror, but we did it as one. And, finally, we have come to the inviting shores of a bright future. Together.

speaker: Lissa
text: Wooooo! I can't believe we did it!

speaker: Frederick
text: Exceptionally well fought, my prince! At long last Ylisse can know lasting peace.

speaker: Sully
text: Nothing like kickin' the crap out of a dragon to make you feel alive!

speaker: Virion
text: Virion the Grimslayer... Ah, such a noble ring to it!

speaker: Vaike
text: Yes! We won! We won! We... Uh, hey—has anyone seen my axe?

speaker: Stahl
text: Anyone else hungry? Because I'm starving!

speaker: Miriel
text: Let the scholars remember: there is no weapon more proficuous than the heart!

speaker: Kellam
text: Hip hip hurrah! ...Huzzah? ...Hello? ...Anyone? ...Never mind.

speaker: Sumia
text: We owe our victory to the world's finest captain and prince!

speaker: Lon'Qu
text: Laying it on a bit thick, aren't all of you? ...Well, I guess if any time called for it, it'd be now.

speaker: Ricken
text: Captain Chrom! How'd I do? I was great, wasn't I?

speaker: Maribelle
text: I never doubted us for a second! ...Well, maybe a half second.

speaker: Panne
text: The taguel have won more than peace... We have won a new clan.

speaker: Gaius
text: And so ends another contract. ...Sweet, sweet victory.

speaker: Cordelia
text: My good prince... My joy has no bounds...

speaker: Gregor
text: Today Gregor not be stingy! Treat everyone to special bear dinner!

speaker: Nowi
text: All this happiness is so contagious! I could just...c-cry! *sniff*

speaker: Libra
text: At last, we have won Exalt Emmeryn her peace...

speaker: Tharja
text: Stop grinning, you shameless fools! ...You want to make me smile, too?

speaker: Olivia
text: Today's dance will come from the heart!

speaker: Cherche
text: Whew! Quite a battle... Perhaps time to settle down for a spell.

speaker: Henry
text: Oh, NICE! I'm still bleeding in, like, twelve different places! Look at all that blood...

speaker: Lucina
text: It's over... I'm finally free...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Chon'sin's struggle has ended. Mercy on you all, my good friends.

speaker: Basilio
text: Har har har! We whupped 'em but good! Now, to feast! Bring the meat and mead!

speaker: Flavia
text: The names of Chrom and Robin will long be remembered in Regna Ferox.

speaker: Donnel
text: Look, Ma! Look, Pa! I done done it!

speaker: Anna
text: Well, it's back to business, I suppose. Drop by our shops now and again, okay?

speaker: Owain
text: Farewell, O dire beast! Now it's your turn to suffer in darkness!

speaker: Inigo
text: Huzzah! Now I'll finally have more time for the ladies...

speaker: Brady
text: Well, heck. We actually did it. We saved the world!

speaker: Kjelle
text: My long training has finally proven its worth.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Truth and justice win again! Woooooo!

speaker: Severa
text: I never doubted us. We were born to win.

speaker: Gerome
text: We have wrestled destiny itself into submission!

speaker: Morgan
text: Father/Mother! Now we have years to share stories with one another.

speaker: Yarne
text: H-holy moly! I might make it outta here alive after all!

speaker: Laurent
text: Well, how delightfully fascinating this all was.

speaker: Noire
text: Is... Is all the scary stuff over?

speaker: Nah
text: Our journey through time was worth it, wasn't it, Mother?

speaker: Tiki
text: The world has been plucked from the maw of darkness!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Really now, I just can't seem to die... Where's the messy end I was promised?

speaker: Walhart
text: I stand justified! Man alone is the ruler of his domain.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom... Everyone... Thank you...

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: Say'ri, your strength has led this world back to light.

speaker: Aversa
text: I suppose an end is an end. ...But now how will I fill my days?

speaker: Priam
text: Our strength in body and mind have set the world on a better course.

speaker: Chrom
text: I know some of you will be returning home to your homes and families. This is good, though I will be most sorry to lose you. But ours is a fellowship that cannot be weakened by time or distance. As we walk toward a new and brighter future, let us think often on each other. And let's never forget what we have accomplished, here, today. Together.

speaker: Chrom
text: Still feeling guilty, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: Huh? Oh... Hello, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: Don't bother trying to hide it. You're wondering if you should have sacrificed yourself.

speaker: Robin
text: How can I not question it? I could have ensured my bloodline never threatens us again. But instead...

speaker: Chrom
text: I won't lie: your death might have spared the world future grief. Perhaps. ...But I know for certain it would have robbed the world of someone very special.

speaker: Robin
text: I'm just one man/woman, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: And the good you bring to the world will more than make up for it. You made the right choice, Robin. Everyone agrees.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Robin?! Wait, what—

speaker: Grima
text: ...WHAT...WHAT ARE YOU DOING?

speaker: Robin
text: For once, I'm glad you and I are the same. Now I can give my life to protect those I care for...

speaker: Grima
text: ...YOU WOULD...NOT DARE!

speaker: Robin
text: I would and I will. The evils you would visit on this world are unthinkable... In some way, I—we share the blame. It's only right we meet our end together!

speaker: Grima
text: ...NOOOOOOO!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! No!

speaker: Robin
text: Thank you, Chrom. For...everything... Tell the others...my last thoughts were of them... May we meet again, in a better life...

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! No! Ah gods, NO!

speaker: Chrom
text: The war is ended, my friends. Never again will the fell dragon trouble our world. I owe you all far more than words can ever repay. Especially Robin, who gave himself/herself to save us all. To save all the worlds to come.

speaker: Lissa
text: P-poor Robin... *sniff* After everything he/she did for us...

speaker: Chrom
text: Don't cry, Lissa. We'll see him/her again. I'm sure of it. Remember what Naga said? That Robin would survive if our ties were strong enough. This isn't over. I believe Robin is out there...somewhere... And I'll find him/her. If it takes me the rest of my days, I'll find him/her...

speaker: Lissa
text: You're right! He/She has to be out there somewhere... And we'll find a way to bring him/her home. Even if we have to search every open field in this whole stupid world!

speaker: Frederick
text: I believe the same, my prince. Robin is too strong to simply disappear. It falls to us to look after the realm until he/she returns.

speaker: Sully
text: Robin had damn well BETTER come back! If that blasted dragon truly got him/her, I'll be the one breathing fire!

speaker: Virion
text: He/She made a noble sacrifice, and I know my nobility! And I know Robin shall someday return!

speaker: Vaike
text: Robin has gotta be out there somewhere... How do I know? Hey, you don't question the Vaike!

speaker: Stahl
text: I can feel it, too. Robin is out there waiting for us. Though I surely will miss him/her in the meantime...

speaker: Miriel
text: While statistically unsubstantiated, I have what laymen might call a "hunch." This hunch corroborates with most of the statements made thus far.

speaker: Kellam
text: Robin, I know you're out there... I know you're not gone... And no one knows more about being lost and found than me!

speaker: Sumia
text: I wish he/she could have stayed with us long enough to see me grow stronger... But all the more reason to work hard between now and his/her return!

speaker: Lon'Qu
text: ...He/She lives. I know it. Some people just aren't the dying sort.

speaker: Ricken
text: If Chrom believes he's/she's all right, then so do I! Maybe I can work out some new magic to bring him/her home...

speaker: Maribelle
text: If he/she returns to us now, I might even consider making him/her tea. ...Myself. Do you hear that, Robin?! ME, making TEA! You should be honored!

speaker: Panne
text: Let us honor Robin's regard for his/her warren. He/She was a true taguel. And a true taguel would not leave family behind... I feel he's/she's out there!

speaker: Gaius
text: If Robin's anythin' like me, he/she won't check out just 'cause a job is done. Gotta collect on all the sweet rewards, right?

speaker: Cordelia
text: Too many times now have I watched loved ones give their lives for me... I must hold on to faith that this time will be different.

speaker: Gregor
text: Oy, Robin! You daring to make Gregor celebrate alone?! Gregor not rest until he drink you under table! Har har!

speaker: Nowi
text: *Sob* *sniff* Robin's not gone! He's/She's just...misplaced! I'll wait a thousand years for him/her if I have to!

speaker: Libra
text: Naga has a way of sending a ray of light into even the deepest darkness. May Robin find that light, just as he/she became that light for us.

speaker: Tharja
text: He/She had better march back here and try again! I only send people off on my terms! ...Or in a casket.

speaker: Olivia
text: There will be one less set of eyes on me as I dance... It feels wrong... Please come back, Robin! Please be out there somewhere!

speaker: Cherche
text: Minerva says she still feels Robin is of this world... Also that he/she smells delicious, but that's neither here nor there...

speaker: Henry
text: Hey, Robin, everyone's dying to see you alive. We're sick to death of death! That reminds me of a good one: two Risen, a wyvern, and a priest walk into a bar—

speaker: Lucina
text: We have won our future, but we are in debt to so many sad memories... I pray at least one of those sadnesses will yet be undone.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: I swear my life and blade to defend this future you have won, Robin. If you can hear me, swear that you will help me do so!

speaker: Basilio
text: He/She did what he had to do. That's the mark of a true warrior! He'll/She'll be back. I'd bet my sweet brown arse on it!

speaker: Flavia
text: Bah! Leave it to Robin to take responsibility for all of us. If he/she cared for us that much, I hope he/she knows how we still need him/her.

speaker: Donnel
text: Thanks to you and the others, I was able to change... And I've got more changin' to do! I wants ya to see it.

speaker: Anna
text: You've done so much for me and all of my many, many sisters. You're an extra-special customer. ...I hope we meet again.

speaker: Owain
text: I feel a soul straight and true pulsing in the darkness. The hero...will return!

speaker: Inigo
text: No tears today. I know he'll/she'll be back. I'll just have to wait, and...try to smile...

speaker: Brady
text: I won't cry! He'll/she'll be back! I know it! And in the meantime, I'll write the finest song about him/her that ever was!

speaker: Kjelle
text: I am glad for our victory, but I wish it did not mean so sad a farewell... I still have so much to learn. Come back and teach me.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Now I know what it really means to be a hero... But heroes always come back to fight again...don't they?

speaker: Severa
text: Fool! Why did you sacrifice yourself?! I refuse to accept it! Return, Robin, or face my wrath!

speaker: Gerome
text: He/She showed me that I have a future. That destiny can be defeated. We have to believe that we can alter destiny once more and bring him/her back.

speaker: Morgan
text: Father/Mother... You can't leave me now. Not like this... I believe in you. Come back!

speaker: Yarne
text: All this death... No more! Please, you've... You've got to come back...

speaker: Laurent
text: The world is vast and full of potential unexplored! I shall devote myself to discovering that art which might reunite us.

speaker: Noire
text: No, this is all wrong... He/She can't be dead! He's/She's out there. We have to be patient and believe!

speaker: Nah
text: This is all wrong. We can't just leave Robin for dead. I'll wait until the end of time for his/her return!

speaker: Tiki
text: Robin put others before himself/herself. No one can question his/her character. But his/her work is not done. He/She is still needed here.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Damn you, Robin! I joined this fight to meet my end, not secure yours! I'll chase after you to the ends of hell...and if you're there, well I'll drag you back!

speaker: Walhart
text: How we die defines how we lived. This can be said of Robin. But I expect there are more pages yet to be written of a man/woman so nearly my equal.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Robin... Come back... I need you... We...need you... This world...needs you...

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: ...Robin. 'Twas a life lived grandly. ...... But was it lived to its end? I trow you are yet meant for more.

speaker: Aversa
text: What? Robin, dead before me? Preposterous! Return, my lord/lady, and you will have my service...

speaker: Priam
text: Robin could not have arrived at his/her decision easily. But I won't accept it. This can't be the end of his/her story...

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin has secured for us all the most precious gift: a future. Now it falls upon our shoulders to protect what was given. I vow to give my all to healing the damage this war has wrought upon the realm. When Robin returns, I want him/her to see what his/her sacrifice bought. Robin...if you can hear me... You will always have a place here with us. Remember that. Always.

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom, we have to do SOMETHING.

speaker: Chrom
text: What do you propose we do?

speaker: Lissa
text: Uh... Uh, I don't know!...

speaker: Chrom
text: I see you're awake now.

speaker: Lissa
text: Hey there!

speaker: Chrom
text: There are better places to take a nap than on the ground, you know.  Give me your hand.

speaker: Chrom
text: Welcome back. It's over now.

speaker: Chrom
text: At last, Valm Harbor. Hmm... It appears well fortified... Prepare the troops. We'll— Huh? What's that?

speaker: Frederick
text: An altercation? That woman—the Valmese dogs are running her down.

speaker: Chrom
text: Any enemy of theirs is a friend of ours. Come on!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: *Huff, huff* Who is that? ...The Ylissean League! So they have finally landed!

speaker: Valmese
text: Over 'ere! We have 'er cornered!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Confound these wretched imperials!

speaker: Valmese
text: Don't let 'er get away!

speaker: Chrom
text: Our first priority is to hurry and save that woman.

speaker: Chrom
text: If possible, we should also visit the homes here to see how the people fare.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Prince Chrom of the Ylissean League! You have my gratitude!

speaker: Chrom
text: You know of our cause?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Of course! I would speak with you more—but first, perhaps...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Ah, yes. Time enough for that once the fighting is finished.

speaker: Old Villager
text: Yes? Helping Say'ri, are you? Good, good! We need such bravery in these times. Here now, sell this at market and use the funds to arm your forces. I'd rather see you put it to use than have that tyrant steal it.

speaker: Maiden
text: There's no standing against the emperor! All who question him are slain on the spot. I am a refugee here... The dastard razed my entire village just for sport! If you truly mean to fight him, I'd have you take this. You can use it to heal the wounds of comrades from afar.

speaker: Villager
text: Oh, well, you don't look imperial, do ya! Care for a wee bit o' gossip? I hear tell of resistance movements all across the continent. Each one strivin' to end Walhart's cruel tyranny...but they're divided. Scattered. They say a beautiful swordmistress is tryin' to unite 'em! Cor blimey! Now, I've never even seen me this lady, but I wish to help her all the same. Should you find her, ask that she read this. It'll make her even keener with a blade!

speaker: Elder
text: (psst! Talk quietly now! The Conqueror has ears everywhere...Between us...I support the Resistance and all, but I'm not about to stand against him. If his men even knew I talked to you, they'd slice me open and wear me like a jacket! ...Er, but good luck to you, though!) ...... (Oh, fine. Here. Take this. Just don't tell anyone I helped you!)

speaker: Farber
text: Long live the emperor! Death to all who oppose him!

speaker: Farber
text: I may fall...but we are legion... You cannot stop...the Conqueror...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Mercy, friends! The tales of your strength were no exaggeration... I am called Say'ri, and I fight with the Resistance.

speaker: Chrom
text: So there is an organized resistance?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, of sorts. Several groups formed to seek liberty for the states of Valm.

speaker: Chrom
text: I thought the emperor had stamped out all dissenters...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: He tries, but we Resistance are a slippery lot. We strike hard and then vanish again into the dark of night. Even now rebels ride to the banner of dynasts across the continent. United, we could pose a veritable threat to Walhart. And so, for some time I have struggled to bring us together.

speaker: Flavia
text: What's stopping you?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Greed. Jealousy. Sloth. All the old weaknesses of man. The dynasts all would have freedom, but on their own terms. Some refuse to take up arms unless their territory is threatened. Others thrive under the Conqueror's heel and will not join unless there is profit in it. Liberty is a fine word, aye, but not always enough to rouse men from foolishness.

speaker: Flavia
text: I take it you're looking for a more convincing argument, then?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Just so, although my efforts thus far have met with meager success. I fear many distrust me because my brother fights for Walhart.

speaker: Basilio
text: Why does he support the empire?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Would that I knew, good sir. Yen'fay was a good man once, but he is my brother no more! If we meet on the battlefield, I would cut him down, same as any other imperial. Walhart is said to command a million men now. Perhaps more. Sooner or later he will stamp out the Resistance entirely, if we do not unite.

speaker: Lissa
text: Um, Chrom? Did she just say he has a MILLION soldiers?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Ha! And what are one million men against the Ylissean dogs of war?! You stopped a thousand of their ships, did you not? Your daring strategy has awoken and inspired people across all of Valm. Together I know we can yet unite the Resistance and break Walhart's grip! Help me, Prince Chrom! I beg of you!

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord?

speaker: Chrom
text: This is no easy thing you ask of me. I have my own causes: a halidom to save and a future to win.

speaker: Chrom
text: I know a great battle has been foretold, but is this it? How to know? Still, I admire your courage... Perhaps your mission is the best way to achieve mine. So yes, Say'ri. I will join your cause with my own. And if I'm wrong, it's my life on the line. ...As it should be. Now. What will it take to unite your people?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Well, I do have one idea...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Since ancient times, many of our people have worshipped Naga. More precisely, we worship the divine dragon's oracle, Lady Tiki. Though most know her only as the Voice. The Voice is trapped in her temple as Walhart's prisoner. But if she were freed...

speaker: Robin
text: The Resistance could unite around her. Where is the Voice being held?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: There is a shrine built in the branches of the divine Mila Tree. She is confined there.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then we have our plan. Let's get to it!

speaker: Aversa
text: Greetings, Prince Chrom. Plegia welcomes you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Aversa!

speaker: Aversa
text: What can I say? It seems fate has designs for me yet.

speaker: Chrom
text: You serve the new king, then? This... Validar?

speaker: Aversa
text: I do.

speaker: Frederick
text: They say he worships Grima...

speaker: Aversa
text: Why yes, of course he is Grimleal. We are both believers. My liege often says it was his faith that got him through, after Gangrel's passing. It was a difficult time... But he kept order where there might have been chaos. We had meant to arrange an official visit to Ylisstol, but—Ah, here is my lord now.

speaker: Validar
text: An honor to finally meet you, sire. I am Validar, king regnant of Plegia.

speaker: Chrom
text: The honor is mine, good king. ...Is it possible we've met before some... Gods! It can't be.

speaker: Validar
text: Oh ho, I'm quite certain I would remember any encounter with Ylissean royalty.

speaker: Chrom
text: (Psst! Robin!)

speaker: Robin
text: (I know! He looks just like the assassin that came after Emmeryn...)

speaker: Validar
text: And you must be Sir/Lady Robin.

speaker: Robin
text: You know of me, sire?

speaker: Validar
text: The whole world knows of Ylisse's master tactician! And indeed, I see the sparkle of wisdom in your eyes.

speaker: Chrom
text: (But we killed him, Robin!)

speaker: Robin
text: (I know but... The resemblance... it's uncanny...)

speaker: Chrom
text: (How could he possibly--)

speaker: Validar
text: My, the negotiations haven't even begun and already so much whispering...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...My apologies, King Validar. We meant no disrespect.

speaker: Robin
text: (Chrom? What should we do?)

speaker: Chrom
text: (Nothing for now. But stay close, and be ready for anything...)

speaker: Validar
text: Then let us get to it.

speaker: Aversa
text: Plegia can offer no soldiers, but will provide 800 warships and 200 transports. In addition, we would be pleased to fully fund the campaign against Valm.

speaker: Frederick
text: That is... surprisingly generous of you, milord. We could not ask for more, quite literally. You offer most all your assets...

speaker: Validar
