text: I would give troops as well, but our army remains in shambles from the last war. I trust the gold and ships will suffice as a sign of our commitment to the cause?

speaker: Chrom
text: Of course it will. Thank you, King Validar.

speaker: Validar
text: The honor is ours, my prince. I look forward to building a strong bond between our two nations.

speaker: Chrom
text: As do I. Then, if there's nothing else? My men and I must hurry back to Port Ferox.

speaker: Aversa
text: Oh, so soon? But I have one more introduction to make.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Yes? And who would that be?

text: Enough! I don't require every detail of your twisted philosophy. You're a villain and a murderer, plain and simple. And I am the justice you deserve.

speaker: Walhart
text: Ha ha ha! Better, Prince. Much better! Be not an agent of someone else's justice, but justice itself! Now, let us fight as two great men, freed of their gods. I grant any challenger the chance to test his will against my own... But you, too, shall be found wanting!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Walhart!

speaker: Walhart
text: Hmm? The princess of Chon'sin? It's a wonder you still live.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: I have survived your gauntlet of betrayal and death, tyrant. Shall I describe to you now the searing pain of it all? The torture of watching friends, family...my entire kingdom perish? The fresh hell of each new day, with no respite in sight?

speaker: Walhart
text: Pain is a concern of men. And respite? Beg that from your gods. Your concerns are not mine. I have risen to a higher plane of existence.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Then today you come crashing down to the hell you've made of this one.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Walhart has retreated into the capital! Fie, will this war never end?!

speaker: Chrom
text: His men gave their lives to secure his escape. They won't lay down arms until he does.

speaker: Lucina
text: Then we must pursue and see that the deed is done.

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn! We're surrounded! The dynasts ride against us!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Hold, sir—look!

speaker: Excellus
text: H-he lost? But how...? How could the Conqueror be conquered?! He's insurmountable! Incontestable! Invincible! ...But then that means... Oh my... Good-bye, then! Do see to it that—

speaker: Walhart
text: Going somewhere, tactician?

speaker: Excellus
text: M-master! I... I was just coming to make sure you were all right. Are you hurt?

speaker: Walhart
text: Rally our forces in the capital. We will put an end to this here.

speaker: Excellus
text: At once, my master. Only... Have you considered, perhaps, waiting just one day? I do have the dynasts and their men on the way. With them to help us, we—

speaker: Walhart
text: Have you seen the battlefield? No, I suppose not. Take your head from wherever it's lodged, and peer out into the daylight, snake. I'm sure your mighty intellect will quickly understand what's happened. Though if you had half the mettle of that Ylissean tactician, you'd already know...

speaker: Excellus
text: M-Master, I don't—

speaker: Valmese
text: The dynasts, sir! From the southlands! They are making to siege the capital!

speaker: Excellus
text: But that's...that's impossible. We had an agreement! Just like I had with... Oh dear... The southern dynasts... Did they find out about Yen'fay?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: This...boggles the mind...

speaker: Chrom
text: Do you recognize them?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, sir. They're from the southlands... States that betrayed us for the empire. ...Or so I thought.

speaker: Flavia
text: Well, their allegiance seems clear enough now.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: I can hardly believe it... Theirs are the lands my brother commanded. Finally, now, they come to answer the call?

speaker: Flavia
text: Finally is right. It's taken a lot of hard work to get here, Say'ri. A lot of sacrifice. From you, from Basilio, from your brother. Don't forget this moment.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, my lady. Aye.

speaker: Chrom
text: Now, let us finish what we began. To the capital, friends!

speaker: Gangrel
text: What's this, then? The exalt herself, in all her radiance? I fear I must shield my eyes! Bwa ha ha ha!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: King Gangrel, I've come for the truth of this unfortunate incident between us.

speaker: Aversa
text: The truth? I can give you the truth.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Perhaps milady might first share her name?

speaker: Aversa
text: You may call me Aversa.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Very well, Aversa. Is Maribelle unharmed?

speaker: Gangrel
text: Who? Oh yes, that little blonde brat.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Unhand me, you gutter-born troglodyte!

speaker: Lissa
text: Maribelle!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Lissa? Darling, is that you?

speaker: Aversa
text: This girl crossed the Plegian border without our consent. And what's more... She wounded the brave Plegian soldiers who sought only to escort her safely home.

speaker: Maribelle
text: LIES! You speak nothing but lies, hag! Did they not teach the meaning of the word "truth" in wretched-crone school?!

speaker: Aversa
text: ...You see? No manners at all. Such a nasty little bird simply had to be caged.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Such a violent temper speaks to her guilt. This will call for a weighty punishment. And if she were to later confess to being an Ylissean spy? My goodness! It would take an act of CONSIDERABLE good faith to repair our relations.

speaker: Maribelle
text: I have done nothing wrong! It is they who should confess! They are the ones who invaded Ylisse. They razed an entire village! When I attempted to intervene, they took me and dragged me across the border. Let the plundered shops and charred homes of that village serve as my proof!

speaker: Gangrel
text: That would only prove Ylisse has a bandit problem—something I hear oft of late... But indeed, tonight I shall weep salty tears into my pillow for your dead villagers.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Your Grace, please!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Peace, Maribelle. I believe you. King Gangrel, I request that you release this woman at once. Surely you and I can sort out these affairs without the need of hostages.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Without so much as an apology? Why should I even bother with parley? I'm within my rights to have her head this instant and be home in time for supper.

speaker: Chrom
text: You black-hearted devil!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Control your dog, my dear, before he gets someone hurt.

speaker: Chrom
text: Rrgh…

speaker: Gangrel
text: Now then, Your Graceliness. Perhaps we can arrange a trade? You give me the Fire Emblem, and I return Mari Contrary here in one piece.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: You would ask for Ylisse's royal treasure? But why?

speaker: Gangrel
text: Because I know the legend! The Fire Emblem is the key to having all one's wishes realized. I have desired it for years. YEARS! ...Yet my birthday comes and goes each year, and nothing from Ylisse. Heheh…

speaker: Emmeryn
text: The Emblem's power is meant for a single purpose, King Gangrel: to save the world and its people at their hour of most desperate need. Would you claim a more noble wish?

speaker: Gangrel
text: I want what every Plegian wants—a grisly end for every last Ylissean! What could be more noble than that?

speaker: Emmeryn
text: What?

speaker: Gangrel
text: Surely you have not forgotten what the last exalt did to my people? Your father named us heathens! His "crusade" across Plegia butchered countless of my subjects and my kin!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...I have never denied Ylisse's past wrongdoings. But I have sworn to never repeat those mistakes. Ours is now a realm of peace.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Yours is now a haven of hypocrisy! Now give me the Fire Emblem!

speaker: Maribelle
text: No, Your Grace! I'd sooner die than act as a bargaining chip for this filthy reprobate!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: No, Maribelle…

speaker: Gangrel
text: Ugh... Taaaaaalk talk-talk-talk-talk. It's time to speak louder than words! This negotiation is over, Your Luminosity! I shall have the Emblem if I have to pry it from your shiny dead hands!

speaker: Chrom
text: Stay back! Or you'll all suffer the same fate!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Now that's a declaration of war if I've ever heard one... A big, messy war that will bleed you Ylisseans dry. Bwa ha ha!

speaker: Aversa
text: Poor, stupid girl... Are you really worth fighting a war over? Years from now, you'll be remembered only as she who destroyed House Ylisse.

speaker: Maribelle
text: No... That's not... Oh, Lissa... Please, no…

speaker: Ricken
text: Maribelle! Go! You're free!

speaker: Maribelle
text: RICKEN?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Ricken
text: Just run! We can talk about it later!

speaker: Aversa
text: Oh, is this your little boyfriend? Isn't he just precious.

speaker: Ricken
text: Don't talk down to me, witch!

speaker: Aversa
text: Nngh! W-wind magic?

speaker: Ricken
text: Come on, Maribelle!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Right!

speaker: Aversa
text: Wretched whelp! I should... No. Our soldiers have them outnumbered. The brats will be dead long before they can reach their comrades.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Bwa ha ha! I have my war! Captain Orton! Remain here, and take down as many Ylisseans as you can. You can expect reinforcements from the forts as well. Now, do your best—at doing your worst! Bwa ha!

speaker: Orton
text: I won't ask for your name. Only your life!

speaker: Orton
text: This matters not. Soon war will be upon...your soil... Heh heh...

speaker: Lissa
text: Maribelle! Are you hurt?!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Nothing I didn't return twofold, darling.

speaker: Robin
text: I'm glad you're safe.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Who...? Oh. It's you.

speaker: Robin
text: Yes. I know you're not especially fond of me, but it's a relief just the same.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Oh, it's not a question of fondness. I am simply protective of Lissa. My treasure is very sensitive, and... Wait. Am I really justifying myself to a commoner? Gods... Yes, well, I do...apologize for being curt. And... And... And you have my thanks for your part in the rescue. There, I said it!

speaker: Chrom
text: Forgive me, Emm. I acted rashly.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: It's all right, Chrom. King Gangrel is the one at fault here. You were only protecting me.

speaker: Frederick
text: The Mad King will be rallying his forces, if they have not mobilized already. I suggest we make haste back to Ylisstol and discuss our strategy.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Of course, Frederick. It seems war is upon us. We must protect the Ylissean people at all costs.

speaker: Lissa
text: Ugh, my poor feet. I've got blisters the size of eggs!

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, it's not so bad, Lissa. Just a healthy little stroll! How are you holding up, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: My legs feel like pudding... Your endurance astounds me, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: Hah! Should I carry you?

speaker: Lissa
text: You can carry me! ...No, seriously. I would really be okay with you carrying me.

speaker: Hierarch
text: Hmm…

speaker: Frederick
text: Is something troubling you, Hierarch? You keep glancing up at the peaks.

speaker: Hierarch
text: Hmm? Oh, I'm just a b-bit nervous I'm afraid. Gh-ghastly times, these!

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, who is that?

speaker: Chrom
text: The hierarch? He's been a friend of House Ylisse for many years. He guided Emmeryn during the early years of her rule. Why do you ask?

speaker: Robin
text: I can't quite put my finger on it, but something feels…

speaker: Plegian
text: Grah ha hah! Time to die, princey!

speaker: Chrom
text: Plegian soldiers? Damn! How did they know we were here? Everyone! Prepare for battle!

speaker: Vasto
text: *Sniiiiiiff* Ahhhhhhhhh... Smell that, men? The winds of fortune are blowing our way!

speaker: Hierarch
text: Hold, sir! I am the man King Gangrel told you about! Did you not receive orders to take me into your protection?

speaker: Vasto
text: I've orders to protect a man, true... But I see no man here! ...Only a pig! A rasher of traitorous bacon that sold out his own sovereign! And what do we do with little piggies, mmm?

speaker: Hierarch
text: Well, you... I mean, perhaps... You let them go free?

speaker: Vasto
text: Oh, are you a chicken now? Bawk bawk! We've a whole barnyard in our midst! Well, it don't matter what you are. The axe will fall just the same!

speaker: Hierarch
text: Eeeeeeeeeeeek!

speaker: Vasto
text: Right! Now for the main event. By moon's end, they'll be erecting statues of me in the capital! Ho there! Ylisseans! Give me the Fire Emblem and your wench of a ruler, and spare yourselves a gory end!

speaker: Chrom
text: Phila, take Emmeryn to the rear of the column. We'll fend off these blackguards!

speaker: Cordelia
text: Huff, huff...* No! Plegians here as well?! Prince Chrom! Captain Phila! Beware! Enemy reinforcements to the rear! They'll be upon us soon!

speaker: Phila
text: Is that... Gods, Cordelia?!

speaker: Robin
text: Cordelia?

speaker: Phila
text: She's one of my knights. Young yet, but quite gifted. But she was stationed on the border... Why...? Oh, gods! Could it mean...?

speaker: Cordelia
text: Nngh! Curse me, I am weak! I must retreat...

speaker: Vasto
text: I'll splatter you across the canyon floor!

speaker: Vasto
text: You doves think...killing me will change anything? Heh... Even now, my brothers storm across your precious border... Go on, dear exalted coward! Run! Flee while they slaughter your subjects! Save yourself... Let their faith in you...bleed away...with the rest...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...They're gone.

speaker: Cordelia
text: Your Grace! My prince! Run! As far and fast as you can! More Plegians are coming, not a half day's march behind you!

speaker: Phila
text: Cordelia, what are you doing here? ...Tell me the border remains secure!

speaker: Cordelia
text: That I could, milady! But it would be false... Gangrel himself led his might against us! The end was upon us when my knight-sisters begged me fly and warn the exalt... I should have stayed... I should have stayed! Ah, gods, I can still hear the screams…

speaker: Phila
text: Peace, Cordelia. You did your duty. The sisters rightly prized your youth. You've many years yet to keep their legacy alive.

speaker: Cordelia
text: But I abandoned them! I'm weak... Their legacy deserves better.

speaker: Phila
text: Sometimes fleeing takes the most courage. They knew that. Now pull yourself together. Let the faith they showed in you give you strength.

speaker: Cordelia
text: Captain Phila, I... How can I go on like this? They were my...my family... *sob* Gods... Oh, gods…

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn those monsters!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: I must return to the capital.

speaker: Phila
text: Your Grace, I cannot advise—

speaker: Emmeryn
text: I should never have left. If it's discovered I'm away when this news comes to light... The people could panic. Riot. More Ylisseans could needlessly die. Here, Chrom. I entrust this to you.

speaker: Chrom
text: The Fire Emblem?

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Take it to Ferox—to safety.

speaker: Chrom
text: And leave you? No, Emm.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: No part of House Ylisse matters more than the Emblem. It possesses tremendous power. But too much blood has been shed over it already. I hope it finds a better guardian in you than it did me.

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm, come on. You can't... Don't talk like that! You sound like you're ready to give up…

speaker: Emmeryn
text: I am not giving up, Chrom. I am only giving what I can.

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm, please! This is madness!

speaker: Lissa
text: Sis, wait! Let me go with you!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Stay with Chrom, Lissa. I command it.

speaker: Lissa
text: This isn't fair! It's not fair! I know our people need you, but we need you, too!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Dry your tears, love. This is not good-bye.

speaker: Phila
text: Your Grace, the pegasus knights will accompany you to Ylisstol.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Very well, Phila. Thank you.

speaker: Frederick
text: I will keep the prince and princess safe, Your Grace. You have my word.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: I know you will, Frederick. Thank you.

speaker: Frederick
text: It is my honor.

speaker: Phila
text: Cordelia. You will stay here with Chrom.

speaker: Cordelia
text: But, Captain—

speaker: Phila
text: I know your heart is heavy, but this is how it must be. Your knight-sisters will be with you in spirit, wherever you go.

speaker: Cordelia
text: ...May they give me strength. As you command, Captain. I will pray for your safety.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Come, Phila. We must go.

speaker: Chrom
text: No! You don't have to go! This is absurd!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom, you don't—

speaker: Chrom
text: Walking to your own death will not bring peace to anyone! Ylisse needs you. WE need you! Be selfish for once in your life!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...... I love you, Chrom. Both you and Lissa are my everything. As for the peace I seek... You cannot see who it is for. I have to go. I'm sorry—I truly am. Let us embrace again in Ylisstol when you arrive with Feroxi reinforcements. I know you will come.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...This is a terrible plan.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: The blood of the first exalt flows strong in us. You and I will keep Ylisse safe. I believe it with all my heart. Safe journey, Chrom. Safe journey, Lissa.

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm... Emm?! Ah...

speaker: Lissa
text: B-but she's safe inside the castle, right? Phila and the others will protect her! And Khan Flavia is assembling her best troops as we speak. We'll make it back home in time. I know we will!

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom? Say something! Say, "Yes, of course we will!"

speaker: Chrom
text: ...I'm sorry, Lissa. What?

speaker: Lissa
text: Ugh, fine! Never mind! Let me know when you get out of your own head for a second!

speaker: Sumia
text: Snap out of it, Captain!

speaker: Chrom
text: OW! ...What the hell was that for?!

speaker: Sumia
text: Oh no! ...Did I do it wrong? Captain Phila said sometimes a good slap will break someone out of their doldrums.

speaker: Lissa
text: Sumia, when you slap someone, you do it with an open palm. You just punched Chrom in the face!

speaker: Sumia
text: Um... It's the thought that counts?

speaker: Chrom
text: Gods, that seriously hurt…

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha ha! What's wrong, my dear prince? Sometimes love hurts! You're lucky to have strong women like these, and not just dainty flowers about. In any case, I bring good news. The Feroxi army has finally mobilized. Every last man is itching to fight. I must say, I'm looking forward to savoring a skirmish or two myself.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Wait. You're coming along?

speaker: Flavia
text: Of course! A khan must have her fun. I'm even bringing my insignificant other.

speaker: Robin
text: Your who?

speaker: Flavia
text: Basilio. The oaf isn't good for much, but he might stop a few stray arrows.

speaker: Basilio
text: Chrom! Good gods, I've been looking for you everywhere!

speaker: Chrom
text: Is something wrong?

speaker: Basilio
text: Our scouts have reported back. Dark news, I'm afraid... Ylisstol...has fallen.

speaker: Chrom
text: What?!

speaker: Basilio
text: The Plegians captured your exalt and retreated back across their lines. Gangrel has declared she's to be publicly executed within the moon.

speaker: Chrom
text: E-executed?!

speaker: Lissa
text: Ooooh…

speaker: Robin
text: Lissa? Lissa!

speaker: Flavia
text: The dastard's not even trying to be subtle anymore.

speaker: Robin
text: I agree. It's an obvious trap.

speaker: Basilio
text: The Mad King knew our scouts would relay this information back. It's clearly a provocation—a hot brand to the buttocks! We should consider our options carefully before jumping to any—

speaker: Chrom
text: Shepherds! We march to Plegia!

speaker: Basilio
text: *Ahem* Well, that would be ONE option, yes... But perhaps we've seen enough royalty waltzing into traps for one war already, eh?

speaker: Chrom
text: I don't care if it's a trap, Basilio. He's going to murder my sister!

speaker: Flavia
text: Peace, Chrom. Breathe a moment. No one's suggesting we don't act. We're simply saying we should act WISELY. We'll need guts AND wits in equal measure if we're to save your sister.

speaker: Robin
text: The khans are right. I'll think of something, Chrom. I promise.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...All right, Robin. I leave it to you to formulate our strategy.

speaker: Flavia
text: Are you certain you're up to the task, Robin? It won't be easy. You hold the exalt's life in one hand, and all of ours in the other.

speaker: Robin
text: A responsibility I do not take lightly. But I am equal to the challenge.

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha ha! You've got stones, at least. I like that!

speaker: Basilio
text: No hesitation, no mincing words... He's/She's either a genius or a fool! I suppose we'll find out once we march. Hold on to your tassets, Ylisseans. We've an exalt to save!

speaker: Excellus
text: Th-they... There must be several hundred thousand soldiers out there! Would they dare...?! Is it... Is it possible... Is it possible it was Yen'fay they feared all along, and not me?!

speaker: Walhart
text: Without him to back it up, your threat was only the grand shadow of a tiny spider.

speaker: Excellus
text: Tiny spider, is it? Well this spider has woven other webs in secret you could not even—

speaker: Walhart
text: You mean how you blackmailed Yen'fay to keep his loyalty? Or perhaps your correspondence with the Plegian woman...Aversa, was it? Yes, I know you have designs on the Fire Emblem... You have no secrets from me, worm.

speaker: Excellus
text: B-b-b-but... I... I don't... If you...knew all of that...w-why...

speaker: Walhart
text: Why haven't I killed you? ...I've asked myself the same thing, several times... But you're no threat to me. And I admit, you have your uses. Besides, I'm not one for court jesters, but you do...amuse me.

speaker: Excellus
text: Amuse you? I AMUSE you, like I'm a jester?! Are you AMUSED now? With a million swords at your door, come for your head?! You've lost! Lost, and you are going to DIE! All of you, ALL OF YOU! But not me! I want no part of this suicide!

speaker: Walhart
text: ...Why, Excellus, did you just volunteer to lead my personal guard against the rebels?

speaker: Excellus
text: ...What?! No, that's—

speaker: Walhart
text: Unless you'd rather fight me. Right here. RIGHT NOW.

speaker: Excellus
text: Mercy! Mercy! F-forgive me, my master! A moment's madness only—it will not return!

speaker: Walhart
text: Then it's settled: we have our new captain of the guard. Congratulations, Captain. You'll be right at my side until the fray is upon us. (Walhart leaves)

speaker: Excellus
text: *Pant, pant, pant, pant*

speaker: Cervantes
text: Do give our guests a warm welcome, snake. Perhaps offer them some of your tea? Hah hah... My equal... Pah! (Cervantes leaves)

speaker: Excellus
text: ...They forget who I am. I could have fried them both where they stood with my magic! We will crush these rebels... We MUST crush these rebels... Or maybe...if Walhart is sufficiently injured...I might "amuse" him with a spell... Nya ha, either way, this spider crawls out alive! Eee hee hee hee!

speaker: Chrom
text: I see Walhart, still seated in his throne room. It doesn't seem like he's thinking about escape.

speaker: Robin
text: And his soldiers... They look ready to die before they'd surrender. One must admire their loyalty, at least.

speaker: Chrom
text: He does inspire that in people. It's part of what makes him so dangerous.

speaker: Robin
text: He inspires that in SOME people.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, in some. But not me.

speaker: Soldier
text: Rally every last man! We make our stand with Emperor Walhart!

speaker: Cervantes
text: Let's have it then, rebellious scum! Like a flimsy belt around the waist of defeat, you shall buckle here!

speaker: Cervantes
text: I...am finished... Nngh... But I have no regrets... I die in the shadow of...greatness...

speaker: Excellus
text: You think I'm afraid? Of YOU?! Come, then. COME AT ME!

speaker: Walhart
text: You would challenge the Conqueror himself?!

speaker: Walhart
text: Nngh... Do you see? Often the sword...is the only way... My conquest...ends here...

speaker: Excellus
text: ...You. ...YOU! You and Yen'fay cost me EVERYTHING!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: I only pray my brother is watching... Yen'fay, guide my hand!

speaker: Chrom
text: Walhart!

speaker: Walhart
text: Prince...

speaker: Chrom
text: Will you surrender?

speaker: Walhart
text: Don't waste my time with questions you know the answers to, boy.

speaker: Chrom
text: It did not have to be this way... You believe in mankind's strength... So did my sister. You believe that we are masters of our destinies... So do I. You could have joined us.

speaker: Walhart
text: ME, JOIN YOU?! Does a pegasus join with the flea on its back? A dragon, with a cow it eats?! You forget your place, BOY. I am the Conqueror! I will unite the world!

speaker: Chrom
text: No! ...I will. And not by forcing all the people to choose the sword or the knee. Peace will only come by stoking people's hearts...not their fear.

speaker: Walhart
text: You think that's what you've done? What your sister did before you? No, she shouted some nonsense and leapt off a rock! Such weakness!

speaker: Chrom
text: Wrong. Not weakness—strength. That one act lives on, and WILL live on, longer than all your conquests...

speaker: Walhart
text: And longer than you will... Come then, flea, and die for your peace!

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm, I tried...

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord! Walhart's soldiers have agreed to cease hostilities.

speaker: Chrom
text: Finally... Then pull our men back immediately. ...It's strange, Frederick... Walhart and my sister were complete opposites. One gave her life to stop a war. The other took lives to create one. And yet they both inspired those around them; both walked a path to end all war. Both lived, and died, trying to unite the people.

speaker: Lucina
text: Yes, Father, but as they say, the method is the message. Your father suffered from beliefs similar to Walhart, and his legacy is plain to see...

speaker: Chrom
text: Mmm...these are matters too weighty for this moment. There will be plenty of time for reflection now that the war is done.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Sir Chrom, a thousand thanks from every Valmese couldn't repay what you did for us. But I recovered Vert, the Gemstone that was stolen from Chon'sin as a trophy.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're giving it to me?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Of course, sir. It seems the fell dragon will soon threaten us all. I would feel safer knowing the Gemstone was in your hands.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then so it will be. Thank you, Say'ri.

speaker: Chrom
text: Are we packed and saddled? Our business in Valm is finished, but we have another task ahead. One perhaps even more dire than we faced here... To Ylisstol!

speaker: Chrom
text: *Sigh*

speaker: Robin
text: I know that face... "Dueling with unpleasant thoughts," are we?

speaker: Chrom
text: You know me well, Robin.

speaker: Robin
text: Hey, remember when Lissa first brought me here? When I met all the Shepherds? And Sumia... Ha ha! Oh, what a day! ...Actually, that's my first memory, in a way.

speaker: Chrom
text: Heh, I suppose so. I wish all our memories since could have been as joyful.

speaker: Robin
text: I know... So much needless bloodshed. So many days of pain and doubt and fighting... We would have never made it without you there to guide us, you know.

speaker: Chrom
text: Funny. I was going to say the same to you.

speaker: Robin
text: I guess we really are two halves of the same whole.

speaker: Chrom
text: I've sent Frederick to search for Sable, the final Gemstone. And I've been reading more about the Awakening ritual. It seems that whoever attempts the rite must brave Naga's fire. If both body and spirit survive the agony, they are blessed with the dragon's power. Otherwise, the candidate...dies.

speaker: Lucina
text: What?! No! ...Er, that is... Father, must you attempt this? (Lucina enters)

speaker: Chrom
text: Eavesdropping, young lady?

speaker: Lucina
text: Forgive me, Father. I didn't intend to... I came to speak with you, but I couldn't find the right moment and—

speaker: Chrom
text: It's all right, Lucina. And yes, I'll be all right, too. I will withstand Naga's fire. I'm sure of it.

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, I have returned. (Frederick enters)

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, Frederick? Did you find it?

speaker: Frederick
text: I believe so, sire. King Validar has extended an invitation. He says Plegia has been guarding Sable, and now he wishes to return it to you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Validar...

speaker: Frederick
text: They sent word to me, milord. They must have caught wind of my search... In any case, Validar asks that you visit him in person, that he might formally present it. Perhaps needless to say, milord, but I don't like this one bit.

speaker: Chrom
text: Neither do I, Frederick the Wary. Neither do I. At best, it's selfish political maneuvering at a time when the world can ill afford it. At worst, our run-in with those Risen last visit was no accident... But we will meet with him. Send word at once.

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, are you...certain that's wise?

speaker: Chrom
text: No, but we haven't time to be certain. ...And my sister never refused a diplomatic gesture, no matter how foul smelling. If he doesn't give us the stone, he may at least reveal where it is. ...Don't worry, Frederick. I'm not walking into this blindly. We will make certain everyone is armed to the teeth.

speaker: Frederick
text: Then the Fire Emblem, milord—you ought at least leave it behind.

speaker: Chrom
text: Unless that's what Validar expects, and he comes to steal it with my best men away... No, it's safest with me, for now. We'll learn the truth of Validar's motive soon enough...

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you ready, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, first I have a favor to ask...

speaker: Chrom
text: As long as it's not a request to leave you behind.

speaker: Robin
text: It's not...though I did consider it. I can't hurt you if I'm not there in the first place. But...I can't run from Validar forever. And if I'm going to overcome him, my best chance is with you by my side.

speaker: Chrom
text: That's more like it.

speaker: Robin
text: But therein lies the favor... If Validar somehow does gain control over me... Promise me... Promise me you'll cut me down.

speaker: Chrom
text: You can't mean that. You can't ASK that!

speaker: Robin
text: I'll resist him with all that I am. I promise you. But there are other people involved here— too many people to ignore... You have a duty to protect them as well.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...You're right. The words burn my tongue, but you're right. But you mustn't let Validar seize control! Whatever it takes. Whatever the cost!

speaker: Robin
text: I'll try. You know I will.

speaker: Chrom
text: Validar!

speaker: Validar
text: Chrom... Come to witness the glorious culmination of your failure? How nice. I have the Fire Emblem, and the Dragon's Table is set for a feast. I will return Grima to this world!

speaker: Chrom
text: You'll DESTROY the world! Lucina has seen it!

speaker: Validar
text: Then I pray today's spectacle lives up to her nightmares! The Awakening rite is not only for exalts and Naga, you know. With it, I'll arouse Grima! The fell dragon needs only a mortal vessel, which you so kindly brought along...

speaker: Robin
text: ...Oh, gods. He means me.

speaker: Validar
text: You ken quickly, Robin. That's my boy/girl.

speaker: Robin
text: No! Never! I'll die first!

speaker: Validar
text: You carry my blood—the blood of the fell dragon. His soul slumbers within you. And now the time has come to awaken you both!

speaker: Robin
text: ...Wh-what?! I'M Grima? I'M the fell dragon?!

speaker: Validar
text: The Grimleal have worked for generations to create someone like you... A vessel worthy of our master. Simply having Grima's blood in your veins is not enough... My father was not worthy, nor was his father before him. Even I was not able to accept Grima's most sacred gift. But you? You had all the makings. You were perfection!

speaker: Robin
text: N-no...

speaker: Validar
text: If your damnable mother hadn't been seized by weakness and fear... She betrayed us—stole you from your crib, and fled with you in the night! I know naught of your life thereafter; but all that matters is your return. That you are here is PROOF of your purpose! it is why you still draw breath!

speaker: Chrom
text: You've proven nothing but your own madness. Robin... We are going to stop this. This can be stopped. YOU can be stopped!

speaker: Validar
text: You may have killed me in some future past, but I am stronger this time! With the power of the Dragon's Table flowing through me, I am unstoppable.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're not the only one stronger this time! Right, Robin? ...Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: Nngh...

speaker: Chrom
text: Stay with me, Robin! You're not beholden to this fiend! You can fight it! We've all seen how strong you are! We've seen what you're capable of! Don't let him shake your resolve!

speaker: Robin
text: C-Chrom, I... I don't know.

speaker: Validar
text: Enough! This sorry display ill befits the heir to our master's power. And you, Prince—your sad poem sounds lovely, but it will not alter destiny.

speaker: Robin
text: They're more than just words!

speaker: Validar
text: Be still now, my son/daughter...

speaker: Robin
text: My life did not begin with you. It began the day Chrom found me in that field. I have been all over this world, and I have helped change it—for the better. I have fought and laughed and bled with my friends, and THAT is what matters! The ties we forged, the bonds we share—they are of a power greater than Grima.

speaker: Validar
text: A ludicrous idea, as you will know better than anyone soon enough...

speaker: Robin
text: We do agree on one thing: my life so far has all been in preparation for this moment... When I kill you or die trying!

speaker: Validar
text: Heh heh heh. You have your father's courage, but your mother's judgment... Very well, pup. Come! Do your worst! Come at me with all you have! There is no damage I can do your body that the fell dragon cannot repair!

speaker: Chrom
text: This is it! Our final battle! You're one of us, Robin, and no "destiny" can change that. Now let's kill this dastard and be done with it!

speaker: Validar
text: So long as the dark barrier stands, no other soul can reach us. You must face your grim fate alone!

speaker: Validar
text: Come, my Grimleal! Smite these infidels!

speaker: Validar
text: Destiny is your master, one way or the other!

speaker: Validar
text: Heh heh... Even this...was meant to be...

speaker: Validar
text: Heh ha, are you so eager to meet your end, little Prince? You WILL die here. Your future is already written.

speaker: Chrom
text: I tell you again: I make my own future. And it's one you'll not live to see!

speaker: Validar
text: Robin, why insist on these games? You only delay the inevitable. And besides, the alternative? Have you considered what happens should I fall? These followers of Naga will spurn you now that they've learned what you are. Kill me, and you incur the wrath of the Grimleal as well... Would you truly choose to be so utterly alone?

speaker: Validar
text: Humans are weak, pathetic creatures... Your "bonds" with them will bind you. You are destined for a greater purpose! The GREATEST purpose! You are to be a GOD!

speaker: Robin
text: ...Not your god—not today.

speaker: Validar
text: This isn't over... Damn you BOTH!

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you all right? That's the end of him. Thanks to you we carried the day. We can rest easy now. At long last...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...What's wrong? Hey, hang on!

speaker: Chrom
text: This is not your—your fault... Promise me you'll escape from this place... Please, go...

speaker: Lucina
text: N-no... Father! No!

speaker: Validar
text: With the five Gemstones in hand, my magic knows no bounds. Robin is powerless to resist me. Do you see now, Son/Daughter? Human bonds are leaves in the wind. They offer you nothing.

speaker: Lucina
text: This can't be happening. We were supposed to change this! Everything I have done is...worthless.
The hell it was!

speaker: Lucina
text: Huh? I know that voice...

speaker: Basilio
text: Don't you put any stock in this destiny hogwash! Let the dead whine about their fate... As long as I draw breath, I choose to keep fighting! That's what life is all about!

speaker: Lucina
text: Khan Basilio! I-I thought... We all thought you were—

speaker: Basilio
text: Worm food, back in Valm? It almost went that way. But I scraped by, thanks to you.

speaker: Lucina
text: I don't understand.

speaker: Basilio
text: Once I took a couple hits from Walhart, I knew he was too strong for me. Normally pride would've had me dead before I'd even thought twice about it. But your warning gave me the courage to be a coward, hah ha! I played dead like a big, bald opossum! It wasn't hard. In truth I almost WAS dead. You saved my life, Lucina. Had you not said anything... I'd have stood my ground against that monster and died on the spot.

speaker: Lucina
text: Oh, Basilio!

speaker: Validar
text: This...does...not...MATTER! If you didn't die there, then you can die HERE!

speaker: Basilio
text: Hah! You're no Walhart, snake eyes! Not as strong, or even as clever... For example: you STILL haven't realized that you've been tricked.

speaker: Validar
text: What?!

speaker: Basilio
text: Robin predicted everything that would happen here. He/She saw it in a dream. Saw this very fight with you.

speaker: Validar
text: If you think—

speaker: Basilio
text: Guess what else was in the dream? The five Gemstones. When Flavia gave my stone to Chrom, Robin saw what fate had in store. He/She knew Chrom couldn't bring the real Gemstones here to Plegia. That would be like swinging a big, juicy steak right in front of destiny's choppers!

speaker: Validar
text: Gya ha ha! A worthy bluff, Feroxi fool, but ridiculous all the same. I've had your merry little band watched since Carrion Isle. Your every move! So I know Robin hasn't touched the stones—he/she hasn't been near them!

speaker: Basilio
text: You watched our party, yes—the members your men knew about; the live ones. But they weren't watching dead men, were they? ...They weren't watching me.

speaker: Validar
text: I... No, that's not—

speaker: Basilio
text: Heh, looks like it might be finally starting to sink in...

speaker: Validar
text: That is not possible! These have to be... They must be...

speaker: Basilio
text: Why? Because of...DESTINY? PAH ha ha! Robin had your destiny beat days ago, when he/she came up with this plan. The expression on your face...it makes all those long nights in hiding worth it. Hah!

speaker: Validar
text: Damn you! Damn you to all the hells! None of this matters! Chrom is dead! Your fates sealed! Grima will— ...Eh?

speaker: Validar
text: No...

speaker: Lucina
text: Father! You're alive!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin...spared me... He/She weakened his/her magic...just before the strike...

speaker: Validar
text: GRAAAAAAGH! Damn you all, and your stones! I won't need them to kill you!

speaker: Chrom
text: Ready to end this, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: Let's do it. I'm ready to see what our true future has in store.

speaker: Chrom
text: We will. Now. Together.

speaker: Basilio
text: Chrom! Robin! We're yours to command!

speaker: Flavia
text: Let's put this dastard down, for good this time!

speaker: Validar
text: Rrgh... F-fools... Destiny cannot...be...unraveled...!

speaker: Validar
text: No...nngh! All...wrong...

speaker: Lucina
text: Die, Validar!

speaker: Validar
text: Impudent meddler! You have failed to change the future at every turn. What makes you think this time will be different?!

speaker: Lucina
text: Perhaps it won't... But either way, it's no reason to spare your miserable life!

speaker: Validar
text: Why... Why would you squander your birthright... Robin...my son/daughter...

speaker: Chrom
text: We did it! We did it, Robin! We've altered our destiny! We... We've won.

speaker: Robin
text: You!

speaker: Future Robin
text: You may have altered the course of history, but not its destination.

speaker: Robin
text: What do you mean?!

speaker: Future Robin
text: It is still written that Chrom died here at your hands. Or, perhaps to be more precise...mine.

speaker: Chrom
text: Who are you, really?!

speaker: Future Robin
text: I told you, I'm Robin. The Robin that murdered you and became the fell dragon, Grima. When this "Marth" of yours decided to come back in time...I came with her.

speaker: Robin
text: Another version of me? But how...?

speaker: Future Robin
text: *Sigh* I can be so daft sometimes... It's really quite simple. I am you. Our only difference is the decisions we've made... Those vivid dreams you have—those are my memories. We share those memories because we share the same heart... Grima's heart.

speaker: Robin
text: Th-the headaches... The voices... It was you!

speaker: Future Robin
text: Your recollection begins the day I entered this world. I intended for us to unite then, the first moment I found you. But your heart was still too weak to contain Grima's power... The shock of my attempt wiped your memory clean.

speaker: Future Robin
text: I knew if Lucina managed to rewrite history, Grima would never be resurrected. And I, in turn, would cease to exist. So I had to step in, now and again, to keep my future secured. Like when Validar was killed in his attempt to assassinate Emmeryn... But that is the past, now. We have our future past to think of. All that remains is for you to become Grima, as I did. Then you and I will become as one, and we can reclaim my power.

speaker: Robin
text: We are not yet the same?

speaker: Future Robin
text: ...You were supposed to choose godhood over your pathetic band of servants. But if you'll not claim the sacrifice laid at the Dragon's Table... I will claim it in your place!

speaker: Robin
text: What?!

speaker: Future Robin
text: Myeh heh ha ha ha! The fell dragon and I are one! And though my journey through time has diminished my power...the life force here shall renew me!

speaker: Chrom
text: All right. Now what?

speaker: Lucina
text: Grima. It's all over...

speaker: Lucina
text: That's Grima! That's the demon who destroyed my world. And now he is among us...

speaker: Frederick
text: The terrible size of it...gods! For once the legends spoke true. We can't face him, not in a straight battle—he'd kill us all!

speaker: Chrom
text: If only we still had the Fire Emblem, we could ask Naga for her power. Then at least we'd have a chance.

speaker: Lissa
text: But Validar took the Emblem!

speaker: Chrom
text: And it was lost inside the Dragon's Table... I know.

speaker: Robin
text: What, you mean THIS Fire Emblem?

speaker: Chrom
text: The Emblem! But how...

speaker: Robin
text: I stole it from you once, remember? The least I could do was steal it back.

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin, you old dastard/sly cat. You never cease to amaze! Quickly now! We must complete the Awakening before Grima catches on!

speaker: Frederick
text: It's said the first exalt paid tribute to Naga at a site on Mount Prism.

speaker: Chrom
text: Do you know where, exactly?

speaker: Frederick
text: Yes. There is an altar at the peak of the mountain. If milord would perform the Awakening, it must be done there.

speaker: Chrom
text: A small hope is better than no hope at all. Hurry, everyone!

speaker: Lissa
text: Here we are! The Shepherds' garrison. Go on, Make yourself at home.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Lissa, my treasure! Are you all right? I've been on pins and needles!

speaker: Lissa
text: Oh, hey, Maribelle!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Oh hey yourself! I've sprouted 14 grey hairs fretting over you!

speaker: Lissa
text: Aw, you worry too much. I can handle a battle or two! ...Although I could do without the bugs and the bear barbecue...

speaker: Vaike
text: Hey, squirt! Where's Chrom? I bet he had a rough time out there without ol' Teach and his trusty axe!

speaker: Lissa
text: Oh, so you're "Teach" now, Vaike, is that it? Hee hee! And here I thought people were just born lacking wits. It can be taught?

speaker: Vaike
text: Ha! Never doubt the Vaike! ...Wait, was that an insult?

speaker: Sumia
text: Beg pardon, but when might we see the captian?

speaker: Maribelle
text: Poor Sumia. She's simply been beside herself with concern... Her eyes were scanning the horizon all day during training. ...She might have earned fewer bruises fighting blindfolded.

speaker: Lissa
text: Aw, Sumia, that's so sweet of you to worry about Chrom.

speaker: Sumia
text: Worry? Well, I... He's our captain and our prince- of course I'd worry!

speaker: Vaike
text: So, who's the stranger?

speaker: Lissa
text: No one's stranger than you Vaike... But allow me to introduce Robin! He/She just joined the Shepherds. Chrom's made him/her our new tactician. You should see all the tricks he/she's got up his/her sleeve!

speaker: Vaike
text: Oh yeah? Can he/she do this? *buuuuuurp*

speaker: Robin
text: I'm sure I have much to learn in the belching arts, "Teach." In any case, it's a pleasure to make your acquaintances.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Ugh, Vaike! That was abhorrent! Must you baseborn oafs pollute even the air with your buffoonery? And you, Robin! Don't encourage him! I'd hope you were cut from finer cloth. Hmph!

speaker: Sumia
text: Don't take it to heart, Robin. Maribelle warms to people slowly.

speaker: Lissa
text: Or burns too quickly! Hee hee! But yeah, just give her time.

speaker: Sumia
text: Ah! Captain! You've returned! I was- I mean, we were so-

speaker: Chrom
text: Sumia! Are you all right? ...Those boots of yours again?

speaker: Sumia
text: No! I mean, yes! I mean... *sigh*

speaker: Chrom
text: All right, listen, everyone: in the morning, we'll be marching to Regna Ferox.

speaker: Robin
text: Regna Ferox?

speaker: Sumia
text: A unified kingdom to Ylisse's north inhabitied by barbarians, or so it's said.

speaker: Chrom
text: Warriors are what they are, and we'll need their strength to quell thas new menace. Typically, the exalt would request such aid in person. But given recent events... Well, the people might worry should my sister suddenly leave the capital. So the task has been passed to us. Now, this mission is strictly voluntary. So if, for any-

speaker: Lissa
text: I volunteer!

speaker: Vaike
text: Me too! You'll be needin' ol' Teach along for such a delicate mission!

speaker: Kellam
text: I'll go as well. ...What? I've been here the whole time!

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, Sumia?

speaker: Sumia
text: It's just that... I'm not sure I'm quite ready for a proper mission just yet. I'd probably just get in the way.

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, you could stay behind the main group, and if a battle is met, just watch and learn? Your choice, of course. But some lessons can only be learned on the battlefield.

speaker: Sumia
text: W-well, if you think it wise, Captain.

speaker: Chrom
text: Just stay by me and you'll be fine.

speaker: Sumia
text: Oh, yes! I mean- Yes, sir, I'll do that!

speaker: Chrom
text: Is everyone ready? We've a long march ahead.

speaker: Stahl
text: W-wait for me!

speaker: Chrom
text: Stahl?

speaker: Stahl
text: Why am I the last to hear about this expedition to Ferox?

speaker: Lissa
text: Huh? Vaike was supposed to... Vaike! Did you forget to tell Stahl about our mission?

speaker: Vaike
text: The Vaike never forgets! ...I just don't always remember, is all...

speaker: Lissa
text: Ugh... I swear, you'd forget your own name if you weren't constantly saying it yourself! Speaking of which, are you SURE you remembered your axe this time?

speaker: Vaike
text: Hey! That was one time! ...Okay, twice, but training sessions don't count. Anyway, I got it right here. Teach is loaded and ready for action! Glad to have you along, Stahl, ol' buddy.

speaker: Stahl
text: That makes one of us. I was in such a hurry, I had to miss breakfast! There were muffins, and cakes, and... Well, I can tell you all about it while we march...

speaker: Robin
text: Your name is Stahl, right?

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Robin. This is Stahl, one of our finest.

speaker: Stahl
text: Hello, Robin. Miriel told me we had a new Shepherd. Er, Miriel's one of our mages. She should catch up soon.

speaker: Chrom
text: Gods, have the Risen spread this far?

speaker: Robin
text: Risen?

speaker: Frederick
text: We needed a name for this new threat, so the council gave them one.

speaker: Chrom
text: Everyone, remember what we're up against!

speaker: Vaike
text: Mya ha! They'll remember ME once I drive my axe into their... Wait... My axe. Where's my axe?! I had it a second ago!

speaker: Chrom
text: Vaike, this is no time for jokes...

speaker: Vaike
text: I'm serious! It's gone, but I JUST had it! It's got to be around here somewhere...

speaker: Chrom
text: Keep to the rear, then! The battle is nigh!

speaker: Frederick
text: All right, listen up. ...Especially those of you who BROUGHT weapons! All weapons have strengths and weaknesses to bear in mind. Lances have an advantage over swords, for example, while swords best axes. We'll want to work this into our strategy whenever possible.

speaker: Miriel
text: Splendid! It seems I've caught up. Now to extirpate these brutes... Hmm? Is that an axe? Why yes it is... Perhaps someone mislaid it? I'd not thought such dereliction permissible amoung the Shepherds. Still, I'd be remiss to not return this implement to its owner. Perhaps along with a stern word or two of disapprobation!

speaker: Vaike
text: Whoa! My axe!

speaker: Miriel
text: I wondered what manner of ignoramus would mislay their weapon. Now I know.

speaker: Vaike
text: Thanks, Miriel! ...Er, for the axe anyway!

speaker: Miriel
text: Perhaps next time I'll use a spell to fasten it to your hands... permanently.

speaker: Chrom
text: What's next, Robin? Guide our swords.

speaker: Frederick
text: Might I advise patience, milord? Robin is a fine tactician, but we have been working her/him mercilessly. Even the best of us needs rest.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, of course. I'm sorry.

speaker: Frederick
text: Perhaps Robin would prefer we choose our own actions at times.

speaker: Chrom
text: But how will we know?

speaker: Frederick
text: We could use a simple command that lets us fight on our own. So long as Robin realizes such a strategy does not guarantee victory. Acting as we see fit may not always lead us to the best course of action.

speaker: Risen Chief
text: Gwaaaaaar!

speaker: Risen Chief
text: Unnngh...

speaker: Chrom
text: Finally, and good riddance! But if they're appearing this far up the Northroad...

speaker: Frederick
text: Then no path is safe. We'll need to stay wary.

speaker: Robin
text: Well, what do we have here?

speaker: Lissa
text: Hey, is that what I think it is?

speaker: Chrom
text: It's a pegasus, all right. I think it's hurt. Let's just have a look here...

speaker: Chrom
text: WHOA! Down, girl! Easy there!

speaker: Sumia
text: Captain, one moment!

speaker: Chrom
text: Sumia! Are you all right? ...Those boots of yours again?

speaker: Sumia
text: No! I mean, Yes! I mean... *sigh*

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, come no closer. This beast is crazed!

speaker: Sumia
text: It's okay, Captain. I can handle this... Shhh... Easy now, girl. I won't hurt you.

speaker: Sumia
text: Shhh...

speaker: Robin
text: How did she calm it so quickly?

speaker: Lissa
text: That's incredible, Sumia!

speaker: Chrom
text: I've never seen anything like it.

speaker: Sumia
text: Oh, it's...it's nothing. Really. I just have a way with animals, I guess.

speaker: Chrom
text: I should say so!

speaker: Sumia
text: You all go ahead. I'll dress her wounds and catch up as soon as we're able.

speaker: Chrom
text: We can make time to wait for you.

speaker: Sumia
text: thank you, Captain. But I can manage. Every moment is precious when all of Ylisse is in danger.

speaker: Chrom
text: Right, then. Be safe, Sumia.

speaker: Sumia
text: As you command, sir.

speaker: Lissa
text: Whoaaa... I don't think I've ever felt so small...

speaker: Basilio
text: I can't even see the top of it!

speaker: Frederick
text: Most impressive indeed... So the shrine hides all the way up in its branches?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, sir. A great staircase inside the trunk leads up to it. However, the empire has closed off the only route to the steps. Or perhaps "roots" to the steps, I should say.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then we'll just have to break through. Come!

speaker: Cervantes
text: So! They arrive at last, eh wot! "Yes, come closer," said the hairy spider to the flies...

speaker: Soldier
text: General Cervantes! Lord Excellus was right—the Ylissean League approaches!

speaker: Cervantes
text: ...Are you daft, boy? Did you not hear what I was JUST saying?!

speaker: Soldier
text: A thousand pardons, sir!

speaker: Cervantes
text: Hmm... They must have some skill to make it this far... But no matter. We will show them the meaning of the word "fear"...

speaker: Soldier
text: The meaning of "beard," sir? Er, yes, I'm sure they would be most impressed.... But perhaps—

speaker: Cervantes
text: Fear, you deaf ignoramus! FEAR!

speaker: Soldier
text: Y-yes, sir! Of course, sir! ...Sorry, sir!

speaker: Cervantes
text: ...They are impressive, though, aren't they? My whiskers? Ha ha! I've not shaved since my very first battle. And have I ever lost? No! Not even once! Ergo, my moustache makes me invincible. It's science, my boy—science!

speaker: Cervantes
text: Heh ha, yes! "Come, reinforcements," said the spider to...the...other spiders.

speaker: Cervantes
text: My whiskers are safe against you lot—victory is inevitable!

speaker: Cervantes
text: Nngah! But...how can this be? My invincible moustache! Blasted science, you have...played me for a...fool...

speaker: Chrom
text: Fiend! You invade kingdoms and bully them into submission... Why? What does it achieve?

speaker: Cervantes
text: Do you even need ask, whelp? Emperor Walhart is destined to rule this world, plain and simple.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, but to what end?

speaker: Cervantes
text: Irrelevant! Walhart's mind is beyond the grasp of common men.

speaker: Chrom
text: So you don't even know what you're fighting for?

speaker: Cervantes
text: I tend to my own beard, boy. A soldier does not question orders. But he gives his loyalty—and maybe his life—in the service of greater men.

speaker: Chrom
text: Great men? Is living only to conquer so great an ambition?

speaker: Cervantes
text: What could be greater! Once I had dreams myself of commanding a nation... But Walhart? Aye, he dreams bigger. He would rule the entire world! Mine is nothing compared to the moxie of the Conqueror. I am but a single tiny hair on the beard of a flea in his great moustache! Have you not tasted the thrill of being part of something bigger than yourself?

speaker: Chrom
text: Not at the price of inflicting cruelty and suffering, no.

speaker: Cervantes
text: Hmph. Then we have nothing more to discuss. Prepare to learn the meaning of the word "beard." ...Fear, I mean fear!

speaker: Cervantes
text: ...Eh wot?! It cannot be! Say'ri—my mortal enemy...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: General Cervantes... Your reputation—and your gut—precedes you.

speaker: Cervantes
text: But we have met in battle before, girl! Have you forgotten?! Not long ago, you and I, locked in deadly combat. I was sure we had won the day until you appeared...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: ...Your beard again? Can you talk of nothing else, you imperial pig?!

speaker: Cervantes
text: Ap-PEARED! I said "appeared"! Just...never mind!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Marry! What fighting! I almost pity the enemies of Ylisse.

speaker: Chrom
text: Say'ri, do you know the way up to the shrine?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, sir. Follow me—and let us be quick about it!

speaker: Lissa
text: *Huff huff* Ugh... How many stairs are there in a case of stairs? Because I'm already sick of this stupid staircase!

speaker: Lucina
text: The Voice truly lives all the way up here?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Lady Tiki! Are you here? Prithee answer!

speaker: Tiki
text: *Yawn*

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Ah, my lady... I'm so relieved to see you're all right.

speaker: Lucina
text: So you are Lady Tiki? She who speaks for the divine dragon?

speaker: Tiki
text: ...Marth? Oh, Mar-Mar, is that you?!

speaker: Lucina
text: ...My name is Lucina, milady. Though I did go by the name Marth for a time. Might we have met?

speaker: Tiki
text: ...Alas, no. I'm sorry... You reminded me of someone I knew. But he is gone now. Lost during my endless sleep...

speaker: Tiki
text: You and your father are of the exalted bloodline, are you not?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, milady.

speaker: Tiki
text: Do you yet possess the Fire Emblem? It should have been passed down through your family...

speaker: Chrom
text: I... Yes, I have it...

speaker: Tiki
text: Ah! What relief to know it has not been lost. ...But where are the Gemstones? I see only Argent.

speaker: Chrom
text: Gemstones?

speaker: Tiki
text: Yes, there are five of them—Argent, Sable, Gules, Azure, and Vert. Each holds a portion of Naga's power. When mounted upon the Emblem, they allow one to perform the Awakening.

speaker: Frederick
text: The rite by which the first exalt channeled the divine dragon's power...

speaker: Tiki
text: The very same. With the Fire Emblem's power, the exalt was able to defeat Grima. But such power was too much for men, and so the Gemstones were scattered. I kept Azure here with me.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: My kingdom had safeguarded Vert for generations. But the gem was recently stolen by Walhart's men.

speaker: Lucina
text: Milady, do you know where the other two Gemstones might be?

speaker: Tiki
text: The remaining Gemstones, Sable and Gules, are no longer known to me. They may have been taken long ago, at the time of the Schism.

speaker: Basilio
text: Regna Ferox was founded during the Schism. As were most all nations in the realm, I believe.

speaker: Lissa
text: Wait—does that mean you guys have one of the Gemstones, Basilio?

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha! As if anyone would entrust the oaf with such a thing!

speaker: Basilio
text: Actually, it's true—we did keep one: Gules. ...Did I never inform you?

speaker: Flavia
text: You most certainly did not.

speaker: Basilio
text: Hmm... Must have slipped my mind. Regardless, yes. The West-Khans once safeguarded Gules. But it was lost long before my lifetime.

speaker: Tiki
text: Here. Take Azure, exalted ones. With it, you possess two of the five Gemstones. Now you must seek out the others and perform the Awakening. Our world must be defended from Grima at all costs!

speaker: Chrom
text: But I'm confused... I thought Grima's power was sealed away.

speaker: Tiki
text: Yes, but ever since, there have been those who would change that. Grima's life force grows even now, and with it, the long shadows of despair.

speaker: Chrom
text: When will he return? And where?

speaker: Tiki
text: I cannot know these things. But I can feel his presence... It looms, closer and closer... This task is a heavy burden, but as he of exalted blood, it must fall to you, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: I understand. Thank you, for all your help.

speaker: Robin
text: We owe you a great debt, milady.

speaker: Tiki
text: Ah! You... You have it...

speaker: Robin
text: ...What?

speaker: Tiki
text: You have power...like mine.

speaker: Robin
text: I do?

speaker: Tiki
text: I... Ah... Forgive me... I am still groggy from my slumber. My words outpace my thoughts.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Are you all right, my lady?

speaker: Tiki
text: I am fine... Just very tired... I haven't the strength to join you in the fray. Not yet. But I will call the people together, in prayer, for an end to this conflict.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Factions of the Resistance are already uniting in answer to the Voice's call! Soon bards will sing of this day... "They who conquered the Conqueror!"

speaker: Chrom
text: A tune I'm most anxious to hear.

speaker: Robin
text: But a man like Walhart will not roll over dead at the first sign of trouble...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, my lord...as you say. He will muster his forces to put down the Rebellion. Then his gaze will turn to us. Against his full might, we would not last long.

speaker: Chrom
text: Where are his armies garrisoned?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: The Valmese Imperial Army is comprised of three main divisions: one controls the north, one the south, and the third the lands between. Emperor Walhart commands the northern forces. Their might easily exceeds our own. The south is led by my brother, Yen'fay. His host is said to rival Walhart's.

speaker: Robin
text: Divisions, are they? Hmm...

speaker: Flavia
text: I see a plan brewing in those eyes of yours, Robin...

speaker: Robin
text: If we could divide their divisions—disrupt communications, supplies, et cetera... Then introduce misinformation to add to the confusion...a whisper here and there... The panic would spread on its own...and all the quicker for their great number. Such a giant force could collapse under its own weight.

speaker: Chrom
text: Say'ri—the third division, stationed between the other two...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, sir, at Fort Steiger, halfway along the highroad. In fact, not so far from where we stand now. We might stand a chance against them... But it would take speed, and luck. I wager Walhart and Yen'fay will hear of our exploits soon, if they haven't already. I suggest sending the bulk of our army to the north and south to mask our plan. An elite force, led by Sir Chrom, might then quietly slip through to Fort Steiger. What say you?

speaker: Chrom
text: I say, "aye."

speaker: Flavia
text: Aye.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Fie! We could all be dead before nightfall, yet not one of you so much as hesitates. Your courage is...an inspiration... Aye, we will win this war yet, by gods!

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom, we have to do SOMETHING.

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, what do you propose we do?

speaker: Lissa
text: Uh... I don't know!...

speaker: Chrom
text: I see you're awake now.

speaker: Lissa
text: Hey there!

speaker: Chrom
text: There are better places to take a nap than on the ground, you know.  Give me your hand.

speaker: Chrom
text: You all right?

speaker: Robin
text: Y-yes... Thank you, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: Ah, then you know who I am?

speaker: Robin
text: No, actually. I... It's strange... Your name, it just...came to me...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Hmm, how curious. Tell me, what's your name? What brings you here?

speaker: Robin
text: My name is... It's... Hmm?

speaker: Chrom
text: ...You don't remember your own name?

speaker: Robin
text: I'm not sure if... I'm sorry, but where am I, exactly?

speaker: Lissa
text: Hey, I've heard of this! It's called amnesia!

speaker: Frederick
text: It's called a load of pegasus dung.  We're to believe you remember milord's name, but not your own?

speaker: Robin
text: B-but it's the truth!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...What if it IS true, Frederick? We can't just leave him/her here, alone and confused. What sort of Shepherds would we be then?

speaker: Frederick
text: Just the same, milord. I must emphasize caution. 'Twould not do to let a wolf into our flock.

speaker: Chrom
text: Right then—we'll take him/her back to town and sort this out here.

speaker: Robin
text: Wait just one moment. Do I have a say in this?

speaker: Chrom
text: Peace, friend—I promise we'll hear all you have to say back in town. Now come.

speaker: Robin
text: What will you do with me? Am I to be your prisoner?

speaker: Chrom
text: Hah! You'll be free to go once we establish that you're no enemy of Ylisse.

speaker: Robin
text: Is that where we are? Ylisse?

speaker: Frederick
text: You've never heard of the halidom? Ha! Someone pay this actor/actress. He/She plays quite the fool! The furrowed brow is especially convincing…

speaker: Chrom
text: Frederick, please.  This land is known as the Halidom of Ylisse. Our ruler, Emmeryn, is called the exalt. I suppose proper introductions are in order... My name is Chrom—but then, you already knew that.  The delicate one here is my little sister, Lissa.

speaker: Lissa
text: I am NOT delicate! …Hmph!  Ignore my brother, please. He can be a bit thick sometimes. But you're lucky the Shepherds found you. Brigands would've been a rude awakening!

speaker: Robin
text: Shepherds? You tend sheep? ...In full armor?

speaker: Chrom
text: Heh, it's a dangerous job. Just ask Frederick the Wary here.

speaker: Frederick
text: A title I shall wear with pride. Gods forbid one of us keeps an appropriate level of caution. I have every wish to trust you, stranger, but my station mandates otherwise.

speaker: Robin
text: I understand, sir. I would do no less myself. My name is Robin. …I just remembered that. How odd. I suppose that's one mystery solved.

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin? Is that foreign? …Ah, well. We can discuss it later. We're almost to town. Once we—

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom, look! The town!

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn it! The town is ablaze! Those blasted brigands, no doubt... Frederick, Lissa! Quickly!

speaker: Frederick
text: What about him/her?

speaker: Chrom
text: Unless he's/she's on fire as well, it can wait!

speaker: Frederick
text: Aptly put, milord.

speaker: Lissa
text: Let's go already!

speaker: Robin
text: But what about— Hmm...

speaker: Garrick
text: Gwa ha ha! Get to it, lads! Grab anything shiny, and put the rest to the torch! We gots an example to set for these Ylissean types! Ain't that right, lass?

speaker: Maiden
text: S-stay away from me! Please! Someone! HEEEEEELP!

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom, we have to stop them!

speaker: Chrom
text: Don't worry—after today, these bandits won't be bothering anyone ever again…

speaker: Robin
text: Wait!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! You followed us! Why?

speaker: Robin
text: I… I'm not certain myself. But I'm armed, and I know my way around a fight if you'll have me.

speaker: Chrom
text: Of course—strength in numbers. Just stay close!

speaker: Frederick
text: Remember, Robin, we face practiced thieves and murderers. They will grant us no quarter. It's kill or be killed.

speaker: Chrom
text: So, Robin, I see you wear a sword. Is it— Wait, is that a tome? …You know magic?

speaker: Robin
text: I…believe so? I suppose I should check.

speaker: Chrom
text: You "believe so"? Perhaps I'll just keep a few paces behind you for the time being…

speaker: Robin
text: No, I can control it. I'm sure. Now, how did this work again? Ah, yes…

speaker: Lissa
text: We'll see who's delicate! I may not be able to attack like Chrom, but when you get injured? I'll be the one stitching your bones back together, care of my trusty staff! You just tell me where to go, Robin.

speaker: Chrom
text: Is anyone hurt? It would be foolish to leave a wound untreated.

speaker: Robin
text: Indeed. Timely use of a staff or a vulnerary should prevent the worst.

speaker: Chrom
text: Still with us, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm… It's strange. Here on the battlefield, I can… Well, I can "see" things.

speaker: Chrom
text: See things? Like what?

speaker: Robin
text: The enemy's strength, their weaponry, the flow of battle… I must have studied this somewhere.

speaker: Chrom
text: So, you're saying you can size up the enemy at a glance?

speaker: Robin
text: Yes, it would seem so. And perhaps more, if I apply myself…

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you all right, Robin? Don't rush into danger.

speaker: Robin
text: I'm fine, Chrom. Don't worry.

speaker: Chrom
text: You've lent us your strength, and that makes you a friend. Having an ally by my side gives me courage.

speaker: Robin
text: Thank you, but…I think there's more to it than that.

speaker: Chrom
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Robin
text: I believe there's a tactical advantage to fighting side by side… It's fuzzy… Wait, yes: working in pairs improves strength, defense, speed… Yes, yes, I'm sure of it!

speaker: Garrick
text: Here, sheepy sheepy! Come to the slaughter!

speaker: Garrick
text: Bwaaargh!

speaker: Robin
text: Well, that's the end of that.

speaker: Lissa
text: Lucky for the town, we were close by. But holy wow, Robin! You were incredible! Swords, sorcery, AND tactics! Is there anything you can't do?

speaker: Chrom
text: You're certainly no helpless victim, that much is for sure.

speaker: Frederick
text: Indeed. Perhaps you might even be capable of an explanation for how you came here?

speaker: Robin
text: I understand your skepticism, Sir Frederick. And I cannot explain why only some knowledge has returned to me. But please, believe me. I have shared all that I know.

speaker: Chrom
text: You fought to save Ylissean lives. My heart says that's enough.

speaker: Frederick
text: And your mind, milord? Will you now heed its council as well?

speaker: Chrom
text: Frederick, the Shepherds could use someone with Robin's talents. We've brigands and unruly neighbors, all looking to bloody our soil. Would you really have us lose such an able tactician? Besides, I believe his/her story, odd as it might be.

speaker: Robin
text: Th-thank you, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: So how about it? Will you join us, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: I would be honored.

speaker: Frederick
text: Did you notice, milord? The brigands spoke with a Plegian accent.

speaker: Robin
text: Plegian? What's that?

speaker: Chrom
text: Plegia is Ylisse's westerly neighbor. They send small bands into our territory, hoping to instigate a war.

speaker: Lissa
text: And it's the poor townsfolk who suffer! Totally innocent, and totally helpless...

speaker: Frederick
text: They do have us, milady: Shepherds to protect the sheep. Do not be swept up in your anger. It will cloud your judgment.

speaker: Lissa
text: I know, I know... Don't worry. I'll get used to all this.

speaker: Villager
text: Milord, please! You must stay the night! We are simple folk of simple means, but we would gladly toast your valor with a feast!

speaker: Frederick
text: A most generous offer, sir, and no doubt your hospitality would be grand... But I'm afraid we must hurry back to Ylisstol.

speaker: Lissa
text: Dark meat only for me, medium well, and no salt in the soup. I simply— Wait, what?! We're not staying?! But, Frederick, it's nearly dark!

speaker: Frederick
text: When night falls, we'll camp. Eat off the land, make our bed of twigs and the like... I believe you mentioned you would be "getting used to this"?

speaker: Lissa
text: Frederick? Sometimes I hate you.

speaker: Robin
text: You've quite the stern lieutenant there.

speaker: Lissa
text: Yeah, well, "stern" is one name for it. I can think of a few others!

speaker: Chrom
text: Frederick only smiles when he's about to bring down the axe.

speaker: Robin
text: Duly noted.

speaker: Frederick
text: *Ahem* You do realize I AM still present?

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, we realize.

speaker: Robin
text: Heh heh.

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord remains as amusing as ever. Now then, shall we be going?

speaker: Chrom
text: All right, all right. Ready to go, Robin? The capital isn't far.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Just as I thought: the turncloaks only made a show of opposing us. We're clear of them. But Yen'fay's forces approach swiftly. It won't be long now...

speaker: Robin
text: We should hasten south to meet them, and distance ourselves from Walhart. This battle will be challenge enough without the Conqueror breathing down our backs.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: ...Another concern: the dynasts who betrayed us. They attacked us and let us go both, because it suited their purpose. Should they attack us from behind as we battle Yen'fay, it would be an easy victory. They would curry favor with the empire without risk of injury. This is how they think.

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Chrom
text: We cannot defend two fronts. We'll need to choose our battlefield carefully... Say'ri, that mountain—I've seen it smoke for hours but I see no trees on it anywhere?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: What...ah. That is no forest fire, sir. It's a volcano. Have you never seen one? That one is called the Demon's Ingle. It is known and feared by all people of Valm. Few dare even get close, lest they anger the wicked fire god.

speaker: Chrom
text: Hmm... Robin? Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

speaker: Robin
text: Only if you're wondering how quickly we can reach the volcano.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: G-go to the Demon's Ingle?! Do you know what you're saying?

speaker: Robin
text: I'm saying your opportunistic former friends wouldn't dare risk following us. And we can use the flames as barriers, to limit how your brother's army approaches.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Mmm... And my brother will still come. His stubborn pride will force his hand...

speaker: Chrom
text: Then it seems we have our strategy.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: ...'Tis a risky plan, but I can devise none better. And you two seem to have a peculiar talent for performing miracles.

speaker: Excellus
text: Why, General, such a melancholic air about you today. Whatever is the problem? ...Oh, is today the day you face off against your beloved sister? Dear me, of course it is! Well then, of course you'd be in a foul mood...

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: She is a rebel and traitor to the empire. I have no sister.

speaker: Excellus
text: Oh, very good, very good—right out of the book, General Yen'fay! (And I commend your acting ability...very convincing! I think your men all heard you.) In any case, I'm SO glad I can trust you not to take it easy on her ragtag little troupe.

speaker: Excellus
text: Yes, we BOTH know why you'd never let any of her comrades escape, don't we? Oh, I know it must be so difficult, General. But think of it this way: You still have a family. A big one! The whole imperial army is your family now! ...Well, I should run. Do tell your little sister I say hello? Ta ta!

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: I am Yen'fay of Chon'sin. That is all you need know before you die.

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: Well fought... She will...be...safe... I can die...in peace...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Brother. I won't ask you why... We are well beyond that point now. I will speak it plain: I cannot forgive you, and neither can I let you live.

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: I've asked you for nothing, Sister, least of all your forgiveness.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: But you will have my justice, like it or no! You, who stood by in silence while everyone around you suffered! While villages were razed and fields burned, you watched but said nothing... When Father and Mother were murdered—you said nothing! Nothing, before you ran to the arms of the one man responsible for all of it! Your silence was deafening. Maddening. Even now...have you nothing to say?!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Damn you, Yen'fay! Then I will make your sword answer for you! Draw your blade, and let it sing your final words!

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: Say'ri... You have grown...so strong...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: ...Do...do you mock me? I have seen your best swordplay...that was not it. You went easy on me...but why?

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: What I could not tell you in life... I say with my death...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: But, Yen'fay...

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: You have found...strong comrades... I no longer need fear for you... ...I die...in peace...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Yen'fay, wait! What do you mean? Why?! Don't leave me with more silence—not this time! Yen'fay!

speaker: Chrom
text: General Yen'fay.

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: Aye, that is the name. What would you have of me, Ylissean?

speaker: Chrom
text: I would ask why a famed swordmaster would sell his honor to Walhart.

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: ...That is not your concern.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Are you truly your sister's brother? She is a principled woman. Even knowing Walhart's strength, she has fought on valiantly. Are you so deluded as to genuinely consider her your enemy? Or are you simply afraid of your master?

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: Afraid...? Yes, fear plays its part, that I cannot deny.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...You admit it, then? You are craven!

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: I did not say it was fear for my life. That my reasons exist is not cause to explain them all to strangers.

speaker: Chrom
text: If there's honor left in you, say it now. You could still join us...

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: The bones have been thrown, lad. All that remains is to see where they fall.

speaker: Chrom
text: So be it.

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: Hrrgh! Nngh...

speaker: Chrom
text: Whatever your reasons joining them, there must have been another answer...

speaker: Yen'Fay
text: Some quandaries in this world...have...no...proper answer...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Our victory is secured... Yen'fay has fallen. I will never understand why he joined Walhart... His reasons die with him.

speaker: Excellus
text: But oh, what a death it was! Did you see the grief etched on his face? The mix of longing and pain in the eyes? He had become such an accomplished actor, but that was all too real, hee hee!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Excellus... What would you know of my brother, you loathsome toad!

speaker: Excellus
text: More than you, princess of Chon'sin. And I would watch that mouth of yours... I am honoring Yen'fay's sacrifice by not killing you now...but even I have my limits.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: ...What? What do you mean "sacrifice"?

speaker: Excellus
text: Oopsie! Did I just spill the beans? Hya ha ha ha ha! I'm so sorry, but I promised your dear brother I'd never tell...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Explain yourself, snake—or die!

speaker: Excellus
text: Bah! As if YOU could harm ME! YOU only live by MY grace, you ungrateful WRETCH! I could have had you killed countless times! And I would have, if not for him...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Enough talking around it—say what you mean!

speaker: Excellus
text: Oh, did Yen'fay not groan out the truth as you cut him to bloody pieces? No, I suppose not. He always was so quiet. And proud...honorable, I think they call it? Yet he swallowed his pride and cast aside his honor...all to protect his beloved kin. That's right, Little Sis. He did it...to save you.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: What?! ...Lies... You're lying!

speaker: Excellus
text: No, I'm telling the truth, which I admit is a rare treat, so you best shut up and enjoy it. Before you met these Ylisseans, I could have had your head with a word. In Chon'sin, at Valm Harbor... Did you really think yourself so elusive? You were my leverage for Yen'fay. Unwitting and unbound, but a hostage all the same. I let you live; he fought for us. That was our deal. And he kept his end, right TO his end!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: No...NO!

speaker: Excellus
text: Phew... Well, I don't know about you, but I feel MUCH better having that off my chest. Maybe I will give this truth telling a try more often! Yes, I shall resolve to do so! In any case, good-bye, friends! I wish you safe travels, and so sorry about Yen'fay... Oops! I broke my resolution twice already! Tee hee hee!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: N-no, this isn't... This can't be... Y-Yen'fay, no...

speaker: Chrom
text: Say'ri...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Gods... The things I said to him... The things I did... I have wronged him beyond imagining.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: If he had only spoken! Told me! I could have joined the ruse, I...

speaker: Lucina
