text: Milady, I know well the grief of losing family with so much yet unsaid.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: I am wretched! I've repaid my brother's kindness with death! Oh, Yen'fay, forgive me... Please, oh please... Please...

speaker: Lissa
text: Say'ri, I... I'm sorry... I'm so sorry!

speaker: Chrom
text: Say'ri, you did all you could. Your brother knew that... You are blameless in this. Excellus and the empire are at fault here. And they will be made to answer for it, I promise you.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: ...... Sir Chrom, I... Pray, forgive me. You have done so much for this land while I can give nothing in return. Or worse... What help I offered turned against us...

speaker: Robin
text: WE'RE the Resistance now, and we've yet to lose a battle! Yen'fay would be proud. And he'd also want us to fight on...to make sure his sacrifice has meaning. And fight we will, Say'ri. Until this land is free.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Aye, sir/my lady... And thank you. I owe my life to you all, and to my brother... I swear to you, and to him... I will make the most of it.

speaker: Soldier
text: Milord! *huff, huff* K-Khan Basilio, he... He has been killed in battle!

speaker: Lucina
text: No!

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn it all! You're certain?

speaker: Flavia
text: I am. He's gone, Chrom. I saw him fall myself. ...He's gone.

speaker: Chrom
text: Flavia! What happened? Wait...you're hurt! Lucina—fetch a healer, at once!

speaker: Flavia
text: I'll be fine, gods damn me... Gods damn me for outliving that one-eyed clod! That big, bald oaf! That...that...Aaaaaargh!

speaker: Lucina
text: That's twice now I have failed...

speaker: Flavia
text: I'll kill him! I'll cut that dastard Walhart down myself! I swear it before the gods!

speaker: Chrom
text: No, Flavia...for now, you need to rest and to heal. When the time is right, we will avenge Basilio. You have my word.

speaker: Flavia
text: ...Then know that I will hold you to it...

speaker: Lucina
text: ...Why did I let him go...

speaker: Flavia
text: Chrom, there's something else. Something important. Basilio asked I give you this...

speaker: Chrom
text: Wait... Is that...? Ah... I can feel its power resonating through my whole body...

speaker: Flavia
text: It's Gules, one of the Gemstones you need. Don't ask me why in hell's name the oaf hid it from you. He always did love his surprises, damn him.

speaker: Chrom
text: Whatever his reasons, I accept his gift now, and gladly.

speaker: Flavia
text: It's hard to believe he's truly gone... The larger the man, the larger the void left in his wake...

speaker: Lucina
text: And Khan Basilio was a titan. There is no replacing him. I should have tried harder to convince him...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: The scouts have reported back. Walhart's army...has retreated to the imperial capital.

speaker: Robin
text: Retreated?!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: It seems the dynast turncloaks are withdrawing their soldiers as well.

speaker: Chrom
text: I don't believe it...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Steiger and Yen'fay have fallen; it's no shock Walhart might pull back to regroup. And of course the dynasts now see cracks forming in the empire...

speaker: Chrom
text: Maybe they'll reconsider which side they will fight for?

speaker: Lucina
text: Possibly, if they can see an advantage in it for themselves. With them or not, it seems a decisive battle is upon us.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: To think, how quickly our fortunes have shifted...

speaker: Robin
text: We have Basilio to thank for it. For all of it. His sacrifice made it all possible... If only there had been some other way...

speaker: Flavia
text: No second guessing! Basilio would have hated that. You did your duty as best you were able, same as he. Now clear the doubts out of that clever head of yours—we're going to need it. The fate of Valm—and all our homelands—hangs on this next battle. For the sake of history and all our fallen comrades... We will bring this empire crashing down!

speaker: Chrom
text: Shepherds! Comrades! Soldiers! We make for the capital! This "Conqueror's" reign ends now!

speaker: Lissa
text: I told you—it's getting dark already! ...Ech! And now the bugs are out! Noisy, disgusting bugs that buzz around and crawl all over and bite you when—Agh! Won goph in mah mouph! Blech! Ptooey!

speaker: Chrom
text: Aw, come on now, Lissa. Hardship builds character. Want to help me gather firewood?

speaker: Lissa
text: Tpht! Tpht! Yeeeeeuck! ...I think I swallowed it... I'll pass on finding firewood, thanks. I think I've built QUITE enough character for one day!

speaker: Robin
text: We should probably think about food. I don't know about you, but I'm starving.

speaker: Frederick
text: Yes, I should think a little hunting and gathering is in order. Now, who wants to clear a campsite?

speaker: Chrom
text: Mmm... It's been too long since I last had bear meat. Delicious! ...What's wrong, Lissa? Dig in.

speaker: Lissa
text: Pass! ...Gods, couldn't you spear us an animal normal people eat for once? I mean, come on! Who eats bear?! You're meddling with the food chain. Right, Robin? ...Uh, Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: *Munch, munch, slurp*

speaker: Lissa
text: *Sigh* I suppose a person would enjoy just about anything after not eating for days...

speaker: Chrom
text: Just eat it, Lissa. Meat is meat.

speaker: Lissa
text: Since when does meat smell like old boots?! Wait, I take that back—boots smell better!

speaker: Frederick
text: Every experience makes us stronger, milady. Even those we don't enjoy.

speaker: Lissa
text: Really? Then why don't I see YOU eating, Frederick?

speaker: Frederick
text: Me? Oh, well... I'm not hungry. I...I had a large lunch! Yes, quite.

speaker: Lissa
text: Yeah right, Frederick!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Huh?

speaker: Lissa
text: *Yawn* What's wrong, Big Brother?

speaker: Chrom
text: Sorry, I didn't mean to wake you, but... Something is amiss...

speaker: Lissa
text: Define "something".

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm not sure... I think I'll have a look around.

speaker: Lissa
text: Not alone, you won't! I'm coming too.

speaker: Chrom
text: Heh. Thanks, Lissa.

speaker: Lissa
text: It sure is dark. ...And quiet. Where did the birds go?

speaker: Chrom
text: Something is wrong here...

speaker: Lissa
text: Aaah! Chrom!

speaker: Chrom
text: Gods, what— Agh! What is this madness?! Lissa, stay close!

speaker: Chrom
text: Lissa, run.

speaker: Lissa
text: Huh?

speaker: Chrom
text: I mean it! Go!

speaker: Chrom
text: Hey! This way!

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom, what IS that?!

speaker: Chrom
text: Lissa, you'd better stand back.

speaker: Chrom
text: Lissa!

speaker: Marth
text: Help!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Right!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Quite an entrance. What's your name?

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord! Milady! Are you hurt?

speaker: Lissa
text: Frederick! Robin!

speaker: Robin
text: Are such horrific creatures commonplace in these lands?

speaker: Chrom
text: They're not from Ylisse, I promise you that.

speaker: Frederick
text: No one is injured, then? Thank the gods...

speaker: Lissa
text: Thank the masked man who saved me! If it wasn't for him, I'd be... Hey, where did he go?

speaker: Frederick
text: We can worry about him later, AFTER we put these...things...to the blade. Eyes open, now. We know nothing about this enemy.

speaker: Chrom
text: Right.

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm? Are those...

speaker: Frederick
text: Abandoned forts, yes.

speaker: Robin
text: Then we should take shelter in them whenever possible. No doubt they will offer distinct advantages in battle.

speaker: Sully
text: Captain Chrom! Wait! I'm coming! ...Agh, I knew I shouldn'ta left 'em. All right, you ash-faced freaks! Which one of ya wants to try my lance on for size first? I know just the spot for it: shoved right up your—

speaker: Virion
text: Hold, milady!

speaker: Sully
text: Muh?

speaker: Virion
text: Life may be long, but attraction is fleeting! Would you leave me in your sweet dust? Leave war to the warriors, dear bird! A beauty such as you need wage only love.

speaker: Sully
text: ...The hell are you?!

speaker: Virion
text: Ha! Is the lady intrigued? Of course you are—it's only natural. I am myth and legend! I am he who strides large across history's greatest stage! The man who puts the "arch" in "archer"! My name, dear lady, is Vi—

speaker: Sully
text: Sorry, Ruffles—no time for this. Onward!

speaker: Virion
text: Virion! ...Er, my name. It's Virion. W-wait! Where are you going? Pray, at least tell me your name!

speaker: Sully
text: I'm Sully. ...And I'm a Shepherd.

speaker: Virion
text: Sully! How divine! A starkly beautiful name, as befits its owner, truly. Will you marry me, my dearest Sully?

speaker: Sully
text: Will I what now? Oh wait, I get it... This is a joke. And when I put my boot through your face—that's the punch line.

speaker: Virion
text: I realize my manly figure and noble bearing can be overwhelming. 'Tis common! So please, don't feel pressured to answer right a—

speaker: Sully
text: How's THIS for an answer?!

speaker: Virion
text: OOF! G-goodness, but those shapely legs certainly can kick, can't they... P-please, milady! Allow me to accompany you, at least! Mine is a cold, empty world without you. I shall be your most willing servant, and you, in turn, will give my life purpose...

speaker: Sully
text: *Sigh* Fine... Anything to shut you up. ...What? Stop staring at me like that!

speaker: Virion
text: Goddesses and gentlemen, might I have your attention? I, as it happens, am an archer! ...The archest of archers, in fact. As such, I attack most effectively from a distance. So kindly keep me one step away from peril, if you would!

speaker: Risen Chief
text: Ryaaargh!

speaker: Risen Chief
text: Nnh...aaagh...

speaker: Frederick
text: It seems all the creatures are vanquished. This young man took care of the others.

speaker: Lissa
text: Um, I never got to thank you...for before. So...thank you. You were very brave.

speaker: Chrom
text: You saved my sister's life. My name is Chrom. Might I ask yours?

speaker: Marth
text: You may call me Marth.

speaker: Chrom
text: Marth? After the heroic king of old? You certainly fight like a hero. Where did you learn your way with a sword?

speaker: Marth
text: I'm not here to talk about me. This world teeters at the brink of a horrible calamity. What you saw tonight was but a prelude. You have been warned.

speaker: Lissa
text: Huh? What's teetering where now? Hey, wait!

speaker: Robin
text: Not much for conversation, is he?

speaker: Frederick
text: It appears his skills lie elsewhere. I wager we'll hear his name again... But for now I'm more concerned about the capital. We should make haste.

speaker: Robin
text: So this is Ylisstol, capital of Ylisse... I've never seen so many people!

speaker: Frederick
text: It appears the capital was spared the chaos we encountered, thank the gods. I see no evidence of the great quake. It must've been limited to the forest.

speaker: Lissa
text: Well, that's a relief!

speaker: Old Villager
text: Look! The exalt has come to see us!

speaker: Robin
text: The exalt is your ruler, yes?

speaker: Frederick
text: Yes. Her name is Lady Emmeryn.

speaker: Robin
text: Is it safe for her to walk among commoners like this?

speaker: Frederick
text: The exalt is a symbol of peace—Ylisse's most prized quality. Long ago, at the dawn of our age, the fell dragon tried to destroy the world. But the first exalt joined forces with the divine dragon and laid the beast low. Exalt Emmeryn reminds us all of the peace we fought for then.

speaker: Chrom
text: With Plegia poking at our borders, the people need her. She's a calming presence, when some might otherwise call for war.

speaker: Robin
text: Then the Ylissean people are indeed lucky to have her.

speaker: Lissa
text: She's also the best big sister anyone could ask for!

speaker: Robin
text: Yes, I imagine she... Wait, what? She's your... But wouldn't that make you and Chrom...

speaker: Frederick
text: The prince and princess of the realm, yes. You remember Chrom's name and not this?

speaker: Robin
text: You said you were "shepherds"!

speaker: Chrom
text: And so we are...in a manner of speaking. We just have a LOT of sheep.

speaker: Robin
text: C-Chrom... I mean, Prince Chrom! Sire! Forgive my dreadful manners!

speaker: Chrom
text: Just Chrom is fine. I've never been much for formalities.

speaker: Robin
text: The prince and princess... That explains why Frederick tolerates all the teasing, eh?

speaker: Frederick
text: Indeed. Oh, the sacrifices I make for the good of the realm...

speaker: Chrom
text: It looks like Emm is returning to the palace. Would you like to meet her?

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom! Lissa! Welcome home. Oh, and good day, Frederick. How fared you all?

speaker: Chrom
text: Well—we shouldn't have any bandit problems for a while.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Wonderful. And our people?

speaker: Chrom
text: Safe as they can be, Emm. But we still need to watch the borders. The brigands crossed over from Plegia.

speaker: Phila
text: Forgive me, milord. My pegasus knights should have intercepted them.

speaker: Chrom
text: No, Phila. Your duty was here, with the exalt.

speaker: Lissa
text: And besides, we had plenty of help!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Ah, you speak of your new companion here?

speaker: Chrom
text: This is Robin. He/She fought bravely with us against the brigands. I've decided to make him/her a Shepherd.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: It sounds as though Ylisse owes you a debt of gratitude, Robin.

speaker: Robin
text: Not at all, milady!

speaker: Frederick
text: Forgive me, Your Grace, but I must speak. Robin claims to have lost his/her memory, but it is only that: a claim. We cannot rule out the possibility that he/she is a brigand himself or even a Plegian spy.

speaker: Chrom
text: Frederick!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Yet you allowed him/her into the castle, Chrom. Does this man/woman have your trust?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes. He/She risked his/her life for our people. That's good enough for me.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Well then, Robin... It seems you've earned Chrom's faith, and as such you have mine as well.

speaker: Robin
text: Milady.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: But thank you, Frederick, for your prudence, as always. Chrom and Lissa are blessed to have so tireless a guardian. I do hope they remember to mention that from time to time...

speaker: Frederick
text: They occasionally express something akin to gratitude, Your Grace. Phila. I assume you've heard about the deathly creatures we encountered, yes?

speaker: Phila
text: Yes, milord. They've been sighted all across Ylisse.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom, we are about to hold council. I was hoping you could join us.

speaker: Chrom
text: Of course.

speaker: Lissa
text: I think that's our cue, Robin! C'mon, there's a place I want to show you.

speaker: Robin
text: Ah, take it all in! Breathtaking... Somehow our troubles feel a lifetime away out here.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yet in truth, we're headed straight toward them... I should be grateful the Plegians delivered us this fleet, as promised. But it's my first time on a vessel, and my legs... I never fancied myself a sea captain.

speaker: Lucina
text: This is my first voyage as well. In my time, all ships were destroyed. Smashed to pieces, along with their ports.

speaker: Chrom
text: Lucina... Something I've been meaning to ask... After you stopped Emm's assassination... Why didn't you stay with us?

speaker: Lucina
text: I felt I had no other choice. I could not risk altering history any more than necessary. I sought only to divert events that directly led to Grima's return.

speaker: Lissa
text: Hey, so wait—what about the guys who tried to kill Chrom in the gardens? What would've happened if you didn't save him?

speaker: Lucina
text: He would have been gravely wounded. And those wounds would have played a part in the tragedies to come.

speaker: Lissa
text: Whoa! Good thing you changed things, huh?

speaker: Lucina
text: If indeed they have changed... The river of time always favors its original course. Take the exalt's death... I stalled it, yes, but in the end I was not able to prevent it.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...You did what you could.

speaker: Lucina
text: I was so certain it was over. That I'd saved the world. But time simply found another way back to its course. Perhaps the task is simply too great... Perhaps if I'd done something differently? I replay events in my head, over and over...

speaker: Chrom
text: Don't. You did your best. And you saved me, after all.

speaker: Lucina
text: You're kind, Father. But nothing is certain... Another could take your life. Time could find a way...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Do you know how I die?

speaker: Lucina
text: Only rumors... I was told you fell in a great battle, fought to sway your destiny. ...And that you were murdered— betrayed by someone dear to you.

speaker: Robin
text: Nngh! Ah...

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin? What is it?

speaker: Robin
text: M-my head... I don't... F-forgive me. I'm fine.

speaker: Lucina
text: ...... After your murder and Grima's return, I took the name Marth and fought back. I prayed to the Hero-King for a small part of the strength he used to save the world. But I need this subterfuge no longer. I choose to fight as Lucina now. The name that reminds me of the strength in the man and woman who chose it.

speaker: Chrom
text: A strength shared by the woman who bears it.

speaker: Frederick
text: The pegasus knights report the Valmese fleet matches ours, ship for ship.

speaker: Chrom
text: Your tone tells me this is not good news.

speaker: Frederick
text: Their troops vastly outnumber ours. Our vessels are half-full, at best. But every Valmese ship is packed from stem to stern with soldiers.

speaker: Chrom
text: If we attempt to board them in a straight fight, we'll be slaughtered.

speaker: Flavia
text: We've little choice but to try anyway. Plegia had no men to spare, but they were generous with other supplies...including oil. Perhaps a clever tactician could find a use for that.

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm... Perhaps he/she could.

speaker: Flavia
text: If we can put their ships to flame, they'd have nowhere to escape to. We could—

speaker: Basilio
text: You could roast us all like hams! Are you truly so eager to die, woman?!

speaker: Flavia
text: Do you have a better idea, oaf?! ...The problem is we have no catapults. Hmm... How to get the lit oil on their decks without our own ships getting caught in the blaze?

speaker: Robin
text: Hmm... Unless we WANT our ships caught in the blaze...

speaker: Basilio
text: Why in the gods' named would... Well, I know better than to question Robin. Especially not when he/she has that look in his/her eyes. Gods save us from what he/she's cooked up this time—let's just hope it's not us!

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, I have an idea.

speaker: Chrom
text: Those words from your mouth are music to my ears, Robin.

speaker: Robin
text: But for my plan to work we'll need to disrupt their chain of command... Our strongest team would need to board their lead ship and kill their general. As our best captain I'd have you head the squad, but you ARE the prince, so...

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, I AM the prince, so no one can order me NOT to go. I will lead the assault!

speaker: Robin
text: Then this plan truly stands a chance.

speaker: Chrom
text: Heh... So much has changed since we found you that day, lying in the open field... Hard to believe you determine the fate of our entire army now...our entire people. Destiny has a strange way.

speaker: Robin
text: ...No, Chrom. Not destiny.

speaker: Chrom
text: What?

speaker: Robin
text: We're not pawns of some scripted fate. I believe we're more. Much more.

speaker: Chrom
text: How do you mean?

speaker: Robin
text: There's something between us all. Something that keeps us together... Like...invisible ties, connecting us. Giving us strength... WE forged these ties. WE strengthen them. If we preserve them, or break them, it will be by our choices, not some "destiny"...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Robin... I think this salty air might have gone to your head, hah!

speaker: Robin
text: All right, all right—perhaps enough philosophy for one day... There are still details to discuss.

speaker: Chrom
text: Indeed there are! And preparations to be made! Oh, and, Robin... If we are all bound by these invisible ties, I thank the gods it's with you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Now then, everyone! Look lively! We have work to do!

speaker: Ignatius
text: One ship against three of ours? They're either very brave or very stupid... Either way, their bodies will float on the long sea before the day is done.

speaker: Ignatius
text: Arrogant pup! The seas are my home, and they will be your grave!

speaker: Ignatius
text: Strike me down, and ten will take my place... You...have...lost!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! Their general has fallen! I'm giving the signal! All appointed ships, change course! Head right at them! Ramming speed!

speaker: Soldier
text: ...Gods and thunder! Any second now!

speaker: Chrom
text: Steady... Steaaaady...

speaker: Soldier
text: We're right on top of them!

speaker: Chrom
text: NOW! JUUUMP!

speaker: Lissa
text: The sea itself is on fire!

speaker: Frederick
text: It worked! It worked!

speaker: Flavia
text: Only you could hatch such a brilliant scheme, Robin. Who else would desert half our vessels and turn them into flaming cannonballs? And there was still enough room on the remaining ships for all our troops. It was so simple, and yet the Valmese never saw it coming. They never considered anyone might be willing to sacrifice half a fleet...

speaker: Chrom
text: We may have won the day, but the war still looms. We must continue on and seize control of their main harbour.

speaker: Basilio
text: Aye, boy! I've had enough of the smoke and smell here for one lifetime, besides.

speaker: Chrom
text: Full speed for Valm!

speaker: Lucina
text: There it sits...

speaker: Lissa
text: What's wrong, Lucina?

speaker: Lucina
text: That great skull. I saw it once before, when Emmeryn was sentenced to die. Even then it reminded me of...him...

speaker: Chrom
text: You mean...

speaker: Lucina
text: Yes. Grima, the fell dragon. A cataclysmic war ushered his return... It's said he fed on the souls of the fallen before turning upon the living...

speaker: Grima
text: So ends the human race. The future is built upon the past... But your kind shall never see it.

speaker: Grima
text: Your mother and father... ...are dead, tiny one.

speaker: Grima
text: And now it is your turn... to DIE!

speaker: Lucina
text: ...Whether these are his true bones or just an effigy, I cannot say. But I know this: we cannot let that monster come back to life.

speaker: Chrom
text: We'll stop him, Lucina. I promise. The future can be changed. You've proven it already. And with all of us together, we can turn the course of history.

speaker: Lucina
text: I want to believe that, Father. I want to believe that, more than anything...

speaker: Robin
text: (Psst! Chrom!)

speaker: Chrom
text: (...Trouble?)

speaker: Robin
text: (I saw armed soldiers hiding in the shadows as we were shown in...)

speaker: Chrom
text: (Then it sounds like we have our answer already...)

speaker: Aversa
text: Well met, milord.

speaker: Validar
text: Prince Chrom! Welcome.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...I was told you had something you wished to give me.

speaker: Validar
text: My my! No time for courtesy, milord? Such impatience... Do you really want it that badly? This concerns me. The Gemstones and the Fire Emblem can be...treacherous artifacts. A fact Plegia and the Grimleal sadly know all too well...

speaker: Lucina
text: Sadly? You speak ill of when the first exalt used them against the fell dragon?

speaker: Validar
text: Yes I do, intruder!

speaker: Lucina
text: ...Intruder?

speaker: Validar
text: You are not supposed to be here. You must be destroyed!

speaker: Chrom
text: You wouldn't dare!

speaker: Validar
text: Give me the Fire Emblem... Give it to me!

speaker: Lucina
text: You mad scoundrel! This is a declaration of war!

speaker: Validar
text: I will only ask one last time: give me the Emblem. Now!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Never.

speaker: Validar
text: Then this parley is over. Guards! Seize them!

speaker: Chrom
text: Just as we thought...

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, this way! Quickly!

speaker: Aversa
text: Robin had an escape route all planned out... How preciously clever of him/her. You should be proud.

speaker: Validar
text: Hmph. If he/she had half the wits of his/her father, he/she would know they've already lost.

speaker: Chrom
text: We have to get out of here now! Cut down anyone who gets in the way!

speaker: Algol
text: Heh heh. Signal the men in hiding, and give these Ylissean scum no quarter!

speaker: Algol
text: Heh heh... Leaving Plegia so soon? No, please, stay awhile. Stay...forever!

speaker: Algol
text: No! Hyaughhh...

speaker: Chrom
text: Almost there! The exit is just— Wait. Do you feel...

speaker: Chrom
text: Hnrgh...

speaker: Validar
text: Run all you like—you can't escape fate. Don't you know that?

speaker: Lucina
text: Father!

speaker: Validar
text: The Fire Emblem. Give it freely, or it will be taken.

speaker: Chrom
text: Just try it!

speaker: Validar
text: Heh heh... I won't need to do anything... Robin!

speaker: Robin
text: Nngh! Ahh...

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin?

speaker: Validar
text: Seize the Emblem and bring it to me.

speaker: Robin
text: Nngh, no, I... Aarrrgh!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin... What are you...doing?!

speaker: Validar
text: Well done, my child. At last, the Fire Emblem belongs to me. And with my Gemstone, it is complete! Now, to set the Table and perform the rite...

speaker: Chrom
text: D-damn you, Validar! Nngh...

speaker: Robin
text: Ah! Nngh...ahh... What have I...done?!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! We must go!

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, I'm sorry! I don't...know what came over me... I'm so sorry!

speaker: Chrom
text: I know you are, but right now we need to focus on getting out of here!

speaker: Robin
text: ...Understood.

speaker: Robin
text: What I did... It's...it's unforgivable.

speaker: Chrom
text: Enough of that, Robin. Save your energy for helping us track him down.

speaker: Robin
text: No, I... You must leave me behind. He could use me again... I can't be trusted! This cursed blood in me must somehow give...my father...dominion over me...

speaker: Chrom
text: But he never had full control... You can fight it, Robin. And if he expects you to blindly obey, that might be the surprise we need.

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, you...you put too much faith in me.

speaker: Frederick
text: Get back on that horse, Robin. You can't give up now!

speaker: Robin
text: But you're not listening! I told you, I'm not—

speaker: Chrom
text: The deed is done. But you can still try to undo the damage. It's not too late!

speaker: Robin
text: All right. I'll...I'll try.

speaker: Lucina
text: Beg pardon, Robin. Might I have a word?

speaker: Robin
text: ...Lucina. What is it?

speaker: Lucina
text: It's about my father. I have memories of him, you know. From when I was little. Before he...died.

speaker: Robin
text: I see...

speaker: Lucina
text: He was courageous, and kind, and everyone spoke fondly of him. People say he was brave right up until the very end. I always yearned to know him better. And now that I do... I can see that the world will be robbed of a very great man. ...I won't allow that to happen.

speaker: Robin
text: I understand. You love him. ...We all do.

speaker: Lucina
text: Robin, I... Please, forgive me...

speaker: Robin
text: Lucina?!

speaker: Lucina
text: Stay where you are, Robin! I have no choice. I must kill you.

speaker: Robin
text: What?! What madness is this?!

speaker: Lucina
text: In my future, you... You are my father's murderer.

speaker: Robin
text: No! That's insane! Why would I kill Chrom?

speaker: Lucina
text: I was not certain myself, until now... I knew he had been killed by his closest friend. Having witnessed your bond with him, I doubted it could be so... But today's events make it clear. You are at Validar's mercy. I suspect it's he who forces you to take my father's life, and very soon...

speaker: Robin
text: Lucina, wait.

speaker: Lucina
text: If my father is right, then we can change our fates. If this dark future is to be averted, sacrifices must be made. I am sorry, Robin! I know this is murder, I... I know that...

speaker: Robin
text: Lucina, you don't have to—

speaker: Lucina
text: Don't make it harder! Don't resist, and your death will be swift and painless. If you hold any love for Chrom, then let this be done...

speaker: Robin
text: ...Very well. I forfeit my life.

speaker: Lucina
text: Godspeed, Robin.

speaker: Chrom
text: Enough!

speaker: Lucina
text: Father, you don't—

speaker: Chrom
text: Lucina, lower your sword...

speaker: Lucina
text: But, Father—

speaker: Chrom
text: LOWER YOUR SWORD!

speaker: Lucina
text: A-all right. ...I can explain.

speaker: Chrom
text: There's no need. You're not the only one who can eavesdrop. I heard every word. Lucina, I know your heart is in the right place... But I trust Robin. You cannot shake my faith in him/her.

speaker: Lucina
text: This is not about trust! He'll/She'll be the death of you!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin and I have held fast through good times and ill... We swore to be two halves of a greater whole. You underestimate the strength of those ties, the bonds we share. I believe in them more than some foretold "destiny."

speaker: Lucina
text: That is easier to say when you haven't seen it yourself...

speaker: Chrom
text: Lucina, aren't our ties stronger here now than they were in your future? You said so yourself. In this flow of time we are bound tighter than ever, you and I. Not just as father and daughter... But as friends. We can change things—we already have...and we will again.

speaker: Lucina
text: ...Very well, Father. I would ask your forgiveness, Robin, but I cannot expect it.

speaker: Robin
text: I do forgive you, Lucina. You needn't speak of it again.

speaker: Lucina
text: I pray... That is, I trust the both of you will prove me wrong. And that this future will fall to pieces before your bond ever would.

text: Just...promise me you'll find someone else who cares for you. Promise you won't be alone... I want you to be happy, Lucina. That's all I've ever wanted.

text: N-no... Ah gods, no...

text: ...I'm ready now. Do what you must.

text: I... I must...
