text: All these strange travelers... What's happening here?

speaker: Lissa
text: Let's ask 'em! Um, excuse me, sir? ...Sir?

speaker: Villager
text: ...the appointed...time... ...to the Dragon's...Table... ...our prayers...Grima...

speaker: Lissa
text: Riiiiiight... I'll just be backing away slowly then...

speaker: Frederick
text: Sire!

speaker: Chrom
text: Frederick! Have the scouts returned?

speaker: Frederick
text: Yes, milord, and with grim news. Validar has moved to a great altar to Grima known as the Dragon's Table. What's more, it seems all the Grimleal in Plegia are headed there as well. It's as if they're being drawn by some unseen force...

speaker: Chrom
text: Any idea what it all means?

speaker: Frederick
text: Who can say, sire? They speak only gibberish and plod on as if possessed.

speaker: Chrom
text: The cataclysm in Lucina's future... This shows all the signs of leading to it. Damn! This destiny is a stubborn business...

speaker: Lucina
text: We cannot give up.

speaker: Chrom
text: And we will not. We make for this Dragon's Table, and quickly! Come, everyone!

speaker: Aversa
text: The Ylisseans have finally caught up to us, milord.

speaker: Validar
text: Delay them. But carefully... We must reclaim Robin's power.

speaker: Aversa
text: Ah, yes. Don't worry, I'll take extra care with Daddy's special little boy/girl.

speaker: Chrom
text: Validar!

speaker: Validar
text: Fools! Do you know where you've come?

speaker: Chrom
text: Return the Fire Emblem now, and we can end this!

speaker: Validar
text: Aaah ha ha ha ha! You would...end this?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, once and for all.

speaker: Validar
text: My dear boy, we already know how this story ends—you and I both! And yet you rush here... Are you so eager to meet the fell dragon yourself? Or perhaps your own fatal destiny—you would have that realized first? Ha ha!

speaker: Chrom
text: To hell with your destiny. I'll write a new ending.

speaker: Aversa
text: Oh ho ho, so now you believe you can change fate? And here I thought your exalted sister had delusions of grandeur...

speaker: Chrom
text: We've done it already.

speaker: Aversa
text: Your victory over sad little Gangrel? Or perhaps Walhart's defeat? Those were meant to happen. They were preordained. You are just another fool in motley, capering on the stage!

speaker: Lissa
text: But...what about Emmeryn!

speaker: Aversa
text: You changed only the method of her death. Either way, she was planted in the ground...

speaker: Frederick
text: But that was Gangrel's will... Not yours... Not Validar's...

speaker: Aversa
text: You aren't listening. All of this—every word and action—has been orchestrated... Gangrel held the exalt in contempt, yes, so Validar and I used him. In life AND death. The king's demise threw Plegia into chaos. It drove the people to Grima... Now their life force and rancor can be laid before the fell dragon en masse.

speaker: Chrom
text: You couldn't mean...

speaker: Aversa
text: It is called the Table for a reason, you naive little man. It is where Grima feeds! The Grimleal have gladly offered themselves to him for ages. Even now, they pray for his return... Today the Table overflows with bounty, and their prayers will be answered!

speaker: Chrom
text: I will never allow that to happen!

speaker: Aversa
text: But it already HAS happened in our future. This moment was set a millennium ago.

speaker: Lucina
text: How could anyone give their life willingly to that...thing? That monster!

speaker: Chrom
text: I will stop you! I will stop Grima!

speaker: Aversa
text: Goodness! Now you're starting to sound like Walhart, the big bully... He intended to destroy Grima as well, you know. ...Our thanks, incidentally, for taking him off the stage for us.

speaker: Chrom
text: Rrgh... That's why you gave us your ships and treasure but no soldiers... Get rid of Walhart, but keep the faithful Plegians to set your god's Table...

speaker: Validar
text: Aversa, it is time. I must prepare.

speaker: Aversa
text: As you command, Master.

speaker: Chrom
text: Validar! ...VALIDAR!

speaker: Aversa
text: Master Validar is not to be disturbed. But fear not, I have brought the Deadlords to keep you entertained. These 12 generals were great warriors in life...and even greater, now, in death! I would introduce them one by one, but well, as you'll see, they're not much for talk. Besides, you'll meet them all soon enough!

speaker: Aversa
text: Hee hee. Looking for attention? One at a time, love.

speaker: Aversa
text: Ooh... You play rough... But the ritual has already begun. You are too late! Farewell! perhaps we shall meet again? Oh, actually...I suppose not! heh heh!

speaker: Robin
text: I'll never understand minions like you and Excellus. No lives of your own... Living only to serve at the beck and call of your masters. Pathetic.

speaker: Aversa
text: Oh? I might say as much about your relationship to the prince... And please, don't lump me in with that half-witted little toad. Excellus was nothing but a pawn on our board. Another actor on our stage. His ambition was our insurance against Walhart's threat. If you had failed, he might have destroyed the empire from the inside. But in the end, he was just another puppet whose strings we had to cut.

speaker: Robin
text: Then you've confirmed my theory.

speaker: Aversa
text: Yes, I promised him the Plegian throne in exchange for the Emblem... He jumped at the offer! Well, as much as the fat little piggie could jump... Men are all the same. Learn their ambition, and you have them by the— Oho... Well, perhaps Excellus was a bit different in that respect...

speaker: Robin
text: Here I thought him the lowest form of slime imaginable, but you win handily...

speaker: Aversa
text: Yes, well, we play the roles we're given, Robin, as you'll soon discover.

speaker: Robin
text: If we all stand on a great stage, I'll be happy to assist with your exit!

speaker: Aversa
text: Oh really now, how amusing... You're so cute when you try to be clever. But Master Validar already considers you stronger and smarter than I... Whatever shall I do if he decides you're more witty as well? Perhaps I'd best kill you before you ripen and become his everything...

speaker: Robin
text: Before I "ripen"?

speaker: Aversa
text: ...Shhh. Nothing to worry your pretty little head over. Focus on our battle, instead! if you truly are as gifted as my master says... There is no need for me to hold back!

speaker: Chrom
text: A final question, witch, before you die—

speaker: Aversa
text: Oh? Then perhaps one final answer, boy, before you fail...

speaker: Chrom
text: Who is Validar? Why do you follow him?

speaker: Aversa
text: He is...a father to me.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...What?! But... You're Robin's sister?!

speaker: Aversa
text: Aha ha ha! You damn fool! not literally... But he did raise me as if I were his own. Taught me everything... I was a poor orphaned wretch with dirt for food, yet Master Validar took me in. He provided when others would have watched me starve. I would never presume that he loves me... But he is everything I know of love. I would gladly die at his command.

speaker: Chrom
text: Even knowing his actions will destroy the world?

speaker: Aversa
text: But he IS the world—and it is YOU that would destroy HIM! From where I stand, YOU are the only aggressor here. How Robin lives with the shame, attacking his/her own blood...

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin sees beyond himself/herself, to the larger reality. One person's life means nothing in the shadow of millions.

speaker: Aversa
text: A sweet sentiment, and easily spoken when you bear no love for the one... But more difficult when the sacrifice was your exalted sister, wasn't it? I don't expect you to see the world through my eyes, Prince. But I won't pretend to understand how things look through yours.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Then I suppose there is nothing more to say.

speaker: Aversa
text: No, I suppose there isn't.

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn! She escaped! Aversa wouldn't leave Validar before he was ready, even with her wounds. His preparations must be complete...

speaker: Lucina
text: We have to stop him! My future is upon us!

speaker: Chrom
text: We will, Lucina. I swear to you—we will.

speaker: Chrom
text: Up there!

speaker: Validar
text: '  You fool!

speaker: Validar
text: *laughs* Die!

speaker: Chrom
text: This is it! Our final battle! You're one of us, Robin, and no "destiny" can change that. Now let's kill this dastard and be done with it!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin, we have to get closer. Let's move!

speaker: Chrom
text: All right, my turn.

speaker: Chrom
text: Go ahead, Robin!

speaker: Validar
text: Ha ha ha! Why do you resist?

speaker: Chrom
text: Good, he's almost within reach. Let's move in and strike!

speaker: Validar
text: Gya ha ha! Fools! Struggle all you want! You cannot unwrite what is already written!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin, I...I'm Sorry. Just..run while you can...

speaker: Validar
text: Gya ha ha! You can't escape it! That's why it's called destiny!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! No! This can't be how it ends!

speaker: Validar
text: Heh heh heh... GYA HA HA HA!

speaker: Validar
text: This isn't over... Damn you BOTH!

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you all right? That's the end of him. Thanks to you we carried the day. We can rest easy now.

speaker: Chrom
text: At long last...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...What's wrong? Hey, hang on—

speaker: Chrom
text: This is not your— your fault... Promise me you'll escape from this place... Please, go...

speaker: Aversa
text: The enemy has taken the field, milord.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Back already? Ha! It feels as though we just said our good-byes...

speaker: Aversa
text: Our scouts report they are in surprisingly good spirits.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Since when do you trust our scouts? Besides, what does it matter? They're armed like beggars compared to us! I could break their ranks as easily as I break wind.

speaker: Aversa
text: I'd love to hear the song the bards make of that.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Aversa, there is a truth about he world this Ylissean welp must learn. A man is either strong... ...or he is dead! Bwa ha haaa!

speaker: Soldier
text: Y-Your Highness! Dire news!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Oh? Speak.

speaker: Soldier
text: Our troops are laying down their weapons and deserting en masse! Please, sire... I am but a messenger... Have mercy...

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, I've a report from Khan Flavia. The Plegian army is in disarray.

speaker: Chrom
text: How do you mean?

speaker: Frederick
text: It seems man of their soldiers are opposed to further violence. There has been infighting, desertion... Gangrel is trying to stamp out the mutiny by force, but with little success. Outside of a few faithful who serve him directly, his army has all but collapsed.

speaker: Chrom
text: This is incredible news. But why...? ...Emmeryn.

speaker: Frederick
text: Yes, milord. Emmeryn. The report says Gangrel's men chant her name as they abandon the field. Her words, and her sacrifice, have made her a folk hero of sorts.

speaker: Chrom
text: Emmeryn... Why did it take me so long to understand? She believed all people desire peace. She knew, deep down, the Plegians wanted it, too. It just took her to bring it to the surface.

speaker: Chrom
text: I hope she can see this, wherever she is... Today, we put an end to Mad King Gangrel and bring peace back to the land.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Good day, my little princeling! Still dreaming of your squashed sister?

speaker: Chrom
text: No more talk, Gangrel. Today, you die, and peace returns to Ylisse and Plegia.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Pah! Such hypocrisy! You despise me, wretch! You want to cut me down! You don't know the first thing about peace! No man does!

speaker: Chrom
text: I know more than you ever will.

speaker: Gangrel
text: More than me? More than ME?! Bwa ha! ...You ARE me! When life asks you a question, you answer with blood!

speaker: Chrom
text: Maybe you're right... I will never be my sister. I cannot forgive men like you—men who sow nothing but evil. All I have left arc words and her memory. Were I alone, I would be driven to madness. ...Or worse. But I'm not alone. My friends and brothers-in-arms stand behind me.

speaker: Gangrel
text: ...Are you done? May I vomit now? Bwa ha ha! What a flowery harangue! Men are beasts! Nothing more! We fight! We kill! We devour our prey! Beasts do not stand behind beasts, little prince... They use each other only so long as it suits their own selfish purpose!

speaker: Chrom
text: Perhaps this explains why your own soldiers refuse to stand behind you? You are a poison. A festering wound. And I will do what my sister could not.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Such a clever tongue you have, little prince... It will look quite fetching hanging on my mantle, next to your sister's corpse!

speaker: Olivia
text: Milord, I have come! Am I too late? I don't claim my dance as anything special, but Khan Basilio says it renews the spirit!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Yes—draw closer! Let them charge at me with their RAGE! More of my soldiers shall greet them at every foolish step.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Clinging to each other won't save you maggots when the boot falls!

speaker: Gangrel
text: F-fool of...a prince... Your people care not for you... You are...alone... As every man lives and dies: ...alone...

speaker: Gangrel
text: Come, princeling! I've sharpened my sword just for you!

speaker: Chrom
text: My sister wished for our people to know peace, Gangrel. But as long as you draw breath, it can never come. For Ylisse!

speaker: Soldier
text: Sire, the remaining Plegian forces are surrendering en masse!

speaker: Chrom
text: Order our forces to cease fighting at once.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sire!

speaker: Flavia
text: Then it's finished. Once their messenger delivers our terms, that's it. We put an end to this bloody business, once and for all.

speaker: Chrom
text: We've won... Somehow I don't feel like celebrating.

speaker: Basilio
text: Victory can be bitter as well as sweet, boy. It's good you learn that now.

speaker: Flavia
text: Regna Ferox lost many good soldiers today. We need to see to our dead. Then it's time to attend to the living and rebuild our army.

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm sorry, Flavia. Your sacrifice will not be forgotten. Ylisse will compensate your nation in whatever fashion—

speaker: Flavia
text: Oh? In that case, how about you hand over the Fire Emblem and we'll call it even? ...Hah! Just a little Feroxi humor. Don't worry about our finances, Chrom. Reparations will fall to Plegia, and I've seen their treasury—they can well afford it.

speaker: Basilio
text: Yes, pity the man who stands between Flavia and a full coffer, boy.

speaker: Chrom
text: Heh, I'll have to remember that when you come to visit Ylisstol.

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin...

speaker: Robin
text: What's wrong, Chrom? You look so serious.

speaker: Chrom
text: I...I think I owe you an apology. This wasn't your war to fight.

speaker: Robin
text: But I chose to fight it.

speaker: Chrom
text: All I've been thinking about is stopping Gangrel, no matter the cost. Even my own life would not have been too high a price to pay.

speaker: Robin
text: It would have been for us! ...And for me.

speaker: Chrom
text: I've been thinking a lot lately, about everything. And about you, Robin. In many ways, you're the best fighter I've ever known...and the best friend. You are a special woman, and I...I wonder if you think of me as more than your leader?

speaker: Robin
text: I think of you as a great man, and...dear to my heart.

speaker: Chrom
text: I never want to let you go, Robin. Does that make me selfish?

speaker: Robin
text: If so, then let me be selfish, too. I would be with you, always.

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin?

speaker: Robin
text: Yes, Chrom?

speaker: Chrom
text: We met under unusual circumstances, but lives have been made from far less. My sister always followed her heart, so now I'm going to follow mine... What I want to ask you... Well, what I mean is... Will you marry me?

speaker: Robin
text: ...Yes.

speaker: Chrom
text: Ha ha! With a word you've made me the happiest man in all the realm! Now I'll need to ask for a bit of patience for the near future... My first duty must be to heal the scars of war and assume my role for the people. But then, we can begin our life together.

speaker: Robin
text: That's all right. I'm a tactician, remember? I'll figure something out.

speaker: Chrom
text: Thank you.

speaker: Robin
text: I can't help but think back to the day we first met... Strange, isn't it, the way fate brought us together? I am a lucky woman to have met you, and luckier still now.

speaker: Chrom
text: I know together we can bring joy back to the royal palace. I'll do everything I can to make the castle a happy home for us...my love.

speaker: Robin
text: My love.

speaker: Sully
text: Ho, Captain! You hurt? I was concerned.

speaker: Chrom
text: No, I'm fine, Sully. I just... Wait. You were...concerned?

speaker: Sully
text: Yes, you arse-head! Concerned! I have a mouth of filth, not a heart of stone.

speaker: Chrom
text: Ha ha! Same old Sully... You know, sometimes I forget... You've always been there for me. You've been fighting at my side for years, you know?

speaker: Sully
text: Of course I know! I was there, remember?!

speaker: Chrom
text: Hold on, Sully, I'm being serious. Just listen for a moment. You've been coming to my rescue for as long as the Shepherds have existed. And I've needed a lot of rescuing...

speaker: Sully
text: You dolt, don't you know that's because I... *Ahem* I mean, it's my duty, sir. But you sell yourself short, Captain. Most men would collapse rather than suffer a fraction of what you've been through. But you shoulder it alone, and without complaint. You're a damn good man! You're...amazing.

speaker: Chrom
text: Sully, what you said just now...

speaker: Sully
text: ...The arse-head bit?

speaker: Chrom
text: *Sigh* No, after that—about how I go it alone. I don't want to anymore, Sully. I want to have a partner to share it with, the good and the bad, all of it. My sister always followed her heart, so now I'm going to follow mine... Sully...will you marry me?

speaker: Sully
text: ...Har har har! Oh, that's rich, Captain! Damn, you sure know how to... Um, how to... Oh, crap. You're serious aren't you?

speaker: Chrom
text: Perhaps this might answer your question?

speaker: Sully
text: A-a ring?! But this bears the Ylissean crest! You shouldn't—

speaker: Chrom
text: My parents had it made to celebrate my birth. They wanted me to give it to the woman I would spend my life with. Take it. Take it and know I will fight with you and for you until my last breath.

speaker: Sully
text: This is... Oh, Chrom. I can't friggin' believe this!

speaker: Chrom
text: I'll need to ask for a bit of patience for the near future. My first duty must be to heal the scars of war and assume my role for the people. But then, we can begin our life together.

speaker: Sully
text: Oh, I'm not going ANYWHERE! ...It's funny. I've known you so long, we're practically one mind. But I didn't see this coming at all. I feel...happy. Happy beyond belief. What have you done to me, you damned son of a griffon?!

speaker: Chrom
text: I know together we can bring joy back to the royal palace. I'll do everything I can to make the castle a happy home for us...my love.

speaker: Sully
text: Okay, THAT's going to take some getting used to.

speaker: Sumia
text: Captain!

speaker: Chrom
text: Sumia?

speaker: Sumia
text: Oh, Captain! You made it! You're safe!

speaker: Flavia
text: Hoo! Give these two some room!

speaker: Chrom
text: Sumia...you're...choking me...

speaker: Sumia
text: Are you hurt? Grazed, even? You look exhausted!

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom?! Say something!

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm trying to!

speaker: Lissa
text: Uh-huh. Flavia? Robin? Maybe we should... you know.

speaker: Flavia
text: Carry on, lovebirds.

speaker: Chrom
text: Hey, are you—come on, don't cry.

speaker: Sumia
text: *Sniff* S-sorry! I just...

speaker: Chrom
text: No, don't apologize. I've been so worried about everyone else lately... My sister, our party, my people... It feels nice to have someone worry about me. Especially someone who I... I mean, someone so... So gifted with pegasi.

speaker: Sumia
text: You've been through so much.

speaker: Chrom
text: So many have suffered and died because of my actions. Next to my sister's legacy, I feel I'm already a disappointment...

speaker: Sumia
text: But that's not true! Everyone fought so hard for you! Why would we all do that for a man we didn't believe in?

speaker: Chrom
text: Heh. I see your point... Thanks, Sumia. You always help me see the...brighter side of things.

speaker: Sumia
text: To me, you're the brightest thing!

speaker: Chrom
text: Sumia...

speaker: Sumia
text: Y-yes?

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm far from a perfect man, and I know you can do better. But whenever you're close...you give me strength. So, what I want to ask is... Will you be my wife?

speaker: Sumia
text: YES! Yes, yes, oh yes!

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, thank gods! I was worried for a second because... Well, anyway... This is for you.

speaker: Sumia
text: Y-your ring? But it bears the Ylissean crest! Chrom, I...I can't take this.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, you can. My parents had it made to celebrate my birth. They wanted me to give it to the woman I would spend my life with. Take it. Please. And know I will love you until the day I die.

speaker: Sumia
text: Capt—Chrom... Thank you. I swear I will return that love to you a hundredfold!

speaker: Chrom
text: Then I am a fortunate man. I'll need to ask for a bit of patience for the near future. My first duty must be to heal the scars of war and assume my role for the people. But then, we can begin our life together.

speaker: Sumia
text: I'll wait as long as it takes! I...I still hardly believe it. This is like a dream. So much pain surrounds us, and yet... I think this is the happiest day of my life.

speaker: Chrom
text: I feel the same way. I know together we can bring joy back to the royal palace. I'll do everything I can to make the castle a happy home for us...my love.

speaker: Sumia
text: My love.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Prince Chrom! Are you hurt?

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm fine, Maribelle. Sorry, I didn't mean to worry you.

speaker: Maribelle
text: I was worried about Lissa! Who would protect her if something were to befall you?

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh. I...I see. Forgive me.

speaker: Maribelle
text: I'm... I'm sorry, that wasn't how I wanted that to—

speaker: Chrom
text: Don't be sorry. When we lost Emmeryn, I was lost in my own pain. I was selfish... I couldn't be there to offer comfort to Lissa. ...But it was all right, because an amazing woman WAS there for her, all along...

speaker: Maribelle
text: Lissa is a treasure. She's the best friend I could ever have. But I'll also always...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Yes?

speaker: Maribelle
text: I'll always be there for... Oh, don't make me say it!

speaker: Chrom
text: Maribelle.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Y-yes?

speaker: Chrom
text: I know I'm not perfect... I'm rash, I can be rude... I'm far from the gentleman you deserve. But I've seen the love you are capable of, and I've grown so very fond of you... My sister always followed her heart, so now I'm going to follow mine... Maribelle... Would you be my wife?

speaker: Maribelle
text: Y-your wife?! Oh Chrom, are you sincere? This is no jest?!

speaker: Chrom
text: No jest, Maribelle, I swear. And to prove it...

speaker: Maribelle
text: B-but...this is your royal ring! Prince Chrom, I don't know if I can—

speaker: Chrom
text: Of course you can. My parents had it made to celebrate my birth. They wanted me to give it to the woman I would spend my life with. Take it. Please. And know I will love you until the day I die.

speaker: Maribelle
text: This and your vow are the finest gifts any woman could dream of...

speaker: Chrom
text: Then the finest woman shall have them. I'll need to ask for a bit of patience for the near future. My first duty must be to heal the scars of war and assume my role for the people. But then, we can begin our life together.

speaker: Maribelle
text: I am a patient woman. ...Well, if I try. Together with you and Lissa forever... Oh, I've wanted this my whole life!

speaker: Chrom
text: I know together we can bring joy back to the royal palace. I'll do everything I can to make the castle a happy home for us...my love.

speaker: Maribelle
text: My prince...

speaker: Soldier
text: Sire, a messenger from Regna Ferox.

speaker: Chrom
text: See them in at once.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, milord.

speaker: Raimi
text: Prince Chrom, I come on behalf of Khan Regnant Flavia.

speaker: Chrom
text: Flavia? Well, this is a surprise. Is something amiss?

speaker: Raimi
text: I fear so, milord. The khan requests your presence at a summit as soon as you're able.

speaker: Chrom
text: What's happened?

speaker: Raimi
text: Our western neighbors of Valm are no longer acting so neighborly. The emperor, who they name the Conqueror, has launched warships against us.

speaker: Chrom
text: An invasion? Are you certain of this?

speaker: Raimi
text: Yes, milord. The khan hopes to meet with you in Ferox, if it please you.

speaker: Frederick
text: What do you make of this, sire?

speaker: Chrom
text: Ill business to be sure. Raimi, we will meet with Flavia at once...

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom...

speaker: Chrom
text: I know what you're thinking, Robin, but we owe Regna Ferox a great debt. I must apprise myself of the facts there before deciding on a course of action.

speaker: Robin
text: Nope, not what I was thinking. I was actually going to suggest we discuss strategy as we travel.

speaker: Chrom
text: B-but Lucina is newly born! She needs her mother now.

speaker: Robin
text: You told me House Ylisse has a tradition of wet-nursing. And you and Lissa turned out rather well from where I stand. Lucina is a strong child; she takes after her father. The Brand in her left eye proves it.

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm not just worried about her. ...I'd worry about you as well.

speaker: Robin
text: All the more reason to keep me close at hand, no? Together we can be more than we can alone, remember?

speaker: Lissa
text: Aw, let her come, Chrom! You could use her strategic thinking anyway.

speaker: Chrom
text: All right, Robin. Just promise to stay safe. Lissa and I had Emm of course, but we lost our parents when we were young. I want Lucina to grow up with her whole family around her.

speaker: Robin
text: As do I. You have my word.

speaker: Sully
text: Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: I know what you're going to say, Sully, but we owe Regna Ferox a great debt. I must apprise myself of the facts there before deciding on a course of action.

speaker: Sully
text: Ha! And I suppose I'll stay here, right? Fluff the pillows? Bake some damn pies? Maybe knit a blanket so you can snuggle up in your own damn pigheadedness?! The hell with that! I'm coming.

speaker: Chrom
text: B-but Lucina is newly born! She needs her mother now.

speaker: Sully
text: She needs milk, Chrom. Not mothers. She can be wet-nursed like the rest of House Ylisse. Hell, you and Lissa turned out fine, didn't you?! Lucina is a strong child; she takes after her father. The Brand in her left eye proves it. And I'll not let you be the only one to set a strong example.

speaker: Chrom
text: Sully, please, will you just—

speaker: Sully
text: You can try to stop me, Chrom! Maybe even sneak away on your own... But you of all people know how I ride when I'm motivated... I'll catch you.

speaker: Lissa
text: Ha ha! Better just give in right now, Chrom! I mean, it's not like you ever win an argument with Sully anyw—

speaker: Chrom
text: LISSA! ...You're not helping. Just promise me if there's any danger you'll stay out of it, Sully. Please. Lissa and I had Emm of course, but we lost our parents when we were young. I want Lucina to grow up with her whole family around her.

speaker: Sully
text: Yes, her whole family. Just remember that means both of us...

speaker: Sumia
text: Chrom...

speaker: Chrom
text: I'd stay with you if I could, Sumia, but we owe Regna Ferox a great debt. I must apprise myself of the facts there before deciding on a course of action.

speaker: Sumia
text: I'm not asking you to stay here with me. I'm saying I'm coming with you.

speaker: Chrom
text: B-but Lucina is newly born! She needs her mother now.

speaker: Sumia
text: Can she not be wet-nursed as you and Lissa were? That is House Ylisse's tradition, is it not? Lucina is a strong child; she takes after her father. The Brand in her left eye is not your only gift to her.

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm worried about more than our child. ...I'm worried about you.

speaker: Sumia
text: That's sweet. But I'm still coming.

speaker: Chrom
text: *Sigh* ...I know better than to argue once your mind is made.

speaker: Lissa
text: Wow, Sumia really has you trained well! Whh-kssssh!

speaker: Chrom
text: Lissa—you're not helping. Just promise me you'll return at the first sign of danger, Sumia. Lissa and I had Emm of course, but we lost our parents when we were young. I want Lucina to grow up with her whole family around her.

speaker: Sumia
text: I'll be careful. I promise.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Chrom...

speaker: Chrom
text: I'd stay with you if I could, Maribelle, but we owe Regna Ferox a great debt. I must apprise myself of the facts there before deciding on a course of action.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Oh, I understand completely. So when do we leave?

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Leave? B-but Lucina is newly born! She needs her mother now.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Lissa told me the two of you were wet-nursed. I don't think a little common milk will spoil our daughter. Lucina is a strong child; she takes after her father. The Brand in her left eye proves it.

speaker: Chrom
text: It's not that, Maribelle! I'm just... I'd be worried about you.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Then keep me close and all will be well! I'm sure my sister agrees, yes?

speaker: Lissa
text: You bet! Maribelle is family now! She belongs with us!

speaker: Chrom
text: Will you at least promise to stay out of any possible danger? Lissa and I had Emm of course, but we lost our parents when we were young. I want Lucina to grow up with her whole family around her.

speaker: Maribelle
text: You have my word.

speaker: Olivia
text: What about me, my husband?

speaker: Chrom
text: I'd stay with you if I could, Olivia, but we owe Regna Ferox a great debt. I must apprise myself of the facts there before deciding on a course of action.

speaker: Olivia
text: Yes, I suppose so. But I... I was hoping I could go with you. I could dance for our hosts...

speaker: Chrom
text: Olivia, Lucina is still newly born. She needs her mother.

speaker: Olivia
text: Can't she be wet-nursed? You and Lissa turned out just fine without a mother by your side. And Lucina is strong, too! She has the Brand, just like you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Am I not allowed to keep you safe?

speaker: Olivia
text: How can you keep me safe if you leave me here?! *sniff*

speaker: Lissa
text: Aw, look at her! She's heartbroken.

speaker: Chrom
text: All right! All right. Gods... But you must promise to stay out of danger. Lissa and I had Emm of course, but we lost our parents when we were young. I want Lucina to grow up with her whole family around her.

speaker: Olivia
text: I know. I promise.

speaker: Lissa
text: I knew you wouldn't leave Olivia. Not after your whole whirlwind romance... Hee hee... Turn my back one minute and you're married. The next minute? A baby!

speaker: Chrom
text: A lot can happen in two years, Lissa. One day you'll understand.

speaker: Maiden
text: ...Chrom? My husband?

speaker: Chrom
text: I know. I'd stay with you if I could, but we owe Regna Ferox a great debt. I must apprise myself of the facts there before deciding on a course of action.

speaker: Maiden
text: Yes, I suppose you do.

speaker: Chrom
text: You stay here with Lucina. A newborn should be with her mother.

speaker: Maiden
text: But Chrom, I... *sigh* I suppose there is little wisdom in my going. I know nothing of battle. But I will watch over our daughter while you are away. Lucina is a strong child; she takes after her father. The Brand in her left eye was not your only gift to her. Still, you must promise you will stay safe. For her sake...

speaker: Lissa
text: Aww... You two are so sweet to each other. To think, just a couple years ago: strangers. Now: married with a child!

speaker: Chrom
text: A lot can happen in two years, Lissa. One day you'll understand.

speaker: Olivia
text: G-good day, milord.

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, hello, Olivia. What a pleasant surprise.

speaker: Olivia
text: Oh! Is it strange? ...Or untoward? I don't mean to be so! I just thought, since you're always so nice to me, I should…

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm happy you're here. I've always like talking to you. Especially since you've become less... Well, terrified of me than before, heh heh…

speaker: Olivia
text: Heh ha, I know! It is so very strange. I've always been painfully shy around strangers, and even some acquaintances. Even a nod sends me running! But...not with you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Basilio deserves my thanks. Were it not for his introduction, we may never have met.

speaker: Olivia
text: I...I suppose not.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're smiling! ...Heh. It suits you.

speaker: Olivia
text: Really? I'm still so new at it. ...Smiling, I mean. ...At you. Until recently, the very thought of you had me weeping in despair!

speaker: Chrom
text: What? But why?

speaker: Olivia
text: No! Not in a bad way! It's just... Well, you're our leader, and such an important man, and we could never…

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Be together?

speaker: Olivia
text: But it's all right! I've made my peace with it. It's just... I've never felt this way about a man. It's strange. In a good way. ...I think.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're smiling again.

speaker: Olivia
text: So are you! And I never get to see THAT on the battlefield!

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm never this happy on a battlefield. And rarely this happy off it…

speaker: Olivia
text: Milord…

speaker: Chrom
text: Olivia, I'm going to say something, and you're likely going to think me mad. I know that we barely know each other, but I feel something...extraordinary for you.

speaker: Olivia
text: Y-you do?

speaker: Chrom
text: And not just when you dance! I feel it all the time. You're all I think about.

speaker: Olivia
text: Are you saying…

speaker: Chrom
text: I think I love you. And I know that's madness! I KNOW it! But you know what? It doesn't matter. My sister always followed her heart, so now I'm going to follow mine... Olivia, will you marry me?

speaker: Olivia
text: Holy gods! I mean... Yes... Yes, Chrom! Yes, oh yes! I will marry you!

speaker: Chrom
text: I can't promise it will be easy, but I can promise you my heart.

speaker: Olivia
text: Your heart is all I need.

speaker: Chrom
text: I...I can't believe you said yes. I was worried you might run screaming, heh heh. Oh! Wait! I nearly forgot. I have something for you... Here. Take it as a sign of my devotion.

speaker: Olivia
text: Your royal ring? But this must be so precious to you!

speaker: Chrom
text: I've found something more precious... My parents had this ring crafted to celebrate my birth. They wanted my to give it to the woman I would spend my life with. Take it, and know I will stand by you until the day I die.

speaker: Olivia
text: Chrom, this is... It's all too much.

speaker: Chrom
text: This is a love kindled quickly, but it burns bright in me. It is a love that will last. I believe it with all that I am.

speaker: Olivia
text: If this is madness, then lock me up and discard the key! I hope to never draw sane breath again!

speaker: Chrom
text: So be it! We'll be crazy in love, together.

speaker: Frederick
text: I will ride ahead and assemble an escort, milord.

speaker: Chrom
text: Thank you, Frederick.

speaker: Robin
text: I'm quite impressed, Chrom. You make a fine ruler. You've come a long way from tending sheep!

speaker: Chrom
text: Ha! Have I truly changed so much?

speaker: Robin
text: Mmm... In a way, you haven't. But you've grown as a leader, and, of course, as a father.

speaker: Chrom
text: I've tried to do my best. My sister left a weighty legacy. I do all I can just to live up to it.

speaker: Chrom
text: I apologize I could not come sooner, Flavia.

speaker: Flavia
text: What matters is you are here, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: Is it true Valmese warships have set sail? What can you tell us?

speaker: Flavia
text: Not much more than that, I'm afraid. The details remain hazy. Just a moment... Oaf! ...Where are you, you big, bald—Chrom is here!

speaker: Basilio
text: Ah! Well met, boy. I knew you'd come. We have someone you should hear from. I believe you've met? He claims to have insight into Valm's intentions.

speaker: Virion
text: Good day, lords and ladies. How far you all? Allow me the great pleasure, and indeed honor, of introducing myself...

speaker: Chrom
text: We all know who you are, Virion. Although I don't believe we've met your companion?

speaker: Virion
text: Hmph! You know nothing! Prepare for my great unmasking! Long have I posed as archest of archers! Yet that was but a ruse! Yea, an artifice, to disguise myself as a mere above-average man. In truth, I am—

speaker: Cherche
text: *Ahem* May I present Duke Virion. I am his humble servant, Cherche. Greetings, sire. You honor us with your presence.

speaker: Virion
text: Cherche! You stole my moment!

speaker: Chrom
text: A pleasure, Cherche. Perhaps you could speak on your master's behalf?

speaker: Cherche
text: That may speed things along, yes...

speaker: Chrom
text: Then please. Time is of the essence.

speaker: Cherche
text: Very well, then. First, concerning our origins... We hail from Rosanne, a fertile territory on the continent of Valm. Milord is the head of House Virion, and the rightful ruler of Rosanne. A fact he often reminds us of—and loudly.

speaker: Virion
text: Ha! Is she not a true wit? She gets it all from me, you know.

speaker: Chrom
text: So what brings a noble and his charge all the way across the long sea?

speaker: Virion
text: The Valmese. Theirs was an unremarkable nation once. Tiny, almost pitifully so. Had our continent not shared its name, you might almost have forgotten it existed. And so Valm might have remained, if not for Walhart the Conqueror. One by one, he has taken the surrounding realms into his growing empire. I had no choice but to ru... Er, that is, to RECRUIT new allies to aid my people. That's why I've come.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...You fled for your life.

speaker: Cherche
text: More or less, yes. While milord hastily gathered his valuables and guided his people to safety... I alone remained to keep an eye on the Valmese crisis. I was there as Rosanne was swallowed up by Emperor Walhart's overwhelming forces. In the end, I, too, fled here to Regna Ferox seeking asylum.

speaker: Virion
text: To my great relief, I might add! Eligible women are one of Rosanne's most precious natural resources! It would be a shame to waste any, even one who cuts off her lord and ma—

speaker: Cherche
text: *Ahem!* As I was saying...

speaker: Virion
text: Yes, yes, all right, it was only a jape! Please, by all means, you may con—

speaker: Cherche
text: So, begging your pardons, but perhaps it is time to cut this long story short: Walhart has conquered our continent and now seeks to conquer yours.

speaker: Basilio
text: She claims the Valmese fleet will be at our shores in a matter of days. We'll know soon enough if her story proves true.

speaker: Cherche
text: I speak only what I know for true, good people. As does my lord. ...At least, with respect to this matter.

speaker: Virion
text: There's that wit of yours again! Aha! That wonderful...needling, chafing wit.

speaker: Chrom
text: I believe you both. Basilio, we must secure your ports as soon as possible.

speaker: Virion
text: You should know that Valm has the strongest cavalry in the world. You will want to station troops with experience fighting mounted troops.

speaker: Chrom
text: Why, Virion, are you volunteering?

speaker: Tharja
text: So we're to kill or die here, simply because the king demands it? Pfft. What do I care of these Ylisseans? We're given no reasons to fight, only orders. What's the point? Besides, I've always been quite good at choosing who to hate on my own...

speaker: Libra
text: Exalt Emmeryn! No! Gods speed me to her side!

speaker: Campari
text: Where is the damn wyvern brigade?! Hurry! Close off their escape!

speaker: Chrom
text: You there! Who are you? Why do you fight alone?

speaker: Libra
text: Good heavens! You're Prince Chrom, brother to Her Grace the Exalt!

speaker: Chrom
text: You know me?

speaker: Libra
text: Know you? Of course, sire! All Ylissean clergy do. I must thank the gods for uniting us! Oh, dearest and most heavenly fa-

speaker: Chrom
text: With all respect, now is not the time for prayer—it's action that's called for

speaker: Libra
text: Ah, too true! We hurried here to help as soon as word came of the execution.

speaker: Chrom
text: We? Then there are more of you?

speaker: Libra
text: Alas, there were. I lost many brave comrades along the way. In truth, I was starting to doubt the purpose of my struggle... But no longer! Pray, sire, let my axe serve you and your party!

speaker: Chrom
text: Your love for my sister is clear. I would be honored to be joined by such a formidable woman of the cloth.

speaker: Libra
text: ...Man, sire. Man of the cloth.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're a... ...You're not a woman?

speaker: Libra
text: No sire, Women are clerics. I am a priest. Well, technically a war monk, if you care to split hairs...

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh. Yes, well, I'm... I didn't mean to imply... Well, this is rather awkward.

speaker: Libra
text: Oh, it's all right, sire. You realized your mistake quickly enough. It could have been much more awkward. ...... MUCH more...

speaker: Chrom
text: Right! Let's stop there.

speaker: Chrom
text: You there! Are you with the Plegians? You seem reluctant to fight.

speaker: Tharja
text: Death comes to all of us eventually. Why invite it early, fighting for a cause I don't believe in?

speaker: Chrom
text: So... I should take that as a no, or...

speaker: Tharja
text: Let's just say I'm keeping my options open. I mean, long live the king and all, but I'd like to keep living as well. And I have a bit of a rebellious streak, I'm afraid. A...dark side.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then perhaps you would rebel now and fight for our cause?

speaker: Tharja
text: ...You would trust me? What if this all just a ploy to plunge a dagger in your back?

speaker: Chrom
text: My sister, the exalt—I think she would trust you. And I'm trying to learn from her. Besides, I already need to watch my back, whether you're with us or not.

speaker: Tharja
text: Well, that's odd... Ususally when I bring up the backstabbing bit the dicussion is over. All right, then—consider me your new ally. ...For now.

speaker: Libra
text: No... Oh gods... Please finish...what I have started... S-save her...

speaker: Tharja
text: Nngh... Curses! Literally: curses...on you...till the end...

speaker: Campari
text: You'll never save your precious exalt, scum!

speaker: Campari
text: Urgh... Killing me will only... feed Plegia's rage...

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin! Their wyvern riders have fallen! The skies are clear! I'm giving the signal!

speaker: Phila
text: Your grace!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Phila! I'm so glad to see you're safe! But how--

speaker: Phila
text: Khan Basilio's men freed me. Come, we must hurry!

speaker: Gangrel
text: What? Pegasus knights? How did they... That damned Ylissean tactician does NOT play fair!

speaker: Aversa
text: Heh heh heh... Yes, well. Neither do I.

speaker: Robin
text: ...Risen?! Oh gods, no! Chrom! There are Risen everywhere!

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn! Not now!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Bwa ha ha! Oh, did an army of living corpses just APPEAR out of the blue?! Truly, the heavens smile upon mighty King Gangrel this day! Bwa ha ha ha!

speaker: Phila
text: Risen... How... Y-your Grace, I... Forgive me... Uhh...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Phila!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Exeunt one pegasus knight! Bwa ha ha! Watch how they fall, one by one!

speaker: Robin
text: No no no...

speaker: Chrom
text: We've lost...

speaker: Gangrel
text: I believe this is what they call a reversal of fortunes. Now... grovel before me. Plead! Beg for your worthless lives!

speaker: Chrom
text: I'd give up my life before I beg for it from you.

speaker: Gangrel
text: Oh, now THAT is a good line. A fitting epitaph for your tombstone, perhaps? But it's not just your life in the balance. The exalt still stands upon the block. And I have a dozen bows trained on her. All it would take is one word from me...

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm! Hold on, I'm--

speaker: Gangrel
text: ARCHERS! If this Ylissean pup so much as twitches, let fly your arrows!

speaker: Chrom
text: I... I'll kill you!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Go ahead! I welcome it. Just know you were responsible for Big Sister's bloody demise! ...And what of the rest of you? Eh? Who wants the honor of killing the exalt? ...No one? Bah! Your merry band isn't quite so headstrong anymore, is it? Pathetic!

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn you!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Now, now, my boy—no one needs to die today. Not you. Not the exalt. Not your friends. Just lay down your sword and give me the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom! You can't trust him!

speaker: Chrom
text: Of COURSE I can't trust him! I'm not an idiot! But if I say no, he'll kill her! The gods are cruel, damn them! My sister or my duty... A problem with no right answer, yet I must choose!

speaker: Robin
text: I know it's hard to admit, Chrom, but it's the only choice. Compared to the lives of thousands, one person, any one person, is--

speaker: Chrom
text: DON'T! Just... don't say it.

speaker: Gangrel
text: What's this? You'll let your sister and ruler die, all to save some old family trinket? Oh, so delicious! I can't WAIT to hear what your people have to say about it! "THE EXALT IS DEAD! LONG LIVE HER MURDERER!" Your halidom will collapse before you could even begin your rule...

speaker: Chrom
text: We'll see, when the time comes. But first, I'll see you dead.

speaker: Robin
text: That's right. Don't give up! There has to be a way...

speaker: Chrom
text: If there is, I can't see it... Ah, gods!

speaker: Gangrel
text: I will count to three! Throw down your weapons, or your exalt becomes the world's largest quiver. One! Two! Thr--

speaker: Chrom
text: Gangrel, hold! ...You win. Everyone, lay down yo--

speaker: Emmeryn
text: No wait!

speaker: Gangrel
text: SILENCE!

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: King Gangrel, is there no hope you will listen to reason?

speaker: Gangrel
text: You mean listen to more of your sanctimonious babble?! I think not. No, all I want is to hear a THUNK of arrows, and a SPLAT as you hit the ground. Take one, long, last look from your perch. You do so enjoy looking down on people... Then prepare to meet the ground, and your maker! That is, unless if someone were to give me the Emblem... NOW!

speaker: Chrom
text: ALL RIGHT! All right... Emm, I know you won't approve, but this is my final decision. MAYBE someday we'll face a crisis where MAYBE the Emblem would've helped. But I know for a fact that Ylisse needs you, today! The people need their exalt... And we need our sister. If those dark days should come, we'll face them together.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom... Th-Thank you. I know now what I must do...

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm, what are you--

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Plegians! I ask that you hear the truth of my words! War will win you nothing but sadness and pain, both inside your borders and out. Free yourselves from this hatred! From this cycle of pain and vengeance. Do what you must... As I will do. See now that one selfless act has the power to change the world!

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm, no! No!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: No reaction... Was I wrong then?

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom... This is some torch I'm passing you.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Hmph... So be it.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Chrom...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...Lissa...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...And all my people.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Know...

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...that I loved you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Emm...

speaker: Robin
text: Oh gods...

speaker: Chrom
text: DAMN YOU, GANGREL!

speaker: Lissa
text: NOOOOOO!

speaker: Gangrel
text: Bwa ha ha haa! Well now! ...How disgustingly noble. And so lovely a fall! Here I thought death to be an ugly thing. I've never seen one fall so gracefully, in fact. ...And I've seen many fall! Ah... So ends Emmeryn, Ylisse's most exalted! But how can we ensure everyone remembers this beautiful moment of her sacrifice? Perhaps we should gather up her body and put it on display! Bwa ha ha...

speaker: Chrom
text: Gangrel! You die today!

speaker: Basilio
text: No, boy! I secured an escape route! We have to flee!

speaker: Chrom
text: B-But...her body... I have to...

speaker: Basilio
text: You have to RUN! Now do it! Robin! Don't let him do anything stupid!

speaker: Marth
text: No! No... I'm too late... Our bleak future is written once more... And darkness awaits us all.

speaker: Raimi
text: Prince Chrom, please wait here while I summon the khan.

speaker: Chrom
text: Of course.

speaker: Robin
text: The khan is away?

speaker: Chrom
text: Out training, I'd wager. The khans of Ferox prefer battle to politics. Or rather, battle IS their politics.

speaker: Robin
text: A warrior ruler, eh? I can picture him now… A giant of a man of unparalleled thew, his broad chest covered in hair, heheh…

speaker: Flavia
text: Am I now? ...Please, do go on!

speaker: Robin
text: Huh?

speaker: Chrom
text: You're the—?! Er, that is to say... The khan, I presume?

speaker: Flavia
text: One of them, yes—the East-Khan. My name is Flavia. I apologize for the troubles at the border, Prince Chrom. You are welcome in Regna Ferox.

speaker: Chrom
text: Thank you, but I'm confident we can put that misunderstanding behind us. Is it true bandits posing as Ylisseans have been ransacking your border villages?

speaker: Flavia
text: Yes. Those Plegian dogs! We found documents proving as much on the corpse of one of their captains. Plegia must see some benefit in raising tensions between your kingdom and ours.

speaker: Chrom
text: Damn them! I... Forgive me, Your Grace. That was...indelicately put.

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha! Damn them and damn delicacy! Here in Ferox, we appreciate plain speech.

speaker: Chrom
text: In that case, you should have a word with your damn border guards…

speaker: Flavia
text: ...Ha ha! Now that's Feroxi diplomacy! Yes, I like you already. I know why you have come, Prince. But regrettably, I cannot provide any Feroxi troops for Ylisse.

speaker: Lissa
text: What?! Why not?!

speaker: Flavia
text: I lack the authority.

speaker: Chrom
text: Forgive me, but I don't understand. Aren't you the khan?

speaker: Flavia
text: As I said, I am ONE of the khans. In Ferox, the khans of east and west hold a tournament every few years. The victor acquires total sovereignty over both kingdoms. And that means they have the final say when it comes to forging alliances. The West-Khan won the last tournament, you see, and so…

speaker: Chrom
text: So we are to receive no aid at all?

speaker: Flavia
text: Not if you always give up so easily! The next tournament is nigh, you see, and I am in need of champions.

speaker: Chrom
text: What does that have to do with us?

speaker: Flavia
text: The captain of my border guard informs me your Shepherds are quite capable. Perhaps you would consider representing the East in the upcoming tournament? If you win and I become ruling khan, I will grant your alliance.

speaker: Chrom
text: I would have assumed Ylisseans had no place in such Feroxi traditions.

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha! On the contrary. The khans themselves do not fight—they choose champions to represent them. Otherwise our land would be rife with blood feuds and dead khans! We don't involve comrades or kin for the same reason. Over time, it was decided the tournament should be fought by outsiders. Although the outsiders have never included foreign royalty. ...That I know of! Ha! Regardless, it is your choice to make.

speaker: Chrom
text: There is no choice, East-Khan. My people are desperate. We face not only Plegia's constant attacks, but now the added threat of the Risen. If fighting for you is the quickest way to an alliance, then we will take up our steel.

speaker: Flavia
text: Ha ha! Oh, I like you, Prince Chrom. I do hope you survive the tournament! Come, I'll show you the arena where the tournament is held. But be wary! I hear an equally able swordsman champions the West-Khan.

speaker: Chrom
text: He shall be defeated by Ylisse’s necessity.

speaker: Flavia
text: Well spoken again—I look forward to seeing if you're equally skilled with a blade!

speaker: Lissa
text: Chrom! Look!

speaker: Chrom
text: I see him…

speaker: Chrom
text: Marth! One question, before we begin?

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Fine, then. Our swords can speak for us!

speaker: Chrom
text: Where did you get that? There's no way...

speaker: Chrom
text: Tell me—Who taught you to fight like that?

speaker: Marth
text: My father!

speaker: Marth
text: Let us fight with honor. May the best soldier win!

speaker: Marth
text: Impressive...if not surprising...

speaker: Chrom
text: Who is your father?

speaker: Marth
text: I've said enough for one day, sir.

speaker: Chrom
text: Hmph. Is that how it is? Lissa owes you her life, and for that you have my gratitude. But within these walls, I represent the East-Khan and the interests of Ylisse. I can't promise to stay my blade, but I vow not to shame you.

speaker: Marth
text: Heh, never expected such youthful arrogance... We shall see who shames who!

speaker: Flavia
text: Well fought! You have my respect. And, perhaps more to the point, you have your alliance. I will provide Ylisse with the soldiers she needs.

speaker: Chrom
text: Truly? Thank you, East-Khan.

speaker: Flavia
text: I should thank you! It feels like ages since I've held full power. Come, my new friends! Tonight, we celebrate!

speaker: Basilio
text: Bah! Any excuse for a party and Flavia jumps on it…

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm sorry, have we met?

speaker: Basilio
text: I'm the West-Khan you so rudely removed from power! You're handy with a sword, boy. I thought for sure I'd picked the stronger man.

speaker: Chrom
text: What do you know about him?

speaker: Basilio
text: You mean that "Marth"? Bah! He's just some sellsword with delusions of grandeur. All I know is that he turned up one eve and knocked my old champion flat. It was love at first sight, and I'm generally too old for such things! Baha! Anyway, he's gone now. Up and fled the moment the tournament ended.

speaker: Lissa
text: He's so dark and mysterious... *siiigh*

speaker: Robin
text: Sounds like Marth's got at least one fan…

speaker: Lissa
text: Well, I mean, c'mon... He IS sort of dreamy, isn't he?

speaker: Chrom
text: And YOU'RE sort of dreaming!

speaker: Lissa
text: Yowch! Lighten up, Big Brother. I was just kidding.

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord? Milady? If this fascinating discussion is over, we'd best return home. The exalt will want this news of our new alliance immediately.

speaker: Chrom
text: Right as always Frederick.

speaker: Basilio
text: Hold, boy. Before you go, I have a little present for you.

speaker: Basilio
text: This is Lon'qu, my former champion. Not much for talking, mind you, but he's peerless with a sword. As good as Marth, in my mind. To be honest, I can't figure out how Marth bested him so quickly.

speaker: Lissa
text: Marth beat him? But he looks so big and strong…

speaker: Lon'Qu
text: Away, woman!

speaker: Lissa
text: Hey! Wh-what did I say?!

speaker: Basilio
text: Ba ha ha! Let's just say that ladies tend to put Lon'qu on edge. Nonetheless, he is capable. Perhaps he even has the makings of a khan. Consider him West Ferox's contribution to the Ylissean cause.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're certain about this?

speaker: Basilio
text: Yes, yes. He's your man now.

speaker: Chrom
text: And Lon'qu? You have no objections?

speaker: Lon'Qu
text: He gives orders. I stab people. I think our roles are clear.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...All right then. Welcome aboard.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: ...Then Regna Ferox will support Ylisse? Thank you, Chrom. I knew sending you was the right choice.

speaker: Chrom
text: You should see Ferox's warriors! Perhaps now our people will be safe from--

speaker: Phila
text: Your Grace! M-milord! Forgive me, but I bring alarming news!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Phila! Slow down, please! What's happened?

speaker: Phila
text: Plegian soldiers have been sighted inside our southwest border! They attacked a village in Themis and abducted the Duke's daughter.

speaker: Lissa
text: B-but that would be...Maribelle! Chrom, we have to do something!

speaker: Phila
text: There's more: King Gangrel of Plegia claims Lady Maribelle invaded HIS country. He demands we repay reparations for this "insult."

speaker: Chrom
text: And we're to believe a dastard like the Mad King of Plegia?

speaker: Emmeryn
text: Peace, Chrom. We must keep our wits about us.

speaker: Chrom
text: We should put a sword in his gut and be done with it! The Mad King has been trying to provoke war with Ylisse at every step! He won't stop until he drags this whole continent to hell with him!

speaker: Phila
text: I agree with the prince, Your Grace. We must demonstrate to Plegia that such actions have consequences.

speaker: Emmeryn
text: I understand your feelings, Chrom. Truly I do. But if we give him the war he wants, then we lose, no matter what the outcome. Our last conflict nearly ruined the halidom. It left Ylisseans homeless and starving. We cannot repeat that mistake. I will offer parley with King Gangrel.

speaker: Lissa
text: Emm, no! You can't!

speaker: Phila
text: Please reconsider, Your Grace. He cannot be trusted to act in good faith!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: So we either choose to march to war or leave Lady Maribelle to die? No. I will not accept that.

speaker: Phila
text: ...Forgive me, Your Grace. I spoke out of turn. I know you will stand always by your own principles. Pray, allow the pegasus knights to accompany you, though.

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm going, too. ...Someone has to save you from your good intentions.

speaker: Lissa
text: And I want to be there for you AND Maribelle!

speaker: Emmeryn
text: As you wish. Thank you all. Your strength will be mine.

speaker: Chrom
text: Well then! Is everyone ready to go? It's a long march through the western mountains to the Plegian border.

speaker: Ricken
text: Captain! I'm all packed! When do we leave?!

speaker: Chrom
text: Ricken? How did you... Go back inside. You're not old enough for this mission.

speaker: Ricken
text: But, Captain! You know my skill with magic! You know I can handle myself!

speaker: Chrom
text: I'd feel safer with your magic here, protecting the garrison. All right? We're off, then. Be good.

speaker: Ricken
text: Be good? Gods, how old does he think I am? ...Well, I'll show him just how good I can be!

speaker: Basilio
text: Hurry! There should be carriages waiting just through the ravine!

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, please!

speaker: Chrom
text: Rrgh... I'm... I'm coming.

speaker: Basilio
text: Quickly! We're almost... Huh? Damn!  Plegians! I knew it couldn't be that easy... They're right in our way! We must fight!

speaker: Mustafa
text: Ylisseans! I offer you mercy! Surrender to me now and live!

speaker: Basilio
text: Surrender? Sorry, I'm not familiar with the word.

speaker: Mustafa
text: Emmeryn would not have wished for this to come to bloodshed.

speaker: Chrom
text: Don't speak her name!

speaker: Mustafa
text: Your rage is justified, Prince Chrom. But the meaning of your sister's final sacrifice was not lost on me. I suspect many Plegians who heard her final words would say the same. If you lay down your weapons, I vow to protect you as best I can.

speaker: Frederick
text: How can we trust you after what your barbarous king has done? I think we shall take our chances with weapons in hand!

speaker: Mustafa
text: I suspected you would say as much. So be it, Prince Chrom. I shall endeavor to grant you a swift and dignified end.

speaker: Mustafa
text: What are those--thieves I see scattered about? So, they found our battlefield... They comb it for trinkets and spoils, then scurry away like mice. Pah! We shall bring them to justice later. First, the Ylisseans!

speaker: Soldier
text: Forgive me sir, but I...I no longer see the justice in hunting these people down. I accept any punishment you see fit, but after all that's happened...I just can't.

speaker: Wyvern Rider
text: How dare you question the general's orders! You know full well the punishment of insubordination is death!

speaker: Soldier
text: B-but, sir! These people are--

speaker: Mustafa
text: These questions are not ours to ponder, lad. The soldier does not judge. The soldier delivers judgment.

speaker: Soldier
text: Sir, I... I cannot raise my lance against them. Even if... Even if it means death.

speaker: Mustafa
text: ...You were there when Emmeryn spoke, weren't you? So be it! Those of you unwilling to fight are dismissed!

speaker: Soldier
text: But I don't wish to abandon you, sir!

speaker: Mustafa
text: I cannot defy the king, lad. I know him well. He would murder my wife and child to set an example. I will accept the blame for your actions today. Now go!

speaker: Soldier
text: W-wait, General! I see a cause worth fighting for, one I believe in: loyalty to my general.

speaker: Mustafa
text: ...Aye. That's a good lad.

speaker: Mustafa
text: Call in the reinforcements! Draw them close, then strike!

speaker: Mustafa
text: I am General Mustafa of Plegia. If you wish to keep your lives, then you must win them!

speaker: Mustafa
text: Well done, Ylisseans... Hrrggh! Please...spare my men...

speaker: Olivia
text: Khan Basilio!

speaker: Basilio
text: Olivia! I'm sorry we kept you waiting.

speaker: Olivia
text: When I didn't hear from you, I thought... I assumed the worst.

speaker: Basilio
text: Chrom? Robin? Meet Olivia. She'll be smuggling us out of here.

speaker: Olivia
text: Only if you hurry! Doubtless more of the Mad King's men are on their way.

speaker: Basilio
text: Right. Pile in, you lot! And bid farewell to this Plegian hellhole.

speaker: Olivia
text: Ready? Hold on tight!

speaker: Robin
text: All that... For nothing...

speaker: Lissa
text: *Sob* *sniff* Emm... Oh, Emm...

speaker: Frederick
text: I should have died before allowing the exalt to be captured. I have failed as a knight...

speaker: Flavia
text: So what now, oaf?

speaker: Basilio
text: Don't look to me—I'm not in charge!

speaker: Flavia
text: Ugh... I picked a fine time to regain the full throne...

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom, I'm... I'm so sorry. My plan just wasn't enough.

speaker: Chrom
text: You did your best, Robin. ...You have my thanks. It's my own failures that haunt me now. Gods, I was just so powerless!

speaker: Robin
text: It's not your fault either, Chrom.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...She did it for me, Robin. So that I wouldn't have to live with the guilt of either choice, she chose for me. She sacrificed herself rather than give up what could one day save her people...

speaker: Robin
text: Chrom... Listen to me. Look at me.

speaker: Robin
text: I was powerless once, too, remember? And yes, alone, I don't think either one of us is half the person your sister was. But together...maybe we can be something more. If you fall, I'll be there to pull you back up. When you fight for your sister's ideals, I'll be by your side. You don't have to become your sister, you know. You can still be true to yourself. You just have to give people hope in whatever way you can.

speaker: Chrom
text: And what if I can't? What if I'm not worthy of her ideals? Robin, what if I drag you down with me?

speaker: Robin
text: If you aren't worthy, you'll keep at it until you are. And if we both fall down, well, that's what friends are for, isn't it?

speaker: Nowi
text: That's right. I wouldn't be even here if not for you.

speaker: Tharja
text: You gave me your trust and now you have mine. ...For the time being.

speaker: Lon'Qu
text: Were you unworthy, I would have left long ago.

speaker: Virion
text: It took great courage and charisma to unite all of us. ...I knew I possessed such talents, but clearly you do as well!

speaker: Ricken
text: Yeah. We all look up to you! You're like a hero to us.

speaker: Chrom
text: Thank you, everyone. Your words mean more than you could know. My Shepherds... My warriors... There is work to be done. Gangrel must be stopped so that peace can once again reign in Ylisse. Will you help me?

speaker: Lissa
text: You can count me in! I'm tired of crying all the time! It's time to start punchin' stuff!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Hear, hear, darling! Our people have suffered enough.

speaker: Stahl
text: Gladly would I fight and die for House Ylisse!

speaker: Sully
text: Gladly would I fight and KILL those dastards for House Ylisse!

speaker: Libra
text: Our hearts echo yours, sire.

speaker: Sumia
text: I will be the the unbreakable shield by your side!

speaker: Kellam
text: I'm with you, too! You know. Just in case anyone...Hello?

speaker: Vaike
text: Teach is here and class is in session!

speaker: Gregor
text: How much you pay Gregor? Hee hee haw! Gregor make joke! ...Why you look at Gregor like that?

speaker: Panne
text: Your sister earned my respect. The last taguel shall champion her.

speaker: Frederick
text: You have grown strong, milord. I may have set a poor example as a knight... but I swear to you, I shall die before any more exalted blood is spilled!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Thank you all. Truly. You honor me with your fealty. I will not falter again. We shall answer this outrage! The Mad King must be stopped!

speaker: Flavia
text: Right! It's time for ol' Gangrel to get a dose of his own vulnerary! The whole of the Feroxi army is yours to send crashing against him!

speaker: Basilio
text: Har! You young folk—your passions run so hot! If I had any gray hairs, you would've singed 'em right off. In other words, count me in!

speaker: Olivia
text: I'd like to go too, if I may. The exalt did me a kindness once.

speaker: Chrom
text: She did?

speaker: Olivia
text: Y-yes, sire. It would honor me to have a part in giving her justice! Although all I can do is dance... And I'm not so skilled at that, if we're being honest...

speaker: Basilio
text: Har har! She's too modest! Olivia is a Feroxi treasure. You won't meet a finer dancer in all the realms! Her moves inspire soldiers to work twice as hard! You'll do well to bring her along, Commander.

speaker: Chrom
text: Commander? What happened to "boy"?

speaker: Basilio
text: You've earned your way up from that name, I think. Now, where were we? Oh yes! I was just about to start cracking skulls! Flavia will lead me and the other Feroxi in a head-on assault. That should buy you enough time to take down Gangrel. Hear that, boy! You get the fun part!

speaker: Chrom
text: I thought you weren't going to call me--

speaker: Basilio
text: You and Robin have my every confidence. You're a born leader, and he/she has a knack of guiding troops to victory. You both have some growing to do yet, but I can already see you'll grow tall.

speaker: Chrom
text: Thanks, Basilio.

speaker: Basilio
text: All right, enough talk. It's time to raise some hell!

speaker: Chrom
text: Right.

speaker: Basilio
text: Let's get to it, then! Gangrel may try to hit us while we're still licking our wounds.

speaker: Chrom
text: Let him try. This time, I'm ready to dethrone the Mad King, once and for all.
